kTvKPGSzG_FLFpn9pquqqw.text: Great ambiance, the food was lovely, the DRINK SPRECIALS WERE AMAZING, and i love in the fall they have an outdoor fire place.  One of the reasons I love coming back to Charlotte so much.  It's hip, it's fun and the service was great.

25Wn1Pa-XyPZ9_1q2t2oeg.text: I met a group of friends here and decided to give this place a try. I ordered a salad that was very good! It had Bibb lettuce, pears, candied walnuts, blue cheese, with an apple cider vinegar salad dressing! The service was great and this is also a great place to hang out with friends because you can play pool or sit outside. This place has plenty of space!

vGGzT4l1yTvM1C_h0djVOw.text: Went there on Saturday night with reservations at 830 pm during restaurant week. Didn't get sat unit 845pm. Put in order for drinks and upon receiving them put in an order of appetizers. 10-15 minutes later we were told that they didn't have anymore of the short ribs for our appetizer so we ordered something else on the menu as well as our dinner. Shortly after we were then told they didn't have anymore of our dinner entree as well as 2 other items. So we choose the Shepards pie since it was either that fish and chips or a ravioli dish for dinner entrees. Soon after I received my salad but still no appetizers. We didn't receive our appetizers till 945 and then got our dinner entrees at 1015pm. Our pretzel sticks appetizer were frozen in the middle. 2 people had burgers that did not taste like beef. Our Shepards pie looked like a deconstructed upside down smaller portion of a Shepards pie. The only good thing I can say about this place was the view of the city and the manager was nice. After all that we didn't finish our meals. My wife also had her IPhone 6 stolen from there as well. Would not go back again because it looks like there are plenty of other places to go.

pjtVCLNIvWAe76gvKXnLPg.text: Had Sunday brunch with my family.  Great selection.....better than on-line menu. $4 mimosas special!!!  Will recommentpd to friends and definitely dine again.

mjjdwByqdw9d-zmz1PpB9g.text: This place is good for grabbing a beer and maybe a late night snack... but we made the mistake of coming here for and early lunch on a Sunday.   Five of us ordered omelets (mine had spinach and mushrooms). Worst omelets ever... Food delivered in 30 min, so all omelets were cold and rubbery. Also siphoned about 4 tablespoons of oil off of mine. Waitress was apologetic, but was very slow and did nothing. Eggs are not much of a culinary challenge... so not sure what was going on.   Suggestion: Stick to the beer at the PR. Central Ave. has too many other great places to eat where they care about the quality of their food.

9Vqa1DUiHGSikSl6jWmtFg.text: I am from out town and stumble into this fantastic restaurant for a quick lunch. My server, Shaun, was great. He knew the menu and made several suggestions but I ended with salad to start off. The sherry vinaigrette dressing was made from scratch and was awesome. I chose the fantastic  Fish and Chips. Huge portion and I had to take half of it home. Shaun presented me a desert menu but nothing was to my liking. I had asked my server if I might find something lighter for desert that was nearby and he took the time to consult with his coworkers. He came back and suggested a place right around the block. I really appreciated him going the extra effort even-though it took away from his sales. Would defiantly recommend this place and be sure to ask for Shaun.

PyJw_jQkSiwZ1DNEfY9qVw.text: This place has grown on me.  Delicious Fish and Chips, awesome drink specials, and their Waldorf salad is fantastic.  Service can still be  bit iffy, but overall, I have enjoyed my time spent here.  Worth a try for sure.

TxJee43_6EuXOziA82kMbg.text: I went to brunch this morning at Peculiar Rabbit and was very disappointed. The service was mediocre at best and despite not being very busy the waiter was especially slow. I ordered the chicken and waffles and for $16.00 was disappointed at the quality. While the chicken was good and the portion was large, the waffle was nearly burnt and quite hard. With all of the lovely brunch options in the area I would not return.

Y_zJdMwkSBNN_hut9Q7ERw.text: Great rooftop view of QC, awesome menu, great game room. Friendly bartenders and knowledgable staff! Great place for first date!

PwJxG72Dwmf0WRTlcq2VMw.text: Food, drink, and ambiance were all great! Will definitely be returning! Delicious and interesting menu, not the usual you expect at most restaurants today. Ask for waitress Chelsea, she's really great and knows her stuff!!

1qcju5S3_JLkPU7kEsqtXQ.text: Peculiar Rabbit...Not Peculiar at all...More like Incredible Rabbit!  My first experience with this establishment and wow I was blown over. Walked in and it is a very interesting looking building, there is a roof top seating area also but it was 36 degrees here last night and not the time to sit outside. Our waiter approached us right away and informed us that wine by the bottle under 60.00 was half price and to our surprise they had Klinker Brick Petite Syrah! 13 bucks, half price that is a great deal! We looked over the menu and decided that we would have all appetizers. They all sounded so good we had a hard time deciding.  Our first order was for Devils on Horseback, normally it s Bacon wrapped dates but this was  Figs wrapped with Bacon and stuffed with Goat Cheese..(Is your mouth watering yet) served with a side of Arugula salad with tiny beets chopped up on it ...Wonderful! Our Next appetizer was the Duck Duck Mousse. A gorgeous plate with a Duck Mousse served in a little cup with sliced apple and two kinds of pickles, a Duck Confit salad with a pear Marmalade and sexy little pieces of Brioche buttered and sliced for you to spread the lusciousness on...It was really really good! (I think my favorite of all) Our third app was the Asparagus and Egg, It was really good smoked Asparagus with a poached egg over Pepperonota sweet peppers. And our last tidbit was the Lamb Lollipops, two very meaty ground lamb lollipops over a bed of hummus. The Lamb was incredible, grilled and  succulent. It was served with plain flatbread. The hummus was not so great but the lamb made up for it. Like I said..Peculiar , no, Incredible yes..I will be going back soon!

_jTnOYdIzix9AQS3JyLCYw.text: Great place. Great food. Roof top dining  is awesome. I had Sheppards pie and the chef special of Ahi Tuna. Out of this world.

yI6RLstM5-uKzSnwPaNySg.text: Horrible service, decent food -outrageously overpriced for something slapped onto a plate, the view is great, but the management and lack of detail really just drag this place into the dumps. Will only be coming back if friends are visiting town and we need somewhere to grab a quick beer and hopefully not stay too long.

pj7fKDDVePHx29cTcmfXug.text: We went here on a Friday night. Did not have to wait to be seated. We sat outside on the top floor. Great environment. Server was great. Had three appetizers. The absolute must is the devils on horseback. They are bacon wrapped figs. Good view, great staff, amazing food. Don't know where the bad reviews are coming from.

aXN0kRzUKhySw15KxQi8qg.text: We had our office happy hour here, and working with Nichole and Shannon to plan a fabulous event for our staff couldn't have been better.  All the staff that I worked with throughout the whole thing were absolutely great, and it really was the whole package: food was delicious, drinks were stellar, and the rooftop ambience on a sunny spring evening was hard to beat anywhere in the city.  One exceptionally great thing to note: I have a gluten allergy, and they were able to tailor my food choices without issue.  We so enjoyed our time at the Peculiar Rabbit, and hope to be back very soon!

K_sVbUcltqJRmQ3m-wFBxQ.text: Had dinner before performance of Wicked.  We were really pleased. The PEI mussels were outstanding, the oyster PO boy was very good, and the ribs were very tender. And to top it off, the service was good, and the place is very cool and updated.

A_xGNlDb_BeEKJOojQoQVw.text: I will start with the only positive.  The view from the rooftop deck was amazing.   OK Now the ordeal:   We were there to celebrate a birthday party, so there was 12 of us.  Not an extremely large party, right.  OMG we ordered around 1:30pm  BY 2:55pm  OUR FOOD WAS NOT SERVED!   Our waiter kept informing us that the restaurant was "slammed" That is odd and not True because when I went to use the ladies room which is located on the 2nd floor, there was very few patrons eating there. Hmm perhaps those few patrons ate all the food in the restaurant??  OH AND SPEAKING of the ladies room, the sink was over flowing.    Meanwhile, when we were nearing an hour of waiting, and watching patrons that arrived AFTER us get their food, one would think that a manager would climb to the roof terrace and offer an apolgy, the truth or (just call me crazy) a discount.  To add INSULT TO INJURY, when we were at the 90 min wait point,  our waiter told us that he would bring some hashbrowns for us to share.   He returns only to inform us that they ran out of hashbrowns and biscuits.  HUH??? I ordered a biscuit for brunch.  I got up and left.    DO NOT GO THERE WITH A PARTY GREATER THAN 2.

U1lpJBC5RXHJ3Y8BJRaeiA.text: Went there for a friends birthday. Our waitress didn't understand that we wanted split checks and that everyone was sharing the birthday girls portion. Took like 30 minutes for us to get our tabs. The mussels were delish. Would highly recommend. Lobster Mac n cheese was disappointing. Would not recommend. Very disappointing. We went the for the amazing view but it rained so we had to sit inside and it's very noisy and difficult to converse.  I think had the weather been better this place would be great for after work drinks.

DmwOet8yx9oFTyBfnVrNIQ.text: This is me and my husband's first time here. I tried the TRIPLE THREAT MEATLOAF!! It was so good! I loved it! My husband had the Rabbit CHEESESTEAK!!! He loved it! Great atmosphere and bar server Elizabeth was super cool and gave some really good suggestions!! We will be coming back! CHARLOTTE IS SO AWESOME!!

yglavm4DNP2g_JzywbztSQ.text: The name and concept of the Peculiar Rabbit were enough to draw my attention, and when I found an online coupon for the place I was sold. The idea of getting some good food at a bar-like environment was intriguing, and we headed out Saturday night.  Finding the place is no problem, as it's the big three-story bar located across from the Family Dollar parking lot. Parking itself is a different story, and something that confused the heck out of us. We went at 6:30 (made reservations) and by that time there was no parking anywhere on the street or the lot located near Sherwin Williams. After circling a few times trying to find an actual spot to park in we caved in and parked in the Family Dollar lot, which requires you to give the attendant $5.  Once we were finally parked we walked into the place and I was charmed at first. It has a very nice interior that is ascetically pleasing and looAhhks pretty roomy at first glance. We were sat upstairs on the second floor, and upon sitting down and relaxing I realized that the overall noise of the surroundings was too much for me. Our table was right in front of the bar, so as the meal wore on and the seats at the bar filled up, people began having their drinks and conversations while standing...which happened to be right next to us! It wasn't long before I couldn't hear a word the missus was saying, despite being right next to her. I guess part of me expected a somewhat quieter setting for a "gastro pub", but once the drunken young women and disturbingly older men began chatting in arrangement of free drinks, I realized this was nothing more than a bar with a fancy food menu.  Ahh, the food...one of the redeeming qualities of the Peculiar Rabbit. First off, the beer is excellent. They have a nice selection and it is available in 10oz or 20oz glasses. My initial reaction was "what, no 16oz?!" but I found that 10oz was a suitable price... especially when I got a draft of Beckenridge Vanilla Porter for only $3.50! When we go out for dinner we have a beer or wine to go with our meal, not to get drunk on. Thus 10oz was perfect for us.  For dinner I ordered the Shepards Pie ($14) and it was done very, VERY well. I've had Shepards Pie at Irish places and found it under-seasoned and bland, but this dish was nothing short of tastetacular! They start with a heaping portion of ground lamb, which is not overcooked and tough but tender and juicy and greasy...just perfect. Peas and carrots are mixed in with it and this wonderful mound of meat and veggies is plopped onto a bed of mashed rutabaga, rather than the potatoes you would traditionally get. The rutabaga was actually better than potato and was much lighter, so I didn't get the heavy feeling in my stomach I would get after eating some mashed taters. Then they top the entire dish off with a thick layer of cheddar cheese that is simply divine. It was the only part of the meal I had to cut with a knife because it was so thick and chewy, and so, so good. The Shepards Pie is a great meal, and definitely worth the price of admission.  The missus ordered the Cioppino ($17), which is pretty much a spicy fishermen's stew. It consisted of scallops, whitefish and mussels drowned in this tomato stew that was heavenly. The seafood was all of good quality and cooked well, but the star of the dish was definitely the stew itself. It had a nice spicy kick to it and also retained an overall seafood taste. I ended up dipping my bread into the stew, which is something I rarely do. There is one problem with the dish though. The menu says it comes with shrimp as well, though the missus didn't get any shrimp on her plate. Also, even if there had been shrimp, the meal has little substance to it. It's just a plate of seafood. Granted, it's tasty seafood, but I think it needed some kind of starch or side to go with it, like pasta, couscous or risotto...something to make it a complete meal. No one can make a full dinner out of a few mussels, scallops, shrimp  (if you happen to get it) and some whitefish chunks.  All in all, the Peculiar Rabbit does serve really tasty food. My biggest concern is the ambiance, as I would only go back for an actual meal, and want to go somewhere that is less...bar-ish. The outside seating seemed to be a bit more our speed, and if we came back (which I would not be against since the food was good) we would wait the 30-60 minutes for an outdoor seat that might prove to be more comfortable and a little less noisy.

WqgBQ2M9fq8H8ktdyBdpVg.text: Ummm...Ehhh....Meh...Blah.   To be fair, I had friends in town so I was able to visit twice before deciding that this place as cool as it may "appear to be" is not my cup of tea. In fact, the second visit was worse than the first....good thing there was beer involved.   My first visit I went with a pretty decent size group, we just went to have a few drinks and share some appetizers. There was no greeting, just stares....not even glances but  it looked like we inconvenienced them as soon as we arrived. Not a great way to start, we eventually make our way to a few tables upstairs and get some drinks...order some apps the crab cakes, fries and some wings. The food was fine (well the wings were pretty damn good) but after the crappy service we had it didn't make it worth it. Ugh.   The next visit (one day later) was equally bad...again we sat upstairs, the waitress never came over we had to go get her, she told us more of what we couldn't have than what we could...she rushed through everything....was slow to refill our beer and overall it was just very weird and uncomfortable.   One time, perhaps was a fluke...but twice....makes it the norm and I'll be glad to visit other places in the future.

x0uiZc2g6qoUPMxStjlFiA.text: This was our second visit. The chicken poutine was delicious. The piri piri chicken wings were bland, very bland, but the rooftop views made up for it. We'll be back.

e2YooD-qCG4CBi6snTf-dw.text: Hi,   Needed to let someone know about our dinner this past Saturday night. Really disappointing!! The first courses were amazing and then it took about 25 min to get out entrees. The schnitzel was so sweet and the potatoes were extremely dry. Then we waited 30 min to get our dessert to go because it was so loud and the service was pretty bad. The manager came by and asked how things were, as we started to say why we weren't happy she just said great and walked away without listening. She just didn't care about our satisfaction at all or any concerns that the customers were not having a good experience. It was so loud the waitress kept apologizing about it. The place was very empty when we arrived so we were not sure where all the inconsiderate atmosphere came from. Really disappointing!

OjB56Lb3Qj91DwpLe3EJ9A.text: Look this place is great but they have got to get their ^*'% together. I'm here for a Sunday brunch and half the restaurant is empty but they're on a 45 min wait and it's an hour for food. Also, this is not just today, it's a consistent issue. Please figure this out. It's going to lose you customers.

8tP1kjYVoTQkk5jFcrNAJw.text: I've only ever come here for drinks and the amazing view they have of the CLT skyline, until today. I ordered the only burger listed on their brunch menu. Priced at $15 - I figured it would be the real deal.  As soon as my burger came out I knew I made a mistake. Pre made frozen burger patty with a bunch of crap thrown on top, with a terrible bun. I would have been more satisfied with paying $15 for a Wendy's combo meal....hell even a McDonald's Big Mac.   My gf was also very disappointed with her meal. I probably won't come back until a new restaurant takes over this building. If I miss their view of the skyline in the meantime, I'll just scroll through my Instagram feed.

-BrE04MxW-gQh308mpFgwQ.text: Had a father's day brunch at Peculiar Rabbit.  I really enjoy this place and don't get over that way enough.  They had a special, which was a filet over eggs, and potatoes.  I'm not really into that, and usually stick with bacon and eggs, but I saw someone else get it and it looked good.  I figured I'd go outside my box.  It was really good.  The steak was cooked slightly rarer then I usually get it but it was delicious.  I really enjoyed it.  My wife got a bacon and egg sandwich, and instead of bread, they used cheese waffles.  That was really good also.  We sat outside and it was beautiful.  Our waitress was awesome.  Overall great experience.

yhTL0C7mxyGRN3TKMfop0w.text: Very "meh" experience here. We sat at the bar & I will saw the view is one of the best around. But that's where the highlights about end. Service was some of the most disappointing I have had. The level of attention was fine, but these servers were unbelievably unprofessional. Seemed way more concerned with socializing with one another than doing their jobs! I was honestly shocked by the type and tone of conversations they were having with each other blatantly in front of customers. Would not return here for anything other than just drinks... attitude of the servers was a major turn off!

3TkETWVbzk83NnV_TJjPkQ.text: No.  Don't do it.   Slow service. View of CLT not worth it. Food was yuck. Except maybe the cheese biscuit. And the special $5 mimosa? Lordy, how much do you usually charge for a tiny drink?  No.

zt_9ObhKQRQARQ7JP_8IXw.text: Overall bad experience with really bad food. That said, upstairs bar has a pretty view of the city.

wfzP08SQi0cVwqmFs_fvgg.text: Great place! Love the view from the roof patio-best view in Charlotte. Good food, kid-friendly without being kid-oriented. My 10-year-old gives the Classic Burger 2-thumbs-up!

QYkQISyqV1wEL_1gl67xJA.text: Horrible service!!! Great food!!! Great views!!! I really wanted to give this restaurant a chance again. We love the views on the rooftop and the food is delicious. I made reservations for a group of 9 for brucnh. The process was easy and we were seated immediately at 1pm on a busy Sunday. We opted to not get the Buffett, but it looked wonderful. The reason for such a bad rating is the service. There were 3 servers on the rooftop(which was not full) and it took us 30 minutes to get drinks and order our food. Our food finally came and looked wonderful. We did not receive silverware. We promptly asked the waitress who seemed to run away every time we tried to ask for her. We had to ask for silverware twice and tried to get some from another server who ignored us. Finally 15 minutes later we were able to eat our cold food with silverware. The food was excellent, but would've been even better hot. I don't think they should offer ordered food on the rooftop because the food and drinks have to be run up and down the stairs. The process obviously doesn't work seeing the other reviews seem to say the same thing. Unfortunately, I think this will be our last trip.

4BFbLI0Z3fAflGNJdlsouQ.text: Really cool location but the service was sub par at best. The lady serving us seemed put out that we came in at all. Seemed pissed when we chose the patio. My glass had a ring of lipstick around the entire edge. I was not wearing lipstick that day. When I went in to let her know, she offered to pour the wine into another glass. Gross. She ended up getting me a new glass with new wine but, come on. I definitely want to give this place another shot because I would love to try the food and the rooftop but let's hope they hire friendlier people.

dSkwduiwkLFysBJCBX_ozQ.text: Brunch today. Uninspired. Unsatisfactory. Was there early enough that there was no issue with too many people to serve or any other reason why food preparation would have been so weak.  One of us ordered a delicious "sounding" pancake dish of orange ricotta pancakes with pistachio and fig compote. Unfortunately what was served (for $11) were three thin pancakes with perhaps a single pistachio and a hint of fig. Server must have known since she offered to bring syrup.  My order was chicken and waffles with eggs and breakfast potatoes ($14). This dish had possibilities but chicken and eggs (overcooked despite my request) were warm while potatoes and waffles lukewarm at best.  Suppose I could have sent this back but no one came by so it was easier to just deal with what I had. The chicken was decent but overly salty. The potatoes seemed like they could have been cooked a day prior and were lifeless and could have been from a freezer bag and reheated in oven.  Mentioned all this to server who hardly listened but said she would inform the kitchen.  Guess I should have paid more attention to the yelp rating of 3.  We had been to this restaurant twice before and recall a wonderful meal the first time several years ago. Sorry to say though there is no intention to ever return.

cKo6UyOKIdJytHXRVUZvmQ.text: The only great thing this place has going for it is the view of the Charlotte skyline.  I've really tried to like this place, but each time I come I'm reminded why I don't. The food is mediocre, at best, for the price you pay. A slab of romaine lettuce with 4 strips of grilled chicken on top hardly constitutes the price of $12. There are so many better places to go in Plaza Midwood...

BDFt7I6cn82cWsaZGXXO-A.text: Took 20 min to get someone to visit out table.  Another 20 to get our drinks.  Apps came out with meal and the meal wasn't that good.  So incredibly over priced.

kq7RtAS3YEYSlVvMeJslFQ.text: Like the recent patio reservations, the tropical theme is a little weird for a place thats supposed to be a pub, but the rooftop view is nice. Now let's get to the 1 star. The music on the weekends at night. It doesn't make for a great atmosphere, the management seems completely out of touch with what people want.   The second floor has music blasting, most often for an empty bar, and if you want to grab a beer with some friends and just chill (like one does at a pub) it makes it impossible.   The rooftop is the place to be only because of the view, the DJ isn't very good and you often see what looks like the bar management really getting into it behind the DJ while most people don't share the same enthusiasm.   I used to like this place but I try to avoid it these days. Plaza needs a good all around bar to go to, a place like Gin Mil in Southend where you can dance inside if you want to, chill with some friends either inside or go on the roof. What used to be a great go to rooftop bar has quickly become a place to avoid, try again later and regret.

hU7oj_K6nVzP5z0hnONMOw.text: If you want a cool, retro, awesome place to dine, with amazing food, this is your place. Ask for JT! He's the best bartender and waiter. Peculiar Rabbit is one of the best places for brunch and dinner in the Charlotte area!! Not to mention, the best view of the city!

_Ct9D5CbxXmy8-7gw4TJRA.text: Had brunch today at Peculiar Rabbit. A few observations  1.) Awesome space, really great roof deck, friendly servers 2.) bottomless mimosas for $25 is steep. It financially makes sense based on the size of the normal $5 ones, but there are nicer places in CLT that are less than $20.  3.) we asked about vegan options and were told the flatbread without the quail egg on top would work. Right as it came out to our table, our server came up to tell us that the naan they use has eggs in it. So we asked about another dish (I forget the name, but a potato, Brussel sprout, kale dish) being made, again without the eggs on top. They came out about 15 mins after the rest of our party started eating. Overall the food was good (albeit a bit salty), but now a few hours later my stomach is killing me. I am guessing there was butter or some other animal product used because potatoes and veggies alone shouldn't cause this type of reaction. 3.) despite being misinformed about vegan options then needing to wait well after the rest of our table ate, nothing was comped or discounted.  Overall I actually would return and give them another shot (probably just for drinks), but I will say that it is 2018 and not having a single vegan item on your menu is really shortsighted.

eGDvTV9juj8zg7Gp40-cXw.text: Beware - The menu posted here is not the menu currently offered and they don't offer the Specialty Drinks anymore. Super disappointed by that. My burger was good and our waiter Andrew was outstanding.

fXRp28aqft4dwUPO_uyYMQ.text: I'm not a fan of the brunch menu change! This place is slowly going downhill from the menu change to the overall atmosphere. At this point the only thing this place has going for them in the amazing view of the the city.

JY6EUPmVq5JE45ghhjcyyA.text: The food and drinks were great. However the manager that worked during brunch on 1/8/17 was aweful! I ordered a meal, the NOLA Benedict, but the bartender-in-training put in the incorrect order (the regular eggs Benedict). I got my meal and began eating because I was hungry. However, after eating a few bites my girlfriend and I quickly realized that we had not received the correct entree. We asked the bartender if it was indeed the NOLA Benedict, to which she replied she "didn't know there was more than one Benedict on the menu." She put in the new order for the NOLA and everything was great until we received the check. The bartender told us that the manager said that because we ate some of the meal then we had to pay full price. It was not our fault that we got the wrong meal and this having been my first time at the Peculiar Rabbit I did not immediately realize we received the wrong meal. I pulled the manager aside to confirm that we were to pay full price for a meal we didn't order in the first place and he simply said "yes." I told him that was f**ked up customer service and he replied with "O.K." I gave him the remainder on the original meal to throw away because I didn't want it in the first place. I've worked in the service industry for years and I've never seen a manger let a customer leave upset without doing anything to remedy the situation! He didn't even have the manhood to tell me himself that he was making me pay full price, he let the bartender-in-training do it! He was just aweful!

fAXtDi3sB0Q4DXbHqaJtDw.text: I just keep having inconsistent experiences at PR. Tonight I had a nice glass of wine at the bar and waited for my take out and waited and waited and it was a slow night. Very few people were there so why did it take so long. The bartender was fine. The kitchen must have taken a break or something.

5r278Zy27K5uhCmX1s2Nrw.text: I had told myself I was going to wait, but last week as we were walking towards Soul for a late dinner we changed course and decided to try the Peculiar Rabbit. I'm happy we did, but I'm also looking forward to the changes they make after completing their "soft"opening (which we thought was over then, but most likely is by now).  We walked in and asked if we could sit up top, they told us there just happened to be one table left (yay). I'm guessing, as others have mentioned, that they've been cutting back on full seatings while they work out the kinks because there were multiple tables open on the roof. But the view is really nice.  Our server was great, but after telling us they were still in opening stages I was surprised he was handing out three menus to both of us. I was completely overwhelmed, and since this was a last minute decision I didn't have the recommended flashlight packed - so we read by cellphone light. The first oversized menu is beer on the front, restaurant menu on the back, the second is solely wine, and then a smaller manageable card was the bar menu. Having a separate drink menu isn't abnormal, but not everyone at the table needs one, especially when you're already trying to work with a larger sized menu in the dark. It would have been hard enough to take it all in with proper lighting, so after I found what sounded good I just had to stop squinting and hope for the best.   We started with the PBR mussels, and they are amazing. I wish I would have ordered two bowls of them. A few weren't completely purged (not exactly pleasant, but it happens, I understand) but the flavor was fantastic. And the bread they serve with it is tasty as well.  My banh mi, oh my poor banh mi. Apparently a member of the kitchen staff is of Vietnamese descent so for a moment I thought that I was in the wrong with only Americanized versions in my head - but there is no way this sandwich could have been right. Since I don't have night vision, I can really just describe how it felt - like a soft meatloafish portion of (nice flavored) meat on a barely toasted hoagie roll. Mush on mush. There were a few pops with the occasional veggie, but the mayo-like spread on the bread smelled heavily of cloves or anise or something I couldn't exactly put my finger on, but it was potent. Needless to say I left over half the sandwich on my plate. At least it was accompanied by a sprinkling of fries.   The ribs were not a hit either, but as my dining partners stated - bad ribs are still ribs - as he cleaned his plate. It was on what tasted like a sweet corn puree, which I liked, but that's as much as I tried.  Our server was very friendly and attentive, unfortunately all of the games in the game room on the second floor were broken that night so our plans to take our drinks downstairs for a round of video bowling were put on hold. I'll definitely try the Rabbit again, and I'm hoping they'll 1) add some lighting up top 2) fix the games 3) trim down the menu.  As far as the pricing - one appetizer, two entrees, one beer (bottled, on the larger side), and one glass of wine - $50. Not exactly breaking the bank, but next time I'd like to want to finish my food.

IvAQzwvVH85aIglr6Sn5Tw.text: I was in the Plaza Midwood area looking at houses with a friend when we drove by The Peculiar Rabbit. I remembered reading a feature on the restaurant in Charlotte Magazine and have been wanting to try it since reading the article. So, I dragged my friend to lunch so we could try this new addition to the neighborhood.  We went on a Saturday and found out they do brunch on both Saturday and Sunday. I never argue with brunch. I decided to try the apple jacks and my friend ordered the FGT BLT. I also ordered a side of the Benton bacon per the waitress' recommendation to have with the apple jacks. It took all I had not to eat everything on my plate! The portions are large and the flavors are amazing. I would have been fine if they had given me double the amount of goat cheese and lingonberry preserves on my apple jacks, but then I guess there wouldn't be as much for everyone else. The hash browns are incredibly crispy and very difficult to stop eating. By far some of the best I have ever had. I was also able to try the FGT BLT (FGT = fried green tomato) and what a great take on a BLT. The bread was perfect for the sandwich and perfectly grilled.   As soon as we finished all I could say was "when are we coming back?"

AZ14wh9VtS0d0R-03k1n2g.text: Sat at the outside patio with our dog. Very dog friendly and nice outdoor spot for food and drinks. However, service was quite slow and the new menu felt like it was trying to hard. We ordered a burger and salad and left hungry. Portions too small, prices too high.

W9IxxeeLU1jg1-4qCPXP2g.text: This place has gone so downhill. Came for brunch recently and the food was comically bad. It used to be really good, not sure what happened. We also waited about an hour and everyone's food came at different times. No acknowledgment of this from our waiter. Classy! Hoping something else comes in and takes this space over because the rooftop is key in the summer!

-tp6xIXAIe0eXH8s2QSnBg.text: Good brunch spot. $4 mimosas and solid food.   Rachel was our server and Tim was our bartender - did a great job. I'll be back

ZvErNXGp3gUxjH7JzdzS1A.text: I was really pumped about trying this place... it had all the elements I was hoping for in a new CLT restaurant, but unfortunately it didn't live up.  I will re-rate after one more try if my experience changes, but sorry to say this was just average.  First, the positives - cool atmosphere, good energy, liked the music, beer list was good, wine list was just OK (some improvements could be made here).  Now, the negatives - out of 2 apps and 2 entrees, only one was above average (pork belly entree), 2 were average at best and 1 (the bahn mi) was inedible... it was so bad we had to push it aside otherwise we were getting a bit sick from it - not exaggerating.  We ultimately had them take it away.  It was like a rubber sock covered in fish sauce and slapped on a hoagie.    So that's it... just average for food.  Maybe a cool spot to just go drink beers and I might try the food again.  If so, I'll update the review.  For now, don't get your hopes up that this will change the CLT dining scene.

DNJjXJCLnuXa3RT1X-_7eQ.text: $8 for four fried Oreos is a bit ridiculous, and the service was somewhat slow at 7:30 on a sparsely crowded Sunday night but our waitress was very nice, pointed me to Tap Hunter for the current draft list and the host offered to take our sunset picture.

iGw82AMURVGeyBkFRVgZNg.text: We went in on Sunday after a game of flag football hoping to see some NFL games, drink some beer and eat some good food.  The beer is over priced for the neighborhood (this is, after all the neighborhood of the Diamond and Common Market).  The food looked good, but the descriptions on the menu made it unappealing to everyone in our party (and $8 for a side of french fries is ridiculous).  There were a couple of TVs, but this is not a sports bar or even a place to go "watch the game".    The service was substandard.  The roof has a GREAT view (but no bar).  The decor is fun, but very ... unoriginal.  There are a couple of bumper tables on the second floor ... but I don't think it's nearly as game-centric as it's sister bar -- Jackalopes.  I'll come back again in a couple months after they've gotten their feet wet, but my first impression is that they have already lost their identity in an eclectic neighborhood dominated by bars with vision (Soul, Snug Harbor, Whiskey Warehouse, Thomas St, CM).

e2--dRItFe5mPFNFKyuV0Q.text: We had to pick up my son from the Amtrak station this afternoon and decided to take a detour and try one of the restaurants in Plaza Midwood.  After driving around for a few minutes my daughter chose The Peculiar Rabbit because she liked the name and the building looked kinda cool with its different levels.  There were only a few people dining on the patio on this gorgeous day. (I had wanted to try Zada Janes because the patio was full of hungry diners, evidence in my opinion of a place with good food.  Shoulda.)   We were seated upstairs right away and had a decent view of the Charlotte skyline.  Our server was great; prompt and attentive to our drinks.  We ordered the hummus appetizer and it took only a few minutes to arrive.  There was a generous portion of the tasty hummus and  crispy thin slices of baguette.  I inquired about the size of the salads and the server told me they were on the small side, which was not a problem. My daughter and I ordered the watermelon salad with chicken and my husband ordered the house salad with chicken.  He played it safe and was smart.    The description said there was watermelon and pickled watermelon rind, so I was expecting some nice juicy sweet watermelon chunks in addition to the pickled rind.  It also listed puffed quinoa;I didn't really know what "puffed" quinoa was, but I figured what the heck, quinoa is good so I'll try it.  The dressing was a cucumber watermelon vinaigrette.  When it arrived, it looked pretty good, a little larger than I expected, but I was a little skeptical of the brown gritty crumbles on top.  The first taste of the watermelon was shocking because I wasnt expecting both it AND the rind to be pickled.  Furthermore, there were tiny little chopped pickled onions throughout.  I thought ok, I can skip the watermelon, since there weren't that many chunks, but OMG the puffed quinoa was akin to chewing crushed gravel!  I'm not sure what it's purpose was other than grind down my molars.  It pretty much ruined the rest of the salad because it was stuck to every leaf of arugula.  The only saving grace was the chicken and the dressing.  Since the menu wasn't that big, I doubt I will ever go back to see if I liked anything else.

8w73AhjINpAlkBbyaxy0gw.text: I had high expectations for my visit to the Peculiar Rabbit.  I had found the restaurant on the renown National Eater heat map and after checking out the restaurants website and menu, I was very excited. The menu was a bit of a hodgepodge with everything from Shepherds Pie to BBQ Sliders to Chicken n Waffles, but there were several things that caught my attention. In addition, the view of downtown Charlotte from the rooftop looked amazing. Unfortunately, this was one of the most disappointing dining experiences I have had in a long time.   Atmosphere- 1/1 The view from the rooftop is amazing. It's one of the best views from a restaurant in Charlotte. Unfortunately it began to rain and we would be forced inside.  Inside still has a good feel to it, but we were clearly disappointed in the change.   Food- 0.5/2 *No matter what, this is where a restaurant needs to earn its keep and the Peculiar Rabbit fell way short of expectations. I had looked up the menu prior to coming and knew exactly what I wanted. However, the waitress informed us that the menu had changed and everything I wanted was no longer offered. The waitress recommended a few popular items, but had failed to try most of the menu. We ended up getting a burger and tacos. The burgers were said to be big 1/2 lb burgers with lots of flavor, it turned out out to be ok and small. There was no way it was 1/2 lb. The tacos were pretty good but they came with a side of bland rice and a black bean paste on top that looked completely unappetizing. The food was ok, but I was expecting much better.  I left still very hungry.   Price- 0/1 *Our meal was grossly overpriced. $12 tiny, bland burger? $15 for 3 small tacos and a terribly looking side? No thanks. I hate spending $30 for food I don't like and doesn't fill me up..    Service- 0/1 *Listen, I'm not one to be overly critical of the service I receive. I just want a quality meal and somewhat attentive service. This was one of the worst service experiences I've had in quite some time. Here was our experience: -Waitress was friendly but not knowledgeable of the menu.  -As mentioned earlier, the menu had drastically changed and was not reflected online. When I asked about a menu time that was no longer listed, the waitress informed me that they were no longer serving that. Often, I've experienced that the waiter/waitress will go make a special request to the kitchen, but not here. Wasn't a big deal, but a little disappointing.  -As the rain came, we noticed ever other server came immediately to the assistance of their patrons. Our waitress didn't show up for 5 minutes. We were hesitant to get up without notifying her so that we wouldn't confuse the wait staff and sit in a place that we weren't supposed to. We were definitely a little wet by the time the waitress got back to us.  -As we were moved to the bottom floor, our food came out a bit cold but not terribly. Since my burger came with French fries, I naturally would have liked some ketchup. Not our waitress nor anyone else came up to ask if we needed anything. I finally had to go to the hostess (who was very pleasant and helpful) and ask for ketchup.  -We did not receive one refill the entire night.  -Our waitress was not seen again after we moved to the bottom floor... Not once.  -No wait staff or manager asked how we were doing and if we needed anything.  -After we finished eating, our empty plates sat in front of us for 5-6 minutes as probably 20 wait staff walked by and did not offer to take our empty plates away. I finally had to once again ask the hostess for a little help in taking our plates and getting the check. It was the hostess who got us our condiments, took our plates and got our check.  I could have EASILY walked out without paying, no one would have noticed.   It turned out we got lost in the shuffle during the move from rooftop to bottom floor. It happens, I understand that. But this was more than one waitress mix up, this was an entire wait staff that had no intentions of ensuring that we had a good experience. Once the mix up was identified, there was no one and nothing done to make us feel like a valued customer who regrettably got lost in the shuffle. Just barely a disingenuous "sorry." I've never not left a tip, but if there was ever a case this should have been it. I ended up tipping about 10%, which was generous and honestly should have gone to the hostess.   I have a feeling that if I visited the Peculiar Rabbit again, I would have a better experience. The restaurant really does look fun, it's in a great location, great atmosphere, enticing menu, etc. But I will not be coming back to the Rabbit. I'd rather spend my money where I enjoy the food and am treated like a valued customer. Disappointing.  If any staff from the restaurant would like to speak further about this experience, I would be happy to. Feel free to contact me through Yelp at this time. Thank you.

sMDTA_rh8o8MGGgS1qm6VA.text: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible service. Went this Sunday for brunch. Right away the waiter told us it was his last day working there. No one was sitting inside, very few outside or upstairs but waited 45+ mins just to get drinks and take order. Then we waited an hour and a half+ to get food, and the food that we got was cold and teeny tiny portions. Never coming to brunch here again.

LFX7rck99_mDmQLKCV120w.text: My favorite appetizer is DEVILS ON HORSEBACK.  Great stuff!  For dinner, I had the special - surf & turf.  The crabcake was good - mostly crabmeat.  But the 4oz turf came out rare instead of medium.  When I sent it back, the manager personally delivered it to me.  It was still rare.  I wasn't sending it back after that.    The staff is very friendly!

0jjz2e5zuZMLB2oSSFG9ag.text: We just visited for our second time, and the experience, food and service were spectacular.  We sat upstairs this time as opposed to in the bar the first time.  The scene was a little dark and cozy but energetic, and our server was spot-on.  We got the fried green tomato appetizer; the tomatoes were great, and the relish and remoulade were flavorful without being too spicy.  I got the chicken for dinner and my fella got The Peculiar Rabbit; we agreed that mine was better, but his was still pretty good.  This is a welcome addition to the neighborhood - creative food, craft beer, good service and warm atmosphere... throw in a great view, and it's quickly becoming my new, favorite place!

gZyNHr4dAAQrVfdg9xl_Aw.text: Came here for a friends birthday and it's hard to even know where to start listing everything that went wrong. First of all they tried to sit us a table in the dark but graciously took a few minutes to clean off another one. Then about 3 things we tried to order they were out of including the "daily made" caesar dressing and mashed potatoes? Our waitress had serious issues and was extremely rude the whole time because we came in 45 minutes before the kitchen closing. Oh yeah they ran out of silver wear and hotsauce hence the harris teeter being next door. It never ended. My mouth is currently pruned from how salty the fries were. Overall horrible experience don't eat here please.

7kXd31k3IRc8rAHeHlQHaQ.text: i went there for brunch on a Sunday after a night of binge drinking, wearing my disheveled clothes from the night before and the hostess looked at me as if the scum of the earth has just walked in through the door. She was snide & dismissive when I tried to make some small talk and finally seated my friends and I in the back of the almost empty first floor. I FELT SEGREGATED. The food was overpriced and mediocre, except for the orange juice. That was some damn good orange juice.    It took forever to get our food and the staff was mostly rude and stuck up. Overall I wish I stayed home and ate hot pockets in my underwear instead.   Also they took over the free neighborhood parking areas and are charging $5 for parking there now. WHAT IS THIS. WHEN DID MIDWOOD TURN INTO UPTOWN.

fFRfaUAvchqCX0Gonjpc7Q.text: Bar atmosphere with great rooftop view of Charlotte. Food is good but this is definitely a step up from a dive bar.

yAHhabcPwjQTvUqUAQdnrQ.text: New menu as of late July14. We were there on its second day. The waiter kept telling us everything (we asked about) was great. We later realized he hadn't even tried the stuff yet. The calamari was like eating a Michelin.  We sent it back (its gotta be awful for me to send it back).  The waiter then recommended the cheese board (no price listed). It was pretty decent...until the bill came. All other apps were in the $6-10 range. Cheese board: $38!!!  WT...  Shady!  Burgers were OK but two times here was enough for me. Much better spots in CLT...and more affordable!

fvuYwk4cYnC71oDckK-ABg.text: The Peculiar Rabbit is a pretty large bar/restaurant. When I first heard about it being built and finally opening, I thought it would be more of a "bar food" type of place. I was wrong. It does have that bar feel and is would be a great place to head over after work with some friends for a cocktail but I was surprised by the menu.   The menu has some unique twists on various dishes. I don't know that I have ever given figs a chance but I do now. The goat cheese stuffed figs wrapped in bacon are something I think about probably a couple of times a month now. They are sooo good. The bacon is not too crisp but just enough that it wraps around the fig and is drizzled with a beet reduction sauce #OMG.   For dinner, I had the mushroom risotto. Another great choice, but I think this might be a seasonal dish and not one of the regular items. And since we were out for my mother's birthday, what dinner would be complete without a little dessert...so we ordered the seasonal cheesecake which hit the spot.   Overall, I would recommend this place for anything from after work drinks to date night. I would not suggest this place for children for various reasons.

ELrDRKpW0q60nMaEH4kF0g.text: Food was terrible. I'm not sure how you poach eggs and make them look like a bowl of snot, but they have that down. Staff is mediocre. It's a real shame because the rooftop is prime location. I will never be returning.

WXoRHnys17rXP9dbi_jgfQ.text: My friend and I were on our way to a recommended place in Charlotte, when we saw this place. This is a super cute building with an outdoor patio at the entrance and the rooftop. Entranced by the live music and cute stringed lights, we decided to give this a try.  The rooftop was too long of a wait for us, so we sat outside instead, which wasn't that big of a deal for us. We had a musician playing guitar in the background, and surrounded by a lot of chill dogs and dog owners relaxing for the evening with drinks. The atmosphere is incredibly relaxed, and the service was prompt. Our server did a great job checking in on us throughout. To our surprise, Wednesday nights had half price alcohol, so we split a bottle of red wine! Great price for decent drinks!  The food itself is colorful and unique. We split a Portuguese flatbread, which was actually pretty good, but a slight too salty for my taste. I also ordered the fig and pistachio salad, which was decent as well. The squash was pretty hard, but the rest of it was tasty.  Overall, a great place to have a drink and relax--you won't be rushed, and you'll be thoroughly taken care of.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Portuguese flatbread
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fig and pistachio salad

Kh5xJ6rl8IJ44q2ztmMR3A.text: Been here a couple times... mostly for drinks, but never really gotten to have a sit-down meal here until recently.  Probably hands-down the best roof-top seating area in the city due to the restaurants position in Plaza Midwood overlooking the entire Charlotte skyline.  Great place to have a drink and watch the sun set.    Unfortunately a place with a spectacular view didn't have the food to match.  There menu sounded pretty amazing, but it seems like the food execution was off when I went the other day.  We ordered the short rib grilled cheese and roasted brussel sprouts and my friend ordered the chicken and waffle sammich with bourbon creamed corn.  Pretty much the only thing that was memorable were the brussel sprouts so that may be saying something.  Servers and staff were pretty nice... towards the end the rooftop got fairly busy so the two servers were running around like crazy.  Kudos to those guys since they have to run up and down stairs all day fetching people's drinks and food.  Onto my other pet peeve:  parking... sometimes I avoid Plaza Midwood altogether because of parking - or the lack-thereof.  We were lucky since the lot off of Thomas street had one person leaving as we pulled in... otherwise it is full on MAD MAX - everyone for themselves side street parking... and even the "RAP" reverse angle parking spots are usually all filled up.  Once you find a spot, you are good, but it is pretty stressful driving around and then having to walk through some alleyways to get to where you are going.  Overall a great location - I think everyone should experience a sunset from the roof of the PR at least once.  Going back for the food - I'll give them another chance, but I may stick to liquid dinners here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunset from the rooftop
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffle sammich and bourbon creamed corn
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short rib grilled cheese and brussels

3YCcTS_rwPUmuoi_Ksbz_Q.text: I hesitate even giving this place two stars. I've been to the Peculiar Rabbit at least five times. It's easy to get in when the other restaurants are packed, and they have a great outdoor space, so it ends up being at the default restaurant to go to Plaza Midwood.  First off, why does a fully stocked bar not have a cocktail menu??? I know they used to have one at some point. I ended up with a beer instead, which was ok.  I do like the menu, but the food never tastes as good as it sounds. Last night I got the lamb pita and it was pretty bad. The meat was so dry, served room temperature to slightly cold (although the pita was nice and hot), and didn't have anything inside except two cucumbers and a small piece of fig. My boyfriend ordered steak with a garlic mash.  Steak was cooked pretty well, but the garlic mash was so strong that I couldn't even eat it (and this comes from a girl that cooks with a TON of garlic).  Service was incredibly slow. I really don't understand why it took 45min to get our food, and we never really saw our waitress. This seems to be the theme almost ever time I've gone to Peculiar Rabbit.    I would recommend this place if you're going with a group of friends just to have a few drinks and apps (and you only need to see the waitress about every 30min to order another drink). Otherwise, there are other places around Plaza where you can get a good meal, like Fuel Pizza, which was where I went afterwards to get a slice since I was hungry.

pj_WkC6YKGUu8UJt47QOXA.text: Terrible service, terrible food, great atmosphere.  Server did not write down our orders, left for a while then came back and asked us our orders again, still messed up our orders, gave one of our orders to another table then took it away and tried to give it to us. He brought my son the wrong dish, took it away and never brought back his original order. Should have walked away as soon as we smelled the weed on him.  Food: 2.5 Sporks Service: 1.5 Sporks Atmosphere: 4 Sporks Sweet Tea: 1 Sporks Value: 2 Sporks Local Beer: 3 Sporks

u4gzcKuFgH8MSHCQxJNoeA.text: Perfect lunch today-beautiful weather, awesome patio dining, great staff and an extremely good blended burger with potato and chorizo hash. I'll be back to try other items as well!  Brunch seems very popular here, so maybe that's next?

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

VW3s1xjsT7TQurLgo-Rf3A.text: The best experience about this facility is the view. My fiance and I have just moved to the area. We thought it'd make a great way to end the evening by having drinks while enjoying a view and healthy dialogue. Until the Manager came and told us we had to leave because all seats were for the reserved. I guess she forgot she spoke with us 2-5min before to tell us how lucky we were to catch the best seat of the house. We politely thanked her and continued on with our intimate conversation. Not to mention, not one host/hostess notified us of required reservations upon entering.  When we looked around, we noticed all the other African Americans at the facility were being asked to leave as well. I usually do not blame race (because I want to give people the benefit of the doubt plus I always see daffodils and daisies); however, it was the first time in a while since I'd felt it blatantly apparent. It made me regret my decision to move back to "the South."  Otherwise, the service - especially from the Manager was terrible! She tried to offer free drinks to compensate for the fact that she was basically kicking us out for no reason. I will never go back again. My money is just as valuable as all other patrons so I'll use my buying power else where. If I could I'd give this place no stars.

QTPXgy_Uz07wU9iw7z1dZg.text: I waited until this morning to send this review. I was extremely unhappy with the service upstairs for a meet and greet at a business meeting with colleagues.   The bartender was rude, unprofessional, and apparently needs more training on how to do her job as a bartender.   If you can't be polite interactive and happy with customers while doing your job you should not be a bartenders or any staff working with customers. This is not the first time we had a an unpleasant experience with this establishment.  Peculiar rabbit get it together or you won't be in business very long. I see you are struggling now.

FW_-MejilDqORzPDhr0Vhg.text: I was here this past weekend. 1st time I visit this place. It was crowded but not packed so we were able to sit right away. The place is big and has an upstairs rooftop and a cute sitting area downstairs by the entrance. It wasn't loud so me and my friend could actually have a conversation.   We ordered the shrimp tacos for starts, they were good, but I think they could do better, the tortilla was very cold when it got to us, the flavor of the shrimp was good though.   I ordered the Salmon plate. that was very good... Service was slow at first but then they seemed to be more on point towards the end. I will comeback

gacwwBfbAowZp0hSQ8jpmQ.text: We really wanted to sit on the rooftop.... but it was full.  The new menu was just released yesterday, so no one knew much about anything... We got the purple cauliflower enchiladas, the rib grilled cheese.... and the rabbit grilled cheese.  Soo good.  The waitress said they get a new menu every 6 months. We do feel like you don't get your money worth for everything though. My husband and son were still hungry after they finished everything. If the prices were lower... or you got more food, it would be more worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short rib grilled cheese with a side salad
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rabbit grilled cheese with blackberry fennel slaw
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Purple cauliflower enchiladas

3vl70lVZPM0jSSIavF0E_A.text: Here for an annual family gathering and Peculiar Rabbit always stands out! The food, the View and this time even the waitress, Natalie!  She was amazing and took very good care of us along with the other tables she had to serve. So why not a five star review?  Simple the hostess!  We had reservations, sure we were a big party but when I made the reservations we were told to arrive 10 minutes early to be sure to get a table on the roof. Well the hostess didn't like that at all and she made sure we knew it!  We almost made other plans, glad we didn't Natalie was a wonderful server.   Thanks Natalie!!

yB8m-xcI4Pxgi89LBR1lWg.text: Why open a restaurant if your employees are going to give poor "service"?!     I sat right in front of the hostess stand by the door for 10-15 mins and never was approached as the waitress walked past me 3 times and another employee(manager maybe)  was at the table next to me on a lap top.  I moved to the bar where I got a little better service.   Definitely never coming back.   Did I mention that is was only about 7 customers in the entire place.   Just close your doors!

L4AGD6YcvCfXMlTXVVM1cg.text: We had a terrible experience here for brunch for my friends birthday. We had a reservation that was made on open table, yet they had no record of it. The service was haphazard and confusing. The waitress didn't seem to know what she was talking about and kept forgetting about us.   Also- I should note that buying a bottle of champagne and a carafe of orange juice like they suggest does not actually save you any money (in fact it might be more expensive than just getting regular mimosas). The bottomless mimosa price is also ridiculous at $25 unless you plan on sitting there all day.... mimosas are $5 each and unless you plan on drinking 6 mimosas at brunch the deal makes no sense.   Once our food came it got even worse. Everyone who got the eggs Benedict (which was most of our party) couldn't even eat it because the eggs were so overly funny. They weren't just funny yolks- the whites were barely cooked at all. It's really unfortunate because it's a great atmosphere but I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The eggs were basically raw- so gross

j1XRSZ1aR7q-JUm5LG5v0A.text: The food was awful. This place has substantially gone down hill since I moved to Charlotte 6 years ago. Everything tasted bland, portions are way too small for the price. Will not be back.

OAWM-ePjDF02Mip7thj52Q.text: Food can be ok at times but the place seems unorganized and even dirty.  I feel like it was thrown together with no thought.  There are better options.  Good location though.

rC8TJr6Gm698JuxoEQaUgQ.text: Great food, drink, service!!   I got a Jimaca shrimp taco and it was great :)   Awesome crispness and flavor. Unique "taco"

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jimaca Shrimp Taco   SOO good! Nice crispness and unique &#34;taco&#34;.

vGYLSnSJjP_9Yjm_hogcow.text: I will spare you the excruciating details of our terrible, horrible visit.  Cons: Slow Understaffed Menu underwhelming No silverware or napkins delivered with food  Pros: Good beer selection (BUT ask what they are out of) Good view of uptown

OPwxVTS1zrzOgIOwxIvPIw.text: I am completely obsessed with this place! I was here about two weeks ago with my boyfriend and I ordered their sweet potato noodle bowl (I looked on their online menu to find the actual name but it isn't on their online menu-- I don't know why). Anyway-- whatever it is called-- it has spiralized sweet potato noodles with a sweet and spicy asian-influenced sauce. It had shrimp and pork belly and brussels sprouts and all kinds of other fun things. I tend the eat a paleo-based diet and very often I struggle to find something on a menu that I can eat and if I find something-- I often make many modifications. This dish was not that way. I enjoyed it right off the menu, as-is. I loved it! I have debated driving over there to order it again-- it is just that good. Get over there and try is asap!

8NZ162dWoMQC_j-n4siXtg.text: We brought our dog and sat in the outdoor patio area, the staff brought her a water bowl and were very affectionate! We went for brunch and ordered chicken and waffles and a breakfast platter, both were good but did not blow us away. The outside atmosphere was relaxing, with shaded cover, music playing, and tvs. Overall it was a solid choice for affordable brunch with many menu options.

wdYA9HLNXc4CcK7WJYLIpQ.text: Beautiful location but extremely poorly managed!  We went tonight to 3rd floor for beautiful sunset. Not eating, only for drinks, but not one wait staff approached us during the 2 hours we were there!!!  Had to go to 2nd floor bar to get our own drinks.  That's truly in acceptable?!!' No one wants a tip here for service it seems???  Don't waste your time.  Go elsewhere.

c5Sw4hqgT9FSxrQolzFUUA.text: Horrible. They were out of 5 different dishes. Wait staff could have cared less and the manager didn't even bother to come over and apologize.   With all the other places to go - go somewhere else.

vFVPNI_AY8_H6tx1QtgO9A.text: Food was okay. Service was good. The restaurant was dark but there was live music outside. Came for a late lunch on Sun afternoon. More ideal place to watch a game and grab a beer.

4WsBbsjfwGlcRARDWZsu7Q.text: My wife and I stopped by for late drinks and appetizers last night and were impressed with the friendly service and the amazing rooftop views. We had company in town so we decided to drop by this morning to give brunch a try. While the servings were large and tasty, I think Peculiar Rabbit still falls behind Heist and Tupelo Honey Cafe for local brunch. That being said, the herb biscuits were definitely a standout, both in my wife's biscuits and gravy and my country breakfast plate. We will be back.   Side note - front porch is super dog friendly; we saw a server bringing another customer's dog a large bowl of water.

_tuRK28djsvWfP3cwz_5ug.text: So.... I've heard enough reviews about this restaurant having good food, so I finally decided to try it out.  I went for Saturday brunch.  I loved how their brunch is served up to 3pm.  However, I was not pleased with the parking.  I prefer a restaurant to have a parking lot instead of random street parking.  We ended up parking in the CVS lot.  I couldn't even eat comfortably because I was worried that my car may get towed.  Besides that, the food was really good.  But the service was super slow for some breakfast food.  My recommendation is to know what you plan on ordering before arriving at the restaurant.  That way, when the waiter asks for your drink order...you can go ahead and place your food order.  And once you place your order, be prepared that it's going to take 20 minutes regardless if you ordered a plate of eggs.  Crazy, I know.  The food was good enough for me to come back.  Just know that the service is slow.  I wouldn't come to Peculiar rabbit if I was starving and wanted food to quick.  I also would be skeptical that they could handle a large party well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit and white gravy
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles - it has a good portion of a boneless chicken breast

8hKiydu25rcLFYD1214WXA.text: Stopped here for Sunday brunch. Good drinks and food in a fantastic space - you definitely need to sit upstairs. Also had fantastic service from our server Ali - she was awesome! Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from outside

9Rpoxatjxrw0fHjQgji_Ew.text: We shared the shrimp tacos (these were made with a jicama "tortilla" - so good!) and the portobello avocado burger. Delicious, and an awesome view to go with it!

sBmxd5eykiYWusN886BTCg.text: Four stars simply for the great rooftop dining area and skyline view! The food is simple pub fare, but I don't have any complaints about my beer and burger. Great place to hang out with friends!

dltjmQwm62ZbKAaGz_O8uw.text: This place was terrible all around.  We started with the Mediterranean plate and it was not so great.  It game with hummus that was pretty gross, pickled cauliflower - which was probably the best thing on the plate, flavorless pitas, and some olives.  It wasn't awful, but we weren't impressed.  I wish we had stopped the meal there since it went drastically downhill at this point.    Our waiter decided to come by only when we asked for him for things like forks, napkins & water...since they have runners that bring out the food.  The place wasn't even busy when we were in there and I saw him taking pictures with the other staff and laughing...  I ordered the Bahn Mi and it was just so bad I couldn't eat it since it was grossing me out so much.  My husband ordered the burger and it was burned and beyond well done which is ridiculous since he asked for it to be medium.    One of my favorite parts of the night was when we were sitting around waiting for the bill and surprise, surprise, he was no where to be found.  When we asked for him again, he brought the check and we paid with cash - he asked if we wanted change back...if we said no, the tip would have been 50% of the bill! I was kind of impressed he had the nerve to even ask if we wanted change back.  After waiting forever for our change, we left as quickly as we could.  I would never ever ever go back here again.

fwLfUx69vwE-c0UBaZ-2JQ.text: This trendy little restaurant in the heart of Plaza Midwood is getting some poor reviews... and there's a good reason.  The service sucks.  We have enjoyed the food here on two previous occasions, and went again for lunch.  After we were seated with menus the server came to ask what we wanted to drink. I asked about cocktails. She acted like I was speaking a foreign language, she didn't know cocktails. I pointed to the menu and said, "I want something alcoholic that isn't beer or wine... a cocktail from the bar."  She told me that all of the ingredients for their cocktails were out of season, so I couldn't get a drink from the bar.  Now, obviously this isn't True. They would have made me something... but this girl was just so stupid that she couldn't comprehend what was happening.  As we were walking out the general manager stopped us and asked what was wrong. I told him, and he confirmed... they had no specialty cocktail menu because all of their ingredients were out of season.  If I were an investor in the Peculiar Rabbit, I would be worried. Not serving cocktails from their well-stocked bar is like pouring money out the door, instead of into customer's glasses.  We will never return.

NhFCfXHAIpUxrkmI1naJNA.text: I was a bit disappointed during this visit. I ate here when it first opened quite a while ago, and it really has changed. The food is too complicated and not executed well. The taco appetizer was pretty sad. I am also confused as to why at 7:00 at night, water is served in plastic cups, when you are eating at a restaurant that serves entrees upwards of $20. The one thing that really was good was the service. Our server was attentive and personable. Probably will be my last trip here.

FYlSNuNTogJSsGZozr9Jsg.text: I went to Peculiar this past weekend with 2 girlfriends for dinner. Upon walking in, we were told that the wait was "35 minutes but should be sooner". So we decided to wait at the bar and have a few drinks. Thankfully, the drinks were great and the bartenders were on point :-)  Unfortunately, an hour went by without any sign of a table :(   We eventually asked the hostess and were seated within 5 minutes just to find out the kitchen was running an hour behind on tickets (We arrived at 7:45PM and were sat at 9:00PM). Our server was great and extremely attentive. And eventually the food was delicious (at 9:45PM)- we ordered the hummus plate, onion rings and the po'boy sandwich. All of which were prepared well and tasted great! Though these were delicious, we would have ordered actual entrees if it wouldn't have taken as long.   I believe there was mention of a new chef, which understandably can be stressful on a restaurant. But I really think the ball was dropped on communication here. We have been to Peculiar a million times and have always loved it. Servers, bartenders, and food have always been great. Hopefully this one time was a fluke.   Will be trying again and hopefully writing a better review. Fingers crossed :)

4syHqNPJI0F1K40kTHmMRQ.text: We had a great brunch this morning! The menu for Sunday brunch is fabulous! My husband had the American breakfast! He enjoyed it very much. Everything was cooked to perfection!  I had the chicken, bacon, Brie salad. It was delicious. I had hoped for more bacon and Brie, but it was a delicious salad. I added a cup if fruit, $4...a smidgen over priced for what I received.  Too bad it was before noon on a Sunday. We couldn't drink...but we look forward to going back again sometime that we can!

2ZYcKMo-FoExf4hWlhCffQ.text: Love this!!! From Miami and this is the best place we've found in Charlotte. They have amazing food and drinks. Amazing view of the city. We LOVE IT

BhVTWnLiaypbwbqEQTuf_A.text: The location is fun. It's not exactly uptown but that's why your there! Low key, no nonsense. The food is not great but it's not terrible. I have gone in and tried several things at once with a group and all rated it just about the same. The roof top bar on the summer is a HUGE plus!

igIH1FbvMWqqhd8ZjuPs4A.text: We came here after grabbing dinner and drinks at Duckworths. It was ok but something was lacking, order was wrong, waited forever for drinks, just not what we had in mind for a night out. We didn't want the night to end so we decided to come to the Peculiar Rabbit and we're so glad we did! We went to the rooftop and it was a tiny bar, seemed lacking, but we sat at the bar even though they only had 3 seats.... We were like what! The bartender just so happened to get to know us and he did! We spent the whole night at the bar, swapping stories like we knew him out whole life! Graham took the time and added a personal touch that is lost nowadays! Graham's the man and it was like he wasn't just our own personal bartender but a friend! We'll definitely be back! Probably tomorrow, hopefully he's working!

_i83VawYKKUEiGyxO-Lbsw.text: Rooftop bar has spectacular views, great music, and the best bartender in town!  My husband and I had a blast.  Thanks again, Graham!!!

SyKAoRYclC70tsM-XfMPlQ.text: Was here for a networking event, thinking it was just going to be regular bar food but was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Great food choices and presented very well! Has rooftop seating with a great view of the city. Glad we found this place and are very excited to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful day... Beautiful view!

Q2X1O0cNwe0uJ_ZNL7I9Aw.text: Very peculiar indeed.  My experience yesterday afternoon went something like this:  I walk up to the hostess stand and smile.  There was an awkward pause and the two hostesses stare back at me w/o cracking a smile or blinking or saying hello or greeting me.  I felt uncomfortable.  I awkwardly said "I have 3 people in my party.  Is this where I put my name down?"  They, again, stared back at me and told me that there was a 20 minute wait without smiling or blinking.....  Awkward pause.  Me: "So is this where I put my name down on the waiting list or is there another hostess stand?"  They finally took my name and gave me a buzzer.  What was that all about?!  Me and my friend, who showed up after the weird encounter, proceed to the bar area to get her some caffiene.  We asked the bartender for a cup of coffee and you would have thought we ordered something weird like ...I dunno...sushi?? The whole situation just got weirder.   He gave us this  vibe...kinda like we had put him out.... but later came to realize that he was having a terrible day. He told us what was going on and we instantly felt bad.   He didn't have coffee at the bar, but ran and made her a fresh pot and told her it was on the house.  That was way cool.    So we sat at the bar waiting on our third party.  Bartender was actually really nice, friendly, and was good at making a mean bloody mary (that didn't make your mouth feel like it was going to ignite on fire)  Met some really friendly locals at the bar and chatted while we waited.  And waited.  And ...waited.  20 min turned into 40.  *sighs*. FINALLY we get to our table.  Service was SLOW.  Not our servers fault, but for some reason the kitchen was backed up and we were warned about that right when we sat down. Great.  Glad I'm starving.    We ordered and if it weren't for the great company, I would have been irritated at how long it took to get our food.  I know one girl at the bar had waited for her call in order for an hour.  Foodie Call driver was there picking up an order as well and she had been waiting 30 minutes for it.  Not good.    Food finally came out and It was really good.  I mean really really good....but such a small portion.  I ordered the omlete and I guess I expected it to be more filling. I guess the waitress felt so bad that we had to wait for a long time, she brought my second order of mimosa in a giant wine glass.  Red wine glass full of mimosa made all things wrong...right again.  ha! (and it was only $3.00)   I'll have to come back when it's not at the peek of brunch time.  They do have the best bloody mary's, though.  The food was good, just took too long and was a smaller portion than I expected, and the hostesses are SLOW and not friendly....or weren't awake.  Oh and they ran out of bloody mary mix .....and the bartender said it happens almost every other Sunday.  How does that happen??  *shrug*

1YzHQoEkOxWCrtMpdUN5Ig.text: The food is good and the atmosphere is fun. Service was subpar. Server was standoffish, she did not ask we were doing, did not check up on us, and consistently made errors. Will give it another try because the food was good.

_8xORtNPTzU2yPjnkFUkuA.text: The overall experience was good. We had excellent service from Jean-Carle and Sophia and the rooftop dining was gorgeous. We had a very large party and they did their best to take care of us.The food was good and drinks were average. The manager, Nicole, however, was less than pleasant. She was extraordinarily rude to the servers and essentially accused us of trying to not pay for all of our food. When I reminded the server that he had already charged the girl at my table for an entree she said to the servers: "You guys are responsible for anything that isn't paid for, so you better not mess up". If I were the owner and I knew that a manager was treating employees this way, I would be very disappointed.

801tkrSpihprF-ERIUqQpw.text: Came here for dinner with a friend on a Thursday night. We wanted to eat on the rooftop bar so we had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated but it was worth it, it has an excellent view (especially at night).  I ordered the caesar salad to start and it was delicious. Normally I don't flip over things like salads but this was possibly the best caesar salad I have ever eaten. It was grilled hearts of romaine and the grill flavor just made it excellent. They also use homemade dressing which is a major plus.  I had the grilled cheese with fries for my main meal and was really happy with both, the fries were extra crispy which I like. My friend had the pork and pimento cheese sandwich and the the only complaint was wishing it had more pimento cheese on it. She had the honey sriracha brussels sprouts for her side and they were heaven, the perfect amount of sweet and spicy.  Will def. come again.

_Lu3NPe-ZNPr-mc-pyW87A.text: A girlfriend was kind enough to invite me out with her to the Peculiar Rabbit to burn off a gift card that she had, otherwise I would not have ever visited (odd parking situations turn me off - I am an old lady).  I am so glad that she invited me outside of my comfort zone - what a great evening!  The parking... yeah.  There are some parallel spots around the building, but at 5:00 on a Saturday, these were all full.   I drove around the block once to try and check everything out and ended up parking in one of the back-in spots (eek!) on Commonwealth.  When we left around 8:00, all spots everywhere were full - had I encountered that, I would have bailed and told her I caught a case of the plague.  Even though we were meeting very early, I made reservations on Open Table on the off chance that everyone was going to be sick of family and turkey the Saturday after Thanksgiving and bum rush the place.  After 6:00ish, the place really picks up and they were slammed for the rest of the night that we were there.  Very cozy ambiance, comfortable seating.  High top tables and chairs in the bar area, tables throughout the rest of the first floor.  I was seated immediately, even though I was early and the hostess asked if I wanted water and brought it back almost immediately.  Our waiter for the evening was Christopher (?) and he was right on top of things.   My dinner was the Turkey Lurkey, which was a turkey burger with sage mayo, craisins and.... I don't know.  It was good.  Served with a side, I chose the mashed potatoes, which were fine, but the turkey burger was awesome.  Well seasoned and extremely juicy, YUM.  My dinner date is a vegetarian and they made the Holiday Risotto veggie friendly by omitting the turkey.
