We split the Oreo truffles for dessert (balls of smashed Oreos covered with chocolate), which was served with glasses of milk.  Deeee-licious and so rich.    We sat there for a while eating and chatting.  Drinks were kept filled, our waiter was fantastic.  It was all around a great evening and I would definitely go again (early, so I can get a parking spot).

OrokcqIqUFHBCRx1C0PKZQ.text: Not only was my food excellent and service on point, but Taylor is really the stand out server at Peculiar. He is so friendly, informative, and accommodating--everything a patron of this restaurant could ask for. We'll be back and look forward to seeing those ginger braids next time!!

Z9RmF2s3WsIItwG5IjEycQ.text: This is a peculiar place. Upscale wana be. Lovely patio on roof. Can be hard to park. The rabbit dish is good. Fresh food good beer but not great

Sxq6-NTlOVjRfxF2875ckQ.text: I don't really have anything terrible to say about this place. It was just okay.  I was a little peeved that we asked to sit inside bc it was so hot out an the hostess sat us upstairs (where it was super hot) in the middle of trivia night that was "almost over" but lasted the entire time we were there (over an hour). Meanwhile the lower level had plenty of open seating.  The atmosphere doesn't seem to match the pricing. The drinks and food seemed to be that of a nicer restaurant, but its a BAR. The food was good but not worth the cost.  So I guess if you want to over pay for your food and drinks and sit in a hot bar, THIS is the place for you!

QgFACtR-ktTCPJSsILezbQ.text: I have eaten at The Peculiar Rabbit multiple times. I've always found the food to be interesting, priced ok but let's be honest you eat here to sit on the roof.   I arrived at about ten til 6 on a Saturday to a completely empty restaurant I was told that we needed a reservation and could not be seated at all. The hostess was quite rude about it. I am not saying she was lying about being completely full with reservations. But the restaurant was in fact completely empty. The hostess did offer up the bar areas as open seating but then mentioned that the bar areas only included the bars. The bar area high tops were  reserved. Lastly the hostess begrudgingly (read: we had to ask about it) offered up the outdoor patio as open seating but warned us if it starts to rain, we wouldn't be able to move inside. The undertone was that we should probably go fuck ourselves.    My advice to management: always keep a line, can't do that if you don't take walk ins. Also don't hire shitty people.   My advice to anyone that absolutely has to eat here, like someone (probably your girlfriend's friend that you don't really like) is holding a gun to your head and will blow your brains out if you ask to eat anywhere else: try the Lamb Burger and steal the pint glass.   My advice to people that don't fall into the aforementioned categories: go some where else. There's some amazing restaurants in walking distance.   UPDATE: actually made it to a table this time. (I went kicking and screaming with a large group)  Bypassed the bitch of a hostess as the group had already been seated. Our server was good and the food was pretty tasty. They did refer to their beer cheese as Rarebit, which I assume is a throwback to the restaurant's self proclaimed English roots. It's simply not accurate: Rarebit is rarebit, beer cheese is beer cheese. I gave them another star for the food.   At the end of the meal we had to hunt our waitress down for checks, and several people had to speak with a manager to straighten things out. I am sure large parties are especially difficult, and things handles professionally, but still a pain. I still probably won't be jumping at the bit for a return trip.

m41fvK2LUlEyuKkSbd4hsA.text: The menu, Taylor and atmosphere made for a great dining experience. Food came fast and was delicious! Taylor was attentive, knowledgeable and friendly as hell. Not to mention his beautiful ginger man-bun is sexy AF.

hcHF3z70Xp1HxgP3GvZC3w.text: Nice atmosphere. Rooftop is nice but there are no umbrellas and there is no shade, so you can't comfortably sit there in the heat of the day. The food is pretty bland. The calamari was flavorless. The salmon burger I had was just ok. Everyone at my table felt that the food was bland. They do have nice drink specials, which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. View of building

ihT-bsQLOPDDpjnAvjqtKg.text: We ate here Saturday evening based on a recommendation of a family friend. We were very disappointed in the food, but the service was very good. Our waiter was very accommodating to our needs and concerns.

7kfPupUyeqCq3aTjQn3RKg.text: JT's incomparable bartending skills are only upstaged by his stunning good looks. Highly recommend!

_s_RlKidWo5aOGuCyqTr9Q.text: The only thing good about this place is the view. You will see in the reviews a reoccurring theme. People love the view but hate the food. I ordered wings and a burger and both were lackluster. No flavor and very bland for both items. Servers are super nice but the food is horrible. If you go, get drinks only and keep it simple with fries. Trying to play safe with wings or a burger fail here. Really wanted to love this place. I'm pretty sure if they didn't have the view but served this food at a different location, they would be closed by now.

9JYMc6wwCbs6wbl351EXZw.text: My husband and I were greeted by a smiling host and sat immediately. Our server was extremely cheerful, answered all our questions. She was attentive and prompt with our drinks and meals. I had the chicken and waffles and my husband had the big boy burger. They were both delicious and the portions were very generous. I highly recommend this restaurant .

qy4h0rJvrXDVjwsAycl0dQ.text: Food was great, service could have been better.  Would recommend for a good bite and a few drinks before kicking off a night.

i6GyJIYAihKsyPYrDTDuFg.text: We had an event here tonight and the staff was AMAZING!  Originally set up the event a couple of months ago with an employee who was let go (now we know why) who never booked our event and refused to respond to me.  So I called the restaurant today to confirm the event and they didn't have us down! I almost freaked out and then the manager, Kate, was so incredible and calmed me down immediately!  She told me not to worry, "we will take care of it, just give me 30 minutes and I'll get you sorted."  She called me back and had arranged drink tickets and food etc.  She was INCREDIBLE!! I was so impressed that she pulled it together so quickly and so well, especially when I gave her no notice.  I was SO grateful.  She assigned us JT as our own helper.  We were either his only people or he absolutely made us feel that way.  He was SO attentive and fantastic.  No one ever went without a drink, he brought the food out for us to enjoy and was courteous, had a great sense of humor, and was nice to everyone.  He was the perfect person for our group and I am SO grateful to JT and Kate for making this event happen for us!  We loved the patio, it was so great!  The drinks were wonderful and the general vibe was just so much fun.  The event was a huge success, and we even came in slightly under budget!  I would DEFINITELY recommend the Peculiar Rabbit.  If you go, ask for JT!  And Kate is an awesome manager who knows how to handle a crisis!  Thank you so much Peculiar Rabbit!! We will definitely be back!

_xQr6rNHaf8Q7uaXOThzEA.text: Typically I love The Peculiar Rabbit. Usually the food, vibe, and service are excellent. Today my husband and I were out celebrating my birthday and were seated at the patio. After waiting an extremely long time for a server I went inside to ask for service. I was told someone would be sent out immediately. I watched a server come out, pet a dog, check on 2 other tables, and then walk by us without acknowledging us. There are too many restaurants and too many servers who actually want to make money for us to have to put up with this. Not sure we'll be back anytime soon.

svCSza-UkhLae6hdFYIiMQ.text: We came to this joint in hopes of a good view, and then we went upstairs and met Graham. I love bars, so immediately I was concerned when it looked like just a service bar upstairs. Then we started talking to the awkwardly awesome big hearted well versed bartender named Graham who came in when he wasn't supposed to work. This smiling mofo leaves you no chance to not smile. What an asset, we will be back!   Thanks for everything,  Luke and V

biZ-C270P5tnU0klKe_n3g.text: This place is probably the worst thing that ever happened to the history of the known world.  Admittedly the atmosphere is pretty sweet.  Great views of the city, although parking can be a little difficult.  The food, however, I initially would want to call unremarkable but I can't.  I can't call it unremarkable because it is so incredibly remarkably terrible.    I ordered a club sandwich.  It took 45 min to get to my table after I ordered.  After about 30 min I was informed there was no turkey, so they would have to substitute turkey with chicken.  That was fine.  At this point I just wanted my food.  When the sandwich came, my sister who was also with me said the following: "Your sandwich looks like something they would sell at a gas station in South Carolina".  I think that was a completely fair assessment.  For a $11 club sandwich and 45 min wait, I had pictured a sandwich carefully crafted with shaved ham and turkey (as advertised on the menu).  What I got was a slab of ham steak slapped on two pieces of bread.   I'm positive I could have made a better sandwich from my play kitchen as a 3 year old.    My wife ordered a burger medium well.  It came out about as rare as I've ever seen meat.  At this point though we had been waiting for so long she just went with it.    To put in perspective how terrible this place is, this is the first time I have ever signed into yelp and wrote a review, and I would consider myself a serious foodie.  Bottom line:  If I owned a gun, and was walking in a field with a "peculiar rabbit" just ahead of me.  I would shoot that rabbit dead.  This place is terrible.

j6IxI2W3HSmrsY5nJ_NC0A.text: I had dinner at the rooftop patio.  The food was fantastic (had a short rib grilled cheese with sweet potato and bacon hash, and a fried peanut butter sandwich for dessert), the views are good, and the wait staff was exceptional. Everything recommended by Zach was spot on. If I lived in the area, this might be my new go-to spot. Next time I'm in Charlotte, this will be a must-stop. Thanks Zach!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunset view from the rooftop.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried peanut butter sandwich....amazing!
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great menu

uD68hoanDJ99jGM7Dl5ycw.text: After a few less than stellar visits, here's short:  The food is creatively attempted, but without remarkable flavor and tends toward overpriced.   The tap is not interesting. The beer is expensive. On top of that, the staff doesn't seem keen on letting a person hang around and have a few--which at the price is probably a good thing.   The wait staff is terrible. Just terrible. The service is slow to get to you, then inattentive until they want you gone. I have not had a nice, friendly experience on any of my visits. This is key.   All of that wouldn't rate a one-star rating, this puts it over the edge:  The folks at PR have decided to start charging for parking spaces across the street; this impacts not only parking for the rabbit, but also all of the venues around, which have traditionally been open after the shops close. Since they can't seem to make bank with their mediocre food, apparently they need to make up the difference by screwing the neighborhood.  This fact makes them not just an overpriced and uncomfortable place to kill time or have a meal, but an actively bad actor in the community. My advice would be 'avoid' if that weren't True. Since it is, my advice is to actively oppose.

sgPhjwU-wBHK_iSpw0MC8A.text: Charming place in Plaza Midwood. Three levels, or three and a half, with a rooftop.  Chelsea, our server, made a recommendation of the "veggie wrap, add chicken." This was excellent.  The chairs in the dining room, when moved, create a loud and irritating sound. This should be remedied.  The extreme high pressure faucet in the upstairs men's room may as well be a fire hose. This should be remedied.  The surveillance monitor in the men's room is fascinating. This should be duplicated.  FANTASTIC rooftop view.  Mimosas for $2 or $3 on Saturdays is a great deal.  Slightly overpriced otherwise.

nB8RYFWDwWUGvtdRHhwmcg.text: Really bad! Dirty restaurant, dirty silverware, dirty glasses. The management could care less. Our party complained to the manager and this is what we are told "this isn't fine dining, it's more of a hipster bar to attract hipsters and their parents money."  WOW who says that????? This place is a babysitting services with overpriced food and drink, in a dirty atmosphere.  Carve some more words into the table telling them how gross of a bar they have.

9SeXFfNHCEq5R9hFnHR-pA.text: Fun pub spread over multiple levels.  Food is higher end pub food and ambience is fun.

fFiF2zga8xixZIRohmbEMw.text: I want to love this place, I really do. The building itself, the rooftop deck, and the location are all incredible. However, the service is absolutely horrendous. I mean worst service in Charlotte, NC. The food isn't that great either. I will say brunch is better than lunch or dinner but it's still just average. I have eaten here about 5 times (like I said I honestly want to love it). If I were you I'd try another plaza restaurant and skip this one all together.  Follow me at: jodieats_  Photo credit: Tarra Dahlke

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

0-Q2aHOSF1ZGTXB6hYSI9g.text: If I could leave zero stars, I absolutely would. Where do I begin... we were seated around 7:30 and ordered drinks and food. Our food came out at different times for a group of 6. For my burger, which was ordered as it appeared on the menu, it did not include the actual ingredients for which it was sent back. I sent it back only to be told to take my side off (Mac and cheese) to hold on to as they fixed my burger. They brought me back the same burger with the ingredient added, and at this point it was cold. I spoke to a manager about this and never being asked by our server for more drinks. The waitress then came over and asked if I wanted food because the manager didn't know if I didn't want food, just my food comped. My friends had all received dinner as I sat there with their food. We were still not asked if we wanted more drinks after an hour. It then took another 30 minutes to receive my burger and Mac and cheese and for my friends to receive a side of sweet potatoes fries. We never saw the manager again who had avoided eye contact with our table when he came up to the rooftop. Not only was our experience unacceptable, but as a former server, it is absolutely embarrassing for the waitress to come back to our table complaining about the breakdown in communication between her and the manager. I am making sure to tell everyone I know to never visit this establishment.  Update: when I received my burger and Mac and cheese, the manager came about 30 minutes later to ask how it was and when I told him that it came out warm but was completely well done instead of medium he said, "well that's progress" and walked away.

dofNzfPh9KAEsEtxzMmSFw.text: The only thing peculiar about this place is the fact that the food isn't that great. There is so much opportunity here for them to do and provide better!   My best friend wanted to celebrate her last day in the QC dining at a place that had a stellar view of the skyline so she chose PR. She made dinner reservations for the rooftop on Tuesday (8-30-16). I showed up early and was immediately seated and provided menus. Zack, our waiter, was awesome and answered all of our questions about the drinks and food. Draft beer and bottles of wine were half-priced so we both went with beer. I had the DELICIOUS shoffhoffer (sp?) grapefruit that was on tap.  We both went with burgers: I chose the aloha burger with fries and my friend went with the ghost pepper burger (minus the ghost pepper) with Brussels sprouts (per the waiter's suggestion). Our food came out and I was kinda disappointed. The flavors of the aloha burger were very underwhelming. I could barely tell that I ordered anything other than a regular burger because I couldn't taste anything resembling what was in the burger's description. Also, I kept thinking how this place should take advantage of providing seasonal menus. Like, why on earth are they serving anything with squash during the warmer/hotter months?  Yes, it was quite lovely dining with an awesome view of the skyline and watching the sun set but it would've been even better if the accompanying food was better. There's so much opportunity Peculiar Rabbit, I hope the food improves!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2016 menu
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Aloha burger &amp; fries

mcqz47d9b7Ot3I4-SIISkQ.text: I've gone to Peculiar Rabbit on a few different occasions- brunch, lunch, dinner, just drinks- you name it. The view from the rooftop is pretty amazing and the restaurant is in a convenient location if you're in the Plaza Midwood area here in Charlotte, BUT THATS ABOUT.   SIDE NOTE: There are gems in the area that actually are worthy of your time, money, and patronage (for ex: SOUL GASTROLOUNGE, WORKMAN'S FRIEND, shoot- even THE DIAMOND DINER)  HOWEVER, the service at PECULIAR RABBIT has always been inconsistent, questionable, and sub-par despite the day and the time I have decided to go. That brings me to my most recent and unforgettable experience with this sorry excuse for an establishment.  This evening, I submitted an online order through YelpEat24 app. I received an order confirmation, notifying me that the order was received by the merchant, Peculiar Rabbit, and that my order would be ready for pick-up in a 10-45 min time window- FIRST, what kinda time range is that? (RED FLAG along with the other past experiences I should have taken into consideration). I decided to go pick up my order after about 25 minutes. I arrive to the restaurant and I wait about 5 min for the hostess. Kate, hopefully you were somewhere giving someone else proper service. After greeting her, and telling her that I was there to pick-up my to go order that I had put in and received confirmation for about 30 minutes ago, she told me that they were no longer using the YelpEat24 app. And that they no longer had the items I ordered.    Ok, Peculiar Rabbit, I got questions- none of which Kate had answers for apparently when I was there.    Why do you have the menu online? And if you aren't using YelpEat24, why do they have your menu up? Why haven't you contacted anyone sooner about updating the menu? Why was my order confirmed? Why did I have to come all the way to the restaurant for someone to tell me that my order could not be processed, despite notification that it was being made?  Why did Kate give me an explanation conveniently different from the explanation she gave the YelpEat24 customer representative and the one she gave me?  Why did Kate tell me there wasn't a manager or another person I could escalate this issue to? Who in the world is running the restaurant? Alledgedly, NO ONE. Last question, when are you guys gonna get it together?   I am not surprised Peculiar Rabbit is trying to pass off blame, or has no answer for its horrible service, or lack thereof- it has become a pattern that i will no longer doubt or question, and probably will always consider JANKY.  I'm honestly not sure if the management at this place will ever figure it out- but hopefully something changes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order confirmation
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

kt6EEW0CoSgJfWYf686BkA.text: The Peculiar Rabbit is a place that should be crushing it on the regular. Amazing view from the top bar - check. Multi level restaurant with tons of seating and several cool bars - check. Great location in Plaza Midwood - check. Great outdoor patio - check. However, this place just always seems to come up short.   I will say the last two times I have been here are on Mondays, so you can take my review with a grain of salt. Drafts of beer start around $6.50/ea and the menu is fairly simple pub fare - a little overpriced IMO. I do wonder how they keep this place running as every time I have been there is always a new server (I mean the "its my first day here" kind) who never seems to have the support they need to pull off large groups or answer questions about what is on tap or what is coming out of the kitchen. This normally throws up a big flag in my book for high turnover due to lackluster management skills. Case in point, we had a group last week out on the patio and no one in the restaurant apparently knew where the switch was located. It took about 20 minutes to get the chef out who knew where the switch was located. Odd and overall small situation, but just goes to show how keeping good staff can create a better overall customer experience.   My big takeaways are the menu feels uninspired, the drinks are priced on the high side, and the general experience just doesn't contain the "Wow" factor you expect when you pull up. It's frustrating as they seem so close - "good bones" kind of close. I hope they can figure out a way to pull it all together.

yqqIslu2egDjW7TUt5OSVQ.text: Don't ... Just Don't!!!  Service was nonexistent.  Hostess finally sat us after finishing checking her email/text/Facebook ... reading War and Peace ... etc.  it was a long time and place was empty???  Left 10 minutes after we were seated as is became apparent service wasn't getting any better.  Save yourself some headache and hassle ... And just don't go!

3X44EmUZwscPNYExR3p8SQ.text: We had a great experience here and the food was awesome!  I had the fish and chips, my friends had the farfalle dish with pork belly and the San Pedro Shrimp Tray (which was amazing!).  The service was excellent.  My only complaint was the bathroom.  It's male and female and obviously the men can't aim, so there was a mess on the floor. ugh  They need to separate this so us ladies don't stick to the floor because of messy guys. It was gross.

kl54d4haLyNtn2zEn1IHUw.text: Try to keep to keep short, after two hours of the worse experience I've ever had anywhere. I highly recommend over looking this place! 2 hours of wrong beers, cold food, having to get our own silverware. Manager on duty never coming out to apologize nor check in on us. When he finally did, he tried giving us FREE SHOTS as an apology for our experience there. It was a Monday,  not interested. Fast forward he took care of all our checks. Thought the situation was done.. two days later my brother who was with our group that night, also used to work with the manager who was on duty. Image attached below on the text he got form him. Fast forward I went to restaurant to speak to owner about this. He refused to speak with us. Told the manager to "handle it" I knock on door to get his attention, he told me to "loose the attitude" fast forward he tells me there has been issues with manager and that the "2 week notice" is in play. He was defensive of employee and talked over me. We left. 2 days later.. manager still working there and BRAGGING they didn't let him go. This is disgusting. Shame on this business. For condoning this behavior and allowing employees to make RACIAL COMMENTS.

rSU6oj4d5Qx0t2Kp3mrVBg.text: Came after shopping around. First we were sat in a very dark corner and my chair had a large puddle in it from a leak on the ceiling, ruined my clothes. We moved to another table only to have a dozen dead flies on and beside it. (pics included) Asked about the restrooms and nobody seemed to know where they were. Once the appetizers came I was lucky enough to get a basket of fried green tomatoes with a side of grease chunks!!! Definitely a dining experience. Such a shame because this place used to be really cool.

Cf0PyPBEc-uzgUo4nVtYag.text: Over been here for brunch and dinner. Food is below average. Not that great:( drinks aren't too bad. It's rustic inside, with a nice roof top area and patio downstairs. Great for drinks. Would definitely recommend for outdoor drinks:) BUT...Get food somewhere else before or after though.

EotrpUPdWL_2uh5XrAvgSw.text: I've frequented the Peculiar Rabbit, and always forget how great their food tastes whenever I come.  This last time, I ate dinner there for my friend's 30th birthday.   Our server/bartender was quick on her feet and awesome and providing food and drink recommendations, I don't think we ever had to wait on her (even though she was busy) and she never left our drinks empty!   Overall, a great dining experience with a great server/bartender. If you go, make sure you request to sit upstairs! The vibe throughout the restaurant is stellar through and through, but the upstairs is very unique and intimate.   For food, I ordered the bangers on top of a pastry crust, over a bed of mashed potatoes and cranberries - delish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

0cChAeq-BIqTnDT-Wi8tbQ.text: The brunch here was pretty decent. Not great as the waffles were pretty cold but the chicken was good and crispy and the $3 mimosas or $5 double mimosas were a good bargain. Our server was excellent. This place really needs to consider the parking situation. Leaving a $28 brunch to then be forced to pay over three times that to have the scammy boot company Wheel Blockers remove a boot from my car all while treating us like criminals was absolutely not worth it. Don't think I'll be spending much time in this part of town or at this restaurant due to this experience. This is a great way to keep people from patronizing an area...but maybe that's what Plaza Midwood is going for.

cQwUh5b6fDCHQ9P0clLwww.text: Great spot to grab drinks with a good view of the city. Loved their Deep Eddy Watermelon Cooler. It was light and refreshing. A perfect summer drink. The bartender was incredibly nice and helpful.

zoTZ29lvC9Nm1BzfxbbcsA.text: Friday at 6:30 pm.  Mostly empty which should have been first clue. Not allowed to sit at a table on deck if not eating. Yet almost all tables are empty. Asked for a titos with a splash of water and extra lemon and got a glass of water with a splash of titos with very little ice and the smallest lime ever. I was warned that this place isn't good but wanted to give it a shot.  One and done.

ZIyEiqAaTY89hLGR_jNeoA.text: I have to say every time I've some to this place over the past two years, it's slowly gone downhill. Last week, it hit rock bottom.   Let me begin by giving you the best reason to go... the view. The skyline view of Charlotte is still one of the best in the city. Go on a date, go to impress out of town friends (if you're not eating), do not go to eat.   I say 'anymore' because I used to like coming here... their chicken and waffles was one of the best in the city. Came with eggs for brunch or Brussels sprouts for lunch or dinner. It was my faithful go to.   But let's stop playing nostalgia. We sat at the rooftop with some friends a few weeks ago... The service was slow and they only had a limited menu. The food was just not well executed. The bread was stale, the fries were scarce... not what I'm accustomed to for out of town guest trying to give them the best Charlotte has to offer.  I'm usually not this harsh, but the linear progression down of this place makes me feel that it's no longer a good option in my book.

qFbPatXbFqvxm0JoItcMJg.text: This restaurant is an American farm-to-fork gastropub located in Plaza Midwood. They've got delicious food, a range of drinks, and a great view of the city -- enjoy brunch or dinner with this view of the Charlotte skyline. When the weather is nice, this place is bustling.  I recommend the Shepherd's Pie: this entree is DELICIOUS! This dish is made with English peas, rainbow carrots, celery, onions and tender pulled lamb, topped with wonderfully fluffy double whipped potatoes and sharp cheese. Hello savory!  I also recommend the Chicken and Waffle Sammich: this sandwich is huge! Low country spiced fried chicken, bacon marmalade, and honey nut drizzled arugula make this sandwich what it is. If you get this sandwich for dinner, ask for a side of maple syrup (you only get syrup included with the brunch version of this, so you have to ask for this separate if you like your sandwich sweet).

JKZoEoDFGDkhZuaOSUgHyg.text: Wanted to enjoy some Sunday Brunch so we decided to visit this place. We sat on the rooftop because the weather was perfect. Well we sat and waited 10 min and know one came over. We over  heard one of the servers yelling saying he's going home. As we continued to wait we looked down on the street and see the same server yelling "f_ck peculiar rabbit I quit" while pointing his middle finger towards the restaurant. Well I think that was our server and we still waited in the blazing heat for waters someone finally came to greet us after 20 min and apologized and explain how our original server just quit Blah blah blah yea bro we heard but can we get waters it's hot. You would think after getting such crap service a manger would stop by but no everyone was runny around chaotic.

pvxqVB5QSv84-PNXRzojYQ.text: Have to say, completely disappointed.  Im in town for 1 day for work and every website i read had this on their list of places to go.    Went at 7pm, an ok crowd in the outdoor biergarten.  1 group on the 1st floor, no one on the second floor and 1 group on the 3rd floor.  I went out to the rooftop as on an 80 degree night at dusk, this should be the draw.  I should have known something was wrong when there was only 1 couple and a group of 4 guys out there.  I sat there for 25 minutes and got no service.  4 different staff came up to check on the other groups and all ignored me and my attempts to flag them down.    Poor management, i wouldn't give these people a dollar.

bmpKKV3ySmQyLHBeBXnlpw.text: The name, Peculiar Rabbit, is not the only delightful aspect of this newcomer.  The 2nd floor of the restaurant provides for a cozy evening enjoying dinner with friends followed by drinks and a beautiful view from the rooftop bar.  The menu is extensive with something at each price point.  Besides the pimento cheese appetizer, nothing really stood out as amazing on the menu.  That is not say that what I had was not good, it just wasn't stellar.    Peculiar Rabbit has pretty good food, but it's appeal isn't really the cuisine.  PR provides a great space in Plaza Midwood where you can gather with friends for drinks or dinner.  The drink menu is wide and sure to appeal to the beer fan or wino.    Lastly, I see all these issues with the parking.  Let's just face it, most of the restaurants in Plaza Midwood do not provide parking.  So park on the street like you would have to if you went to the Penguin, Common Market, Thomas Street and so on.

Ez9uLPJthjkxr_7xStdW5g.text: Waited for an hour and our food still was not served  Two of us waited an hour and had to leave because our food had still not arrived. It's probably a pretty good place to while away an afternoon drinking and finally eating - we did see two of the six tables in our area served food over the hour we were there - but as a restaurant I would recommend avoiding it for now.

PJ68XJUk07lpbEFV6NDT2Q.text: I have no idea what's driving some of the overly negative reviews here.  But in short, we had a wonderful experience from start to finish.  In long...  First, the whole parking thing.  Yes, there's a convenient lot right across the street that charges $5.  This is a complete non-issue if you are planning on having dinner, because you are going to drop $50 if you get drinks, starters, and a couple entrees and the restaurant will credit you back the $5.  That being said, the restaurant didn't set up shop in a strip mall with 9,000 open spaces, so deal with it, really not worth griping about.  Second, the facility.  As Charlotteans, we should be thrilled that someone was willing to invest so much money in the local food scene.  It's obvious someone spent a whole bunch of cash on this place and it really shows.  I didn't go upstairs, but the bar area is really nice.  Beautiful wood finish, warm, cozy, inviting.    Third, the service.  Nice greeting, quickly shown to our seats, and drink order taken almost immediately.  It was clear there is still a bit of a learning curve for the waitress in being able to talk about the menu, but for a place that's relatively new, I don't really mind if she has to check her notes a few times.  She made some good recommendations nonetheless.  Fourth, the food.  We started with the English Cheddar Rarebit and Lebanese Lollipop.  Rarebit was buttermilk biscuits with a nice beer cheese and tomato confit.  Biscuits tender and flaky, great strong cheese.  The Lamb skewer "lollipop" might have been my best bite of the night.  Tons of flavor in that bite alone and that's not including the Hummus and salsa fresca it came with.  Starters, big hit.  One minor nit was that our bread came out after our starters.  It was very good, crusty homemade bread, but the butter it came with was heavily salted.  Not sure if by design or not.  A bit too salty for my taste and I tend to like salty.  For mains, I got the Oxtail Poutine and my wife got the Mussels.  The Oxtail Poutine was off the charts savory goodness.  I mean, house cut french fries with oxtail gravy and cheese.  Very heavy dish but crazy delicious.  The Mussels were very good as well.  Make sure to save bread or ask for more to use in the Mussel broth.    Lastly, dessert.  We got the Car Bomb.  Chocolate pate, mouse, shortbread.  It was really good, but my wife is more the chocolate person.  I would have gone for the fresh doughnuts or fried ice cream.  All of this ended up being way too much food.  We were able to share and we could easily have dropped one of the mains.  All in, before tip, we spent $66 including alcohol.  Dropping a main would have put us around $50-60 and I don't consider that a bad investment for dinner date with food this good.  Way better than spending upwards of $100+ for a fancy steakhouse.  So, bottom line, ignore the star rating and give this place a shot.  If you are a fan of the gastropub genre, this place is well-deserving of your $$$.  I'd love to go again.

6buw_AlRQ0drpgA0CmMH2w.text: I really hate that I have to give them 3 stars.  Went in on Sunday to have brunch and watch the Panthers game.  The hostess told me it would be 1 hour wait for a party of 4.  The funny thing is the patio and 1st floor dining room was barely half full.  We said ok, we will go elsewhere.   Went across the street and ate, then came back to watch the game about 45min later and have a few drinks.  We walked in and went upstairs.  They sat us immediately  (only a few ppl up there) and handed us menus.  I queationed why they were able to serve us immediately.  The waiter told us the kitchen was just backed up and the hostesses were told to tell people there was a long wait so they would go away.  To me..thats just bad business.   We still decided to stay for drinks.  The bar and wait staff were good and attentive.   The watching experience wasn't great.  They didn't have the volume up for the game, they were just playing music.  The waiter told us the management doesn't want the volume up and that it's not a sports bar.  Crazy right?  The tv's are small and placed it horrible locations.  My opinion the management needs to fix some issues.  They are missing out on revenue for game days.  The bar is beautiful and in a great location in Plaza Midwood, I hate that it is not being used to its full potential.

e0Hog_3ylyGIK7ljhskX5g.text: Was in town for the weekend and wanted an eclectic menu experience...picked the right place! We went around 8:15 with no reservations and was told there would be an hour wait..not bad for a Saturday night.  Sat at the bar and had a glass of riesling with the mussels,  very good! The broth and the tomatoes paired very well, although the menu said it came with crusty bread but my bread was a soft sourdough..ehh. We waited for 50 minutes and got our table for four. My husband ordered the bbq ribs, sooo delicious!  Nice crispy on the outside, tender on the inside saucy ribs with a creamy corn pudding side. I had the butternut lasagne..amazing. Surrounded by a tomato pure sauce, it was not overly cheesey with tender butternut squash and a creamy bechemel sauce. My mouth is drooling thing about it. I ate it all lol Too full for dessert, but I will definitely be back here!

9SgkxZ1ryE1up5AuPbn3uw.text: Cool space ! We were in town for the Fleetwood Mac concert and stopped here to get drinks before heading anywhere. Built more vertically than it is wide, there are Lots of steps in this place!   We sat at the very top, it is open with minimum covering which i loved. I sat with a group of 6 just drinking wine but we waited 25 minutes to see a waitress.   Then I order a glass to share the wine with everyone, a coke with lime and a shot of Jameson neat. Nothing but the wine glass shows up for the remainder of our short stay. It was all good though, we ate at Soul Gastrolounge after and it smoothed everyone over.

KCAHlk2K-yYgsED-a-PiOQ.text: Like most people in Plaza Midwood, I've been watching construction happen on The Peculiar Rabbit and hoping for the best. So when I learned their grand opening was last night, a few friends and I decided to try it out. We made a reservation so we were seated immediately as we arrived, at a large table on the main level.  The beer selection is on point, and our waitress was very knowledgeable about each craft beer on tap - we were thrilled to find that their imperial pints were on special for the grand opening (yyyeeeessssss!). When it comes to the menu, we were all kind of disappointed. The dishes run the gamut - not in a good way - and just seem mismatched. My table ordered the beet salad, oxtail poutine, and fish and chips. Our server just kind of walked away in the middle of our ordering and we had to flag her down to finish...very odd.  The wait for our food wasn't very long at all. Unfortunately, we were all kind of bummed with our dishes. The beet salad, while beautifully plated, is just...there. Cut up beets with some goat cheese and bean sprouts. Meh. The fish and chips got an A+. The poutine....woof. The fries were thin and mushy, the gravy had started to gel, and the cheese was sparse. Super disappointing.  Maybe in the near future they will tame down their menu and adjust their pricing (as of right now, for what you get, it's definitely not worth it). Proceed with caution.

oJ8RfiA5diamkqTYpC3Iiw.text: The rooftop view here is amazing - definitely one of the best in Charlotte. The corn fritters here are pretty good but the jury is still out on the remainder of the menu since my visit was mainly for drinks. Speaking of drinks, the Moscow mules are decent. Service was a little slow but staff was very friendly and informative. I'll give this place another try.

RekjMBovvchtzpUQlwYsCw.text: What a great addition to the Plaza-Midwood restaurant scene!  I've been twice now and am pretty excited about this new place.  My family and I went on a Saturday for brunch.  We are two adults with an 8 year old and 3 year old twins.  We really, really liked the brunch menu.  My husband had two different fancy beers, which he liked.  I didn't have anything to drink, but saw some other folks having yummy looking Bloody Mary's and Mimosas.  But it was the food that was delicious!  Husband had a burger and I their version of a BLT.  The kids had burgers and grilled cheeses.  We were all very happy with our meals and I thought mine was really yummy!  Today, I went back for lunch with a girlfriend.  I had the Vidalia Onion Bisque and my friend had a chicken wrap thingy.  She LOVED her lunch and snarfed it down.  My soup was fine, but I'm honestly less of a cream based soup fan than a broth based soup fan.  So I would have liked a broth based soup option.  It was still fine.    We are planning on going back again.  When we were there for lunch, the let us wander around the place looking at the views.  The upstairs view of downtown is worth coming and having a drink or three with some friends!  Kind of fancy for Plaza-Midwood!

r01UlNyy3LNtiymou3Y3vQ.text: Had dinner and drinks on the fabulous rooftop bar -- the drink special was delicious - a blood orange margarita with salt foam (very cool presentation also!).  Tea brined wings and corn dogs were both delicious, as was the fish and chips.  The tartar sauce that comes with that fish is really yummy!  we also had the southern salad, which was the only item that was a little underwhelming for me.  Not bad, but not as good as the other things we had.  I have eaten here a few times, and had about everything on the starter menu at one time or another - they are all really good!  Friendly service, nice daily drink specials, good beer selection -- and that view!  great place for a sunset dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the rooftop terrace #peculiarrabbit

f4FYHSTJWo6bNJv_MvD6nQ.text: Not great food, not great service. I've been twice and won't eat there again. I might go back for drinks on the rooftop unless they find a way to eff up the view.

7p3_jiwCRSvuzEjjbQhcHA.text: We stopped here for brunch and sat up on the rooftop. It was chilly up there but as long as you have a sweater you're good! The menu has some pretty good choices and I went with the Eggs Oscar and a side of their soup of the day (corn chowder). My sister had the club sandwich with a sunny side up egg added to it. Service was decent and it didn't take too long to get our food or drinks (mimosas and bloody Mary's). My meal was good, I really liked the crab cakes and the grilled asparagus it came with was cooked just right. Blood Mary was made with a mix and just kind of blah, although the mimosas weren't too bad. I really didn't care for our server at all..he was just soo boring. Loved the view and restaurant, food was good overall, but this won't be a place I'm dying to go back to.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Oscar with corn chowder

d-v3OUo7ksF1wYb2u_Vfew.text: Popped in on a gorgeous College Football Saturday ( before the game!) just to see what the Peculiar Rabbit was all about.  Was greeted warmly by the hostess who even gave us some good natured SEC ribbing which I always appreciate.  We were confused by the absolutely empty 1st floor, but  frankly it was kind of an off time for a Saturday. But we forged up to the 2nd floor and  caught our groove at the bar. There were several  groups dining and few folks at the bar.   Just there for a quick bite and drink, we ordered a couple of beers and perused  their light-bite ( lunch?) menu. Chose the soft pretzels - a win - and the asparagus with poached egg - also a win.  Bartender was pleasant and professional.  They definitely spent some coin on the renovation and it looks great but perhaps a little, generic? Which is not a bad thing, just no funk or flair like some of the other neighboring joints.  But, CAN WE STOP WITH THE GASTROPUB MONIKER, PLEASE? Disclosure: After spending 10 years on the West Coast before Charlotte I am BEYOND OVER the use of the the term Gastropub  so maybe I am just being a big crank about that.  Moving on... The 3rd floor - outside patio - has fantastic views of the city and I am always a fan of more outdoor seating with a view. The biggest misstep in design for me is the lack of outside bar upstairs. It screams for  bar.  Overall, I though the Peculiar Rabbit was perfectly A-OK. Would like to check it out again at a different time, taste some more food and see how the vibe changes.

pqkQ38kwJqDPUwYv-wwp7Q.text: Fantastic.  Service was great.  My wife's burger was probably one of the best I've had. My beef short ribs were great.  And the Brussel Sprouts were as good as I've had.  One of my new favorite places.

ODBGZgBDvX029x739FNzBw.text: Great food with a gorgeous rooftop. Been here a few times now and there's a lot of hits but quite a few misses as well. To start off, the food is beyond tasty and props to the chef for coming up with eccentric flavors that simply just work well together. Stopped by after a yoga class on a Friday and shared a slew of apps - we ended up getting the pretzels, the disco fries and the devils on horseback. Gotta admit, the disco fries were way better than I first anticipated, topped with gravy, shredded cheese and cilantro. The devil was bacon-wrapped figs with goat cheese and a sweet beet sauce. Awesome after workout chill spot on the patio and we really enjoyed ourselves.  Last time I headed over was for lunch with a few co-workers. The service was just not good at all. The server never smiled and hardly ever came by so our glasses were constantly empty. Our order took almost 30 full minutes - really? 30 minutes during a lunch hour on a Wednesday? I ordered the turkey burger with a side of beer cheese soup and both were great... just wish I could say the same about the server. But this seems to always happen with the service. I've only had good service one time (after the yoga class) and every other time it's been slow or unfriendly. Or both. So I always make sure to come by only when I'm not in a hurry... which really is a terrible thing to have to do.   On a side note as well, know that at night you can't grab a table without ordering food. If you ask for a table but are only ordering drinks, you'll be asked to move. Seriously. Even if the tables are empty you must sit at the bar, stand or go elsewhere. Although at night, I'm more likely to rack up my bill with drinks not food so their loss.But if you are looking for a well-crafted meal, this is a good place to check out.

zK2gx4yQGMXPefdj8E65Qg.text: For now, Peculiar Rabbit is only getting 3 stars from me. That is solely because aside from having a small bite of my husband's pretzel, I haven't tried any of their food. Despite not trying their food, I am OBSESSED with a) the view from the roof and b) their perfectly spicy bloody marys. The Peculiar Rabbit is now going to be yet another "go to" place when we have out of town guests visiting. It's in a fantastic neighborhood, close to several of our other favorite hangouts, has local beer on tap, and a view of the Charlotte skyline that is unmatched. I haven't been at night yet, so I'm only judging it based on what I experienced at ~2pm on a Sunday afternoon, but I wouldn't mind heading back there next Sunday to soak in some sun and enjoy the views/bloody marys yet again.   My only suggestion, if anyone from Peculiar Rabbit is reading, is to add a few umbrellas or shade structures to the roof. I got absolutely FRIED sitting on the roof for 2 hours, I know I should've worn sunscreen... but I totes would've sat under an umbrella if I had one available.   Other than the sun sensitivity issue, I can find nothing but positive things to say about the Peculiar Rabbit. I hope to try it for dinner and late night soon!

PjiX03FA2_XTe6ApEn3E1g.text: Jackalope Jacks has been contributing to the Elizabeth neighborhood's groove ever since 1994 and its new restaurant concept, The Peculiar Rabbit, will extend that vibe into the Plaza-Midwood neighborhood.  Apparently this bar/restaurant/gastropub has been in the works for years now and renovation and expansion of the old ecclesiastical building feels like it has been going on for a long time, and undeniably it has.    In the 2000s, this used to be the location of the old Steeple Lounge, it may not be immediately apparent to those not from the neighborhood, but this building is not entirely new but rather it is an expansion on an existing building.  Indeed it is unrecognizable.   Ambiance: Strangely, the exterior is similar to the new Cook-Out restaurants that clashes with the contemporary "Arts & Crafts" interior.  Despite the clashing aesthetics, the rich woods and dark colors complement one another very well.  This restaurant/bar is three-story's tall with each floor having its own bar.  The main bar is on the first floor and throughout the whole place you can find seating area for eating.  The terrace with spectacular views of downtown Charlotte on the third floor is already very popular and reservations are highly encouraged in order to eat al fresco.  Food & Drink: They have over twenty craft beers (including local) and an array of wines by the glass and bottle. For those who prefer non-alcoholic drinks there are non-alcoholic beers, root beers, sweet teas, juices, and soft drinks.  From experience, one would expect this to be solely a burger place.  Since they just opened, they are offering a limited version of their full menu.  However, they offer more than just the typical "bar food."    The types of dishes you can find are:   *Asian Fusion - such as Bahn Mi, Vietnamese Hoagie *British - such as Fish & Chips & Sheppard's Pie *New American - Burgers galore including vegetarian variations. *Poutine - French-Canadians rejoice, but their version comes with oxtails.  ~Prices in the menu range from $10-$30.  Reasonable, and runs the gamut for different budgets.  If you want to eat a full meal here, you must order before 10:00pm, because after that the Peculiar Rabbit only offers drinks and "BarBites" (appetizers) till closing time.  I had the veggie burger and it was very tasty, it was tofu based, with shitake mushrooms, brown rice, rolled oats, and other delectable ingredients.  My experience here was nice and from looking at the enthusiastic crowd tonight, one can deduct this establishment will become a very popular locale in the near future.

eq5XeUbocxhGkI66eizu-g.text: The biggest impression The Peculiar Rabbit made was when I was leaving last night. Let me rewind to my dinner last night with a friend to catch up. We had reservations via OpenTable (this venue doesn't give dining points FYI) at 6pm and as the evening was warm preceded to dine on the upstairs patio.   At 6pm the downstairs bar was empty and we proceeded straight up the stairs. The local art on the wall is a good choice for such a prominent neighborhood location. Still it was odd to walk through what used to be a goth dance club to see it all fancy and covered in brightly lit wood. The view is indeed, really, really nice. Our waiter's knowledge of the beer list wasn't comprehensive when I asked him about the type & bitterness of some of the selections but he was able to make a suggestion when I told him the style I preferred. Kudos to them for carrying Breckenridge Brewery's Agave Wheat that I discovered on a recent ski trip. My friend and I were tempted by the PBR PEI's but split the baby back rib sliders with granny smith apple slaw. He ordered the Shepard's Pie I went with the signature Peculiar Rabbit.  I was surprised at how long our appetizer was taking so I believe the kitchen is still figuring out their timing. Indeed the sliders we wanted to share arrived just after  as our main dishes. The fries that accompanies the appetizer looked great but just weren't as crispy as I was expecting but tasted good. The apple slaw on the sliders is really great pairing. I can't speak for my my friend's Shepard Pie as it was gone by the time I looked up to ask. I was engrossed with the peculiar rabbit. The rabbit itself is executed sublimely, with a mild and not overwhelming flavor in the cabernet sauce that envelopes the rabbit meat without overwhelming or hiding it's game meat earthiness. The mashed potatoes the rabbit rests upon are smooth for a rich experience as a dish.  So to recap the food is really good, not outrageous but certainly a price point generally above the rest of the neighborhood but Lulu's, the service/kitchen pacing is mildly underwhelming (and really the only thing holding back a 4th star) but  not impressive and I've already stated the view is great. So let's get to the atmosphere which really was impressed upon me as I left and more people were there.   I can completely see the Peculiar Rabbit becoming the new it place for first or second dates. If you want to impress the first date, spend the money, order dinner and eat on the top level patio. For a more relaxed or mingling evening stay on the second floor & sample multiple dishes from the bar snack menu or drift to the back room for skee ball or bumper pool. To pick up a new upwardly mobile professional friend hang out inside at the first level bar and for a first date cozy up at the tables & heat lamps out front to people watch Snug Harbor or Soul's patrons.

Ka6VQo9zDWka4u8oXBdDmA.text: Zack is awesome!  Great service, great food! He knew all the specials and recommended the best food!  In and out with a large party in an hour which is great!

vALlUVJrNNlpH3uqUsvv0g.text: This place is a 3 to 4 stars toss up. First of all I live in the neighborhood, and yet I don't understand the up-in-arms vibes I am feeling with some of these reviews. So here is my honest and fair version after several visits, including the soft opening.   The design of the space is a little odd.  The first impression is that the space is a little tight.  Reason being there are so many oddly divided areas, like the hidden game area behind the stairs where staffs go in and out of kitchen and a separate dining area on the first floor.  The place is an otherwise well decorated, simple, pub-y kinda joint. The service has always been good, though sometimes I think the wait staffs just aren't that knowledgable about the menu. Bartenders were great and are always on their A game.   Beer selection is decent. Lots of local and domestic microbrews. The other night they had $4 pint on any winter seasonal. I think they have drink specials every time I have been here, so complaining about drink prices isn't warranted.   I haven't been back to the rooftop since the soft opening, which was too dark to eat (or see the other persons face for that matter). I don't know if they have fixed it by now.  Frankly I can't truly enjoy any outdoor patio space in Charlotte ever since it becomes smokers' paradise. I may pop back up there when the weather gets nicer.   Food... It is their weakness.  There are always hits and misses.  I have had the mussels and the onion soup on my first visit.  Mussels were a little overcooked in my opinion. The onion soup has always tasted good but it's a very different consistency (it's a cross between creamy and fluffy... Yes, it has a fluff to it). And it's never hot enough for me as a soup. I have had the banh mi in the late night bite menu, which wasn't a bad deal since it comes with a side.  The meat was a bit overly salty that time, but I may give it another try.  The most recent visit I had the Swedish meatballs. It's a typical tapa size, 3 meatballs with mashed rutabaga.  I found the rutabaga to be fabulous but the meatballs were a little tough in textures.  I think if they can step up the game with the food, it will definitely be a 4 stars place.   I do agree that paid parking isn't cool, but I think that even for uptown. They blocking off an area for themselves is no worse than my city which I pay taxes for telling me I cant park on the street and I must pay to park in private parking lot or garage. At least here we still have plenty of free spaces, just have to walk a little further.   I don't know what beef people have with this management, but I truly believe those personal feelings should not be used as "reviews.". This place is no more "out of character" than Whiskey Warehouse around the corner. At least I always have good services at the Rabbit, can't say that for WW.

H6j9J0Sepeg_pkEidgXMlg.text: I REALLY enjoyed my experience here. How have I never been here?  So we went for Sunday brunch, up on the rooftop. How, you ask? (And you ask because apparently there's always a pretty long wait..) It was hot. And we just sucked it up and endured the heat, and got a nice September tan while we were at it.   I ordered the Chicken Biscuit, and the Lady ordered a salad. The chicken salad was spectacular, topped with hot sauce, a big cheddar biscuit, fantastically flavored fried chicken, cheddar, and scallions. Really filling, really wonderful.   The rooftop itself was an awesome space. There was a fantastic view of the city, and of most of Plaza. I definitely want to come back for regular service dinner, and hopefully they'll get an updated 5 star!

zc1LNauzEw9Is2TwLsX_cw.text: After a 3rd visit, I had to give this place 5 stars. Unique menu, attentive waitstaff and nice view of the city's skyline. The chicken and waffles and short rib grilled cheese sandwich are both must haves.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

VJKC3B7beAel0W2KFHAOFw.text: We came in on a Saturday night and were seated right away. It may have been because we chose patio seating but the weather was amazing. Our waiter was super attentive. They ran out of spinach artichoke dip and he recommended we try the Queen City poutine, which was AMAZING. He also gave it to us on the house since they didn't have what we wanted initially and that further justifies the five stars. My husband and I both ordered the classic burger and it was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. I loved it because you can actually taste the good quality beef instead of overbearing seasonings. It's a very hipster scene and the inside felt a bit loud for my taste (perfect for my 20's, not so much for my 30's). All in all, good atmosphere, great food, and amazing service.

iUJMWeB8tYDpsNDp4oWzyg.text: Food is good sometimes, service is almost always bad.   food to try: brisket cheese sandwich.   The rooftop has amazing views, which makes me come back and give them another chance.

_tSqxJWjW4V1bzABG_qDIQ.text: I love this place--the atmosphere is friendly, there are lots of different places to sit, including a roof patio with a great view of uptown Charlotte. I would give it a five but every time I have been there, the meal has been slow to arrive and it is almost inevitable that at least one or two menu items are not available. The waitstaff is friendly and on the ball--IMHO the issue is in the kitchen. Worth the time, tho--good and interesting food.

yNlFMaSQo_iAFOliKboDhw.text: From The views to the amazing and friendly service to the mouth watering food this place was a fantastic choice for restaurant week this year. The food was beyond tasty. The Carolina poutine, Caesar salad and short Rib entree were all outstanding. Finished with a ridiculously Seleucids slice of cheesecake. I'm already checking the men and planning my trip back there! You must check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short ribs and some Of the best Brussel sprouts I&#39;ve ever had! I wanted to lick the plate lol

DI3J5gzJc1fVE7Hi4PW2Ew.text: 40 minutes to get our beers, food arrived with no silverware or napkins- which we had to track down. Our friends drinks took 1- 1/2 hours to arrive. Yes folks, you read that right- 90 minutes. Abysmal experience. Reminded us why of why no one who lives here in Plaza Midwood goes there. Manager and server were very apologetic and bought us some drinks, but that doesn't change the fact that the establishment is systemically broken.

PrgnzqGjJM4uGxDdDkQrNQ.text: Was extremely disappointed with my first and probably only time here. The service was very mediocre, took 15 minutes to get one drink, forgot to ring in part of our order so that took another 15 minutes to receive, portions of food are small and overpriced, and to top it off the server added automatic 18% gratuity when it is stated on the menu that should only be done with parties of 10 or more (we had 9). Not impressed and felt very taken advantage of here. Will not be returning.

eov0GNyEiPYAcFeIBqxUFg.text: The food was delicious, however, that is honestly the only positive thing I have to say. We had a reservation and it was not until we had ordered drinks that we were informed they were transitioning between menus and they didn't have ANY of the ingredients to make any of their "specialty" drinks. Then someone accidentally dropped a glass and although it was loud no one even came to the table to assist in cleaning up the glass. So, after using all of our napkins we had to ask for a towel from the bar to finishing cleaning it up.... still no one checked on the table and no, no one asked if we would like to replace the drink. Overall the service was beyond lackluster and hopefully you won't need any napkins because they will only be replaced in quantities of threes even though you have a table of ten.

uz_LeOgHaCGOVD1Kxmbdag.text: Last night i was looking for somewhere different to go eat and stumbled upon peculiar rabbit real chill environment perfect way to describe it is bougie on a budget we ate on the rooftop which was even nicer where you can over look some of the skyline downtown but mostly central avenue venues a different kind of vibe but i liked it i had what one of the waitresses called an adult grilled cheese lol i was skeptical about ordering but it was quite tasty and filling the drink i ordered was called a pain killer which i more so ordered for the name funny i know right? The drink was ok i wasnt too crazy about it. My friend ordered some type of pork loin which looked really good i dont eat pork so i didn't indulge it was drenched in some type of delicious looking mushroom sauce i would definetly come back here again i need to find a drink that i actually love there. The name of they're alcoholic beverages are cute! The staff was amazing and funny i had one guy photo bomb my picture ! Thank you guys there at peculiar rabbit for making this a great experience you can check out some footage on my youtube chanel the video titled dollar tree fail at youtube.com/shaylaflare
