Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

IznjbHWamfSsL8cFNMb18w.text: Great food, service is great, nice atmosphere.  I like coming here before it gets to crowded, otherwise service slows down and it gets a little loud. Great on a sunny day

xqQ_f3iSFlhwM6y5sEwQSA.text: The view from the rooftop can't be beat. Beautiful view of the city.   The menu is very small. It felt more like a bar menu than a full service restaurant menu. Everything we ordered was tasty. I enjoyed the watermelon salad, and my burger was  juicy and cooked to order. I also sampled the mussels and the chicken (from the chicken and waffles). Both also good.   Unfortunately our service was poor and very inconsistent. We had young children with us, so we ordered their meals when we ordered our first round of drinks. Long story short, the kid's meals arrived AFTER all of our other food (appetizers then entrees). It was difficult to get staff attention, so getting basic items like silverware, even after there was food on the table) was a chore.   Too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lovely view of the city sunset from rooftop bar.

VXop01cNOIveobCFqbZ2Cg.text: Went for brunch and what a hot mess this place is.  -Waited 30 mins for a table when there were more than a dozen tables empty.  -waited an hour for our food.  -one of the three dishes came out cold and soggy and incorrect -we asked the manager if we could have a redo on the soggy meal (a quick easy dish, the avocado toast.) he was defensive saying "well, everyone's been waiting for their food, everyone decided to show up all at once today.)  -the redo meal came back incorrect with two ingredients missing.   I was so hangry, I gave up and ate it as is and left to forget the terrible brunch experience.   To management: your kitchen is doing a new brunch menu? Great. Do more testing and polishing before launching. Train your staff better.  We were served chicken and waffles with no syrup, biscuits with no butter, food with no utensils. We had to ask for EVERYTHING. Also my avocado toast was disgusting. Store-bought preserved gross guac, not fresh avocado? Yuck.  To the manager, Kyle: don't ever tell clients bad service and wrong orders is the norm because you got slammed. That's not our fault. Send over a round of drinks. Apologize. Act like you care, even if you're stressed.   Bright spots: The server was delightful and tried so hard to make up for the abhorrent food service. Good views. A nice roofdeck.   Such a shame this place isn't better.

nFmzlA4ILxqt3w0epxJmLg.text: My husband and I came here on Sunday, simply because we had a $5 off coupon. In the end, the food was an A-ok experience. However, our waitress was absolutely incredible. I really should have gotten her name!   We got here right at 12 (who would arrive before 12 for brunch on a Sundays anyways.....dumb alcohol laws in NC....brunch without mimosas is just a no in my book!). I ordered a double mimosa. It was good. Not completely sure if it was $8 good. However, it was a nice pour. My husband got the Bloody Mary. It came with all these things attached to the skewer, which is just so fun! I think it was like shrimp, an egg, okra, another shrimp.   The waitress brought out some fresh made scones to start off with. They were absolutely delish. Apparently, the chef makes a batch of scones every Sunday and they basically pass them out for free until they run out. Today's batch was a blackberry lemonade scone. Probably the best part of the meal. The early bird gets the scone is what our waitress said!  For our meal, we ordered the corn fritters and then decided to split the shroom and spinach omelette with grits. The corn fritters came out suuuuuper hot. They were just alright. Nothing completely amazing. The aioli with it was a nice additive though. The omelette was pretty good. There was alot of mushrooms in it, which was great. I wasnt a huge fan of the cheese used....maybe it was swiss. Not completely sure but I think it took a way a bit from the flavor. The cheesy grits were A-mazing though!! I believe my exact quote to my husband was that I was contemplating licking the bowl. Since we split the dish, I had to give up half the grits and that was a very hard thing to do!   Pretty good experience but the waitress was just on it the entire brunch meal. She was super personable and made our experience there!

ZWLjOUkxYbKRLhgUclOFSg.text: Brunch/Breakfast was good and priced well. Why are the coffee cups so small?  I met friends here for brunch one lazy Saturday and we had to wait about 20 minutes or so for a table, we sat at the bar and since it was almost noon, had a cocktail - they have a good specliaty list. The drink was good.  Once seated we placed an order for each of us (eggs, bacon etc) and then some french toast for the table, since all of us wanted to try that.   My impressions:  1) Coffee cups are too small. If you are going to have coffee mugs that small, leave a carafe at the table, so we can re-pour. The coffee itself was really good quality though. I wonder if the small cups are to slow us down on drinking it all.  2) Service is very slow, but not unpleasant. They just seemed a bit confused sometimes.  3) All the food was well prepared and tasty.  4) Good ambience and cute set up.  They have a killer view of Uptown - and the roof top bar is the best.  I do have to mention that the server forgot to put in our french toast order till much later and so we had to wait for it, it didn't come out with the other items as requested.

WomNJwtCeWtpx0FGDvK2wQ.text: That rooftop deck, though. So perfect. Those mules. Drank up. The food. Yummy. I've had brunch and dinner here; solo and with friends. Each experience has been wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic American Burger and yummy brussel sprouts
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles. Cheese eggs.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mules and Views

gZVkFAP6K8MuYcUicai4tw.text: My original spot that my brother took my family was Soul. But since they didnt have indoor seating, because it was full, and there was a 30 minute wait time on a Sunday (they had outdoor seating, but it was too cold)... We came here. I'm glad that I had the chance to check out this place.  Located on the corner of two streets, it gives a feeling of it being up to dated and almost, dare I say "city like" feel? Hm, I guess that's what I was thinking when I walked in.  Inside, you'll find a nice open area and two floors. They have a full bar, my favorite place because you can see what they have on tap, and plenty of seating. Our waiter was Matt, and was a good one too (even though he sometimes forgot what we asked...I'll give him a break though.)  So lets get to the goodies. For appetizers we got devils on horseback. Not bad. The only problem I feel like this dish had was that it was loaded with cream cheese. I'm not in particular about it or fanatic, but it wasn't too bad.  Second appetizer was the fried pickles. I would also like to mention that they have fried okra mixed in there. These weren't bad, but nothing really amazing to compliment either.  Just fried pickles, okra, and some ranch dip.  The third appetizer was the Korean BBQ skewers. Now these, they're just lacking some flavor. I can see the potential of this, but also the portion I felt was a little too small and lacked the BBQ taste. I wish they would have just a little more taste and that would have made the difference for me.   The entree: I got the pasta and provisions pappardelle. You know that excitement feeling from reading the dish and then after tasting it, you have that "that hit the spot" feeling? Well, sadly I didn't get it this time. Yes, I finished my dish, but the aftermath of the dish was just okay. I don't know what it was about though because to me when I ate the pasta it was either too wet (I know theres cream with it, but it wasn't that type of wet) or too thick. The texture in my mouth felt as if I was eating something mushy.   Yet, more notably...the flavor of the cream sauce was good. So it was like eating flavorful mush!  (On the side note, my mother got the Shepard's Pie. This dish is great, I suggest it over what I got.)  Overall, this place I'm just going to give 3 stars. Some dishes lacked flavor and the price of the food I thought was a little pricey, but not too expensive. I would pay any price for some amazing flavor! Hey, at least I didn't have to sit in the cold for food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pasta and something pappardelle
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pickles (And Okra)
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean BBQ Skewers

1Ou7Da6GPFEkg25ku7Aoug.text: You come here for the view (which is the only reason this gets two stars instead of one). My boyfriend ordered a watermelon salad, which was little more than flaccid greens, shredded cheese, mealy watermelon and beef tops so chewy he actually had to go to the bathroom to spit it out. Do yourself a favor and skip the food menu, head to the rooftop. Or go elsewhere.

TyA4amQ2DPr9TeNY8S5iJQ.text: Had the overpriced burger.  Defiantly wasn't worth it.  Food is not worth the price.  The service wasn't good at all.  Took forever to get drinks refilled and to get keys up for the fries.  Waffle came out with out any syrup.  Wouldn't go back again.

S3dAkmHmwJJDwrwAwxXsbA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place especially its view of the skyline. If anyone is in from out of town this is one of my go to places to take them! The drinks are great my favorite right now is the apple mule. On my last visit I had a "rabbit" grilled cheese which is kale, squash, balsamic onions, smoked tomato puree, and melted cheddar on ciabatta and it was ahh-mazing! I have also had their brunch in the past which was equally as good I definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. This picture doesn&#39;t do the view justice!

zzd7xnV6-6H70vPLC0rZdA.text: Tried this place with a group of friends (4) last night and I'll have to say we were not impressed. The service was slow and I attentive.  The server was pleasant but, improperly trained.  I had the ribs and they were awful, I couldn't eat them. They were dry, fatty and full of gristle.  I told the waiter they were bad and he laughed and said it was winter????  My friends were not impressed with food either. The facility was really cool and the drinks were good. If the owners can improve the food quality and fix the service, it'd give them the chance to compete with the awesome restaurants in the area.  Great place for drinks...I wouldn't eat here again.

ecVw_6XfIPP4PtXFh5If-w.text: My wife and I ate there on Memorial Day, clearly understaffed, but our waitress was great. We had appetizers and both were good, the soft pretzels and chicken sliders. I would recommend  for a place to eat.

2KJaWxzFGC6mDijtlAo4Qw.text: Ambiance good. Service was good. Location is close to shops and boutiques. Food was ok. Bland omelette, grits. Pancakes were great! Sundays brunch mimosas are 4$!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pancakes
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo omlette

t-ftqXF4z1R8zZTtt7ULBw.text: Second visit.  Service so-so.  Food disappointing.  Both visits, one waitress took our drink and appetizer order after a bit of a wait, then another waitress actually waited on us.  Turnover was less than perfect; we had to ask for water a second time.  Then, we had to prompt our waitress a second time to get another round of drinks. IMHO, they were understaffed.  The pork belly was charred.  Barely edible.  But we'd already waited so long...  Mashed potatoes were tepid, not much more than body temperature.  The cioppino was flavorful, but overcooked.  The shrimp were rubbery.  The fish, mush.  The second floor was so loud, we could barely hear each other or the waitress.  The beer and wine selection were a plus, but getting a last minute reservation through OpenTable was the highlight of our visit.

EkqPikgKIIv1joW7O0-slQ.text: Went for dinner last night after Veg Fest. We were seated right away but were seated at a dirty table. The hostess cleaned it right away when I pointed out the food still on the table. When our waitress greeted us she told us how she didn't want to be there and how it sucks to work Saturday nights.  I ordered the cheeseburger-cooked medium and my friend ordered the lamb burger.  My burger was well done but the lamb was good. They were also out of the first three beers we tried to order.  I tried to like this place and this is my third time eating here and most likely my last. I wish they trained their staff better.

k3Ga4ONPnYGL7TB40cF-fw.text: Thanks Chef Mark and team for an amazing dinner!  Short ribs are the way to go people!!!

QCjkNf7zw1YH5XMNXiYnFw.text: Food is amazing got the lamb burger and possibly the best burger I have ever eaten. We got the drunken oyster appetizer and it was phenomenal. Service was great, personable server attentive and my beer was never empty. Only downside was that we came too early to sit on the rooftop patio but the street level patio was just fine. Highly recommended.

xqbofUuGvzorzFn4m_PArg.text: I've actually never written a review before but my experience at The Peculiar Rabbit motivated me.   Positives: Great space, two levels, beautiful interior.  Nice beer selection and the service was good.  My wife and I split a calamari appetizer which was nicely done and a nice portion for the price. Negatives: I ordered the Guiness beef stew and it was terrible.  I can't recall sending a dish back (unless its obviously under cooked, etc.) but last night I couldn't justify paying for this dish.  For around 15 dollars (can't recall the exact price) I was given a dish with one piece of beef in it and several spoon fulls of vegetables. Also, it was listed a Guiness beef stew and the broth tasted of canned beef broth.  The actually serving dish itself was quite large but the amount of food in it was equivalent to what you would expect in a appetizer size or bowl size of stew and mostly watery broth.   I sent the stew back and told the waiter that I wasn't interested in anything else.  After having sent something back you would expect a visit from the manager but we didn't receive one. I was not looking to complain but more wanted to give my honest opinion.  You would think they would want to hear the reason for it being sent back so it could be improved upon.     My wife ordered the mushroom risotto arancini which was tasty but was a little dry.  Not sure if it was made to order. We did order dessert (we had a groupon and wanted to get our money's worth) and got the apple gallette.  Again, very dry and did not seem fresh at all.  The dessert was barely warmed and filled with mostly raisins.   Again, it was a very cool spot and would consider going for drinks and maybe an appetizer but would definitely not consider eating there again.  They don't seem to be suffering at all, it was packed on a Tuesday, but they definitely need to work on their food.  The price is not worth the quality at all.

MO9vxy6x_DtfULzga4aZyA.text: Went there for dinner with some friends - the food was delicious and interesting - similar to The Liberty. Not sure if they have the same owners. However, the noise levels made conversation nearly impossible and the service was abysmally slow and careless.   However, definitely check out the view from the roof deck. My Abbe the best view of the skyline that I've seen so far.

r2GCIwxqiaC4DhE2bzxwjw.text: Wonderful place,!!!! Food was great nice vibe. Even though it's Bar for it was good quality good  Loved it

tM4ETnpqNo7O4ggV3oN4LQ.text: My Girlfriend and I want here Monday night 11-17 around 915pm. Quite empty, understandably,  grabbed a seat and was told that entree's weren't available only burgers and starters. Disappointed, (hence only the four stars) we had the beef tartare app. It was good. The bartender/server was great. Despite, closing up shop, she was nicer and more attentive then expected. I wish I knew about limited menu on website or kitchen closing time, however, good experience will have to go back to get my entree.

8waN1dZ1x5TRtRD0WsLUmA.text: Second time was not so good. I have a feeling the martinis on my empty stomach encouraged me to leave a very generous review after our first trip. Don't waste your time or money. Atmosphere is loud and food left my stomach in ruins for a few days after.

wTejQ-9gfjfce84mamD1Og.text: The food here is ok-brunch is probably the best serving they have. The problem with brunch is that each of the four times I have visited this place , the employees always look high, drunk, hungover or a combo. The coffee cups were served on app plates-not saucers-and therefore the cups were sliding around. Again, getting refills on coffee were like asking for blood from a stone---are employees incentivized on saving coffee? It is also a pet peeve to have my check brought before we are done eating-especially on a Sunday brunch. This wasn't the mid week lunch, it was brunch and before noon , so clearly not a big rush to turn a table. It does have a great view of the skyline---just don't expect too much else out of your visit.

S35XL985YMyimayaUUFbAw.text: Had awesome service from JP ( my new favorite person!) and a great time at super better than bad trivia!

r6e4T8D5NdZQjHrMD0kznA.text: Very rude waiters/waitresses! My boyfriend and I came one evening and no one seemed to acknowledge our presence, so we went up stairs. Everyone saw us and looked at us for a minute, but no one cared to help us. So we went up to the balcony. That's when this rude waitress started racing us to every table we tried to sit at, to place a reserved card on each one of them. When we finally found a table, she comes up to us and rudely tells us that we couldn't sit there because we didn't make reservations and that they don't do walk-ins.

ywysYLmllRzkrP_7snAX_Q.text: It is simple really.  The food was terrible and so was the service!!  They took forever to take our order and then it took even longer for the food to come.  They did apologize and even took the appetizer's off the meal.  However, by that time it was too late.  The meatloaf tasted like an old tire and the rest of the food followed suit.  I will not waste my time nor money here again. Very Very disappointed.

eaNVw6Jjw_WlJkNKgdCYtQ.text: After visting several times and loving every time with a great eclectic menu, great wine selection and bourbon specials who wouldn't.....but last night I finally talked a few friends that ususally don't leave their "Southpark Bubble" into coming towards uptown and we were very disappointed.  There were 5 of us and they were out of the first 4 wine choices and the one recommended was not tasty at all.  We went to a higher priced bottle that was fine and they DID take the first bottle off the menu and apologize profusely.  They have also changed their menu to more mainstream items, and the roof top was closed.  I won't be going for a while and my Southpark friends will stay close to home!

FCepMktobozK2R_27kwJLg.text: This place could be awesome - smack dab in the center of Plaza Midwood and great patio and building. The food blows. It's bland and boring and just, bleh. I've been there twice and nothing was spectacular or even worth finishing. The crowd there is also weirddddd

ZqJyJxXSRr66hh3ziQVtaQ.text: I love the Peculiar Rabbit! The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, the view is great, and the atmosphere is perfect.  I really wish I could give it a 5, but unfortunately I have never been served a dish at the appropriate temperature.  It's always been lukewarm in the dozen+ times I've been there.  I've decided in the future I will be requesting my food HOT and hope to receive it as such.  The Saturday special was amazing! It was a crispy duck with mushrooms and bok choy that was amazing in flavor, but lacking in temperature,   I can only imagine the potential of the deliciously balanced flavors and textures to be stellar if served when hot.    Everything is great!  I especially recommend the rancheros for brunch as well as the bahn mi, lamb burger, and the mussels.  The only thing I've had that I wouldn't recommend would be the fried green tomatoes.  They were very underwhelming.    Overall, a great restauarant! Just remember to order your food hot!

ku4tDvNr2jYwm7G-HoaUMw.text: We went here because the building looked really cook and it had a roof deck.  I orderd a chicken bri salad.  It was ok but the salad had 4 ingredients lettuce, chesee, chicken and bacon.  It tasted good but I honestly never had a salad with so little ingredients.  MY girlfriend had a breakfast sandwich with home fries which was small and overpriced.  The view on the roof made this place fun but the food was overpriced for what you got.

k53X8jgeYi924dam2Cf7Hg.text: Best brunch in Charlotte so far on our trip. Dog friendly patio. Super awesome service. Delicious and beautiful food. Many sorts of options. And $5 mimosas and bloody Marys! We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

K6Z95F_WUaq2FM7QtnkXvA.text: We had a amazing view on the rooftop along with a yummy brunch! Our waiter, the bartender, was so sweet!

6SX-A7jjqeG4GLHRgjSEaA.text: Hearing the staff laugh about sticking a straw in the waiters Gooch and serving the to go cup and laughing even harder when the child drink out of the cup is so wrong. This is the armpit of Plaza Midwood. ***Update*** Place is still terrible how is it still open?

rWo6OaH39KjDZUqM2qwNKA.text: Absolutely love salsa nights here, but came just to grab a drink and some food the other night and had a very weird experience. We waited 20 minutes to put our orders in and our waiter was super drunk. Then we went to the bar for a second round and the bar tender was even more wasted! It took forever to get our drinks and the bartender even forgot who's was who's... My friend's drink was pretty much straight vodka. On top of that, the bathroom was really gross. I'll come back for salsa night, but that's about it.

qvD35e3O6FuvL8PZaWIa5Q.text: Entitled staff. Absolute assholes. Nobody should ever go here.  Very very disappointed

X0XSyCOqBydhEthG418Lsw.text: Not sure how to give a review of a place I have yet to eat at. Here goes...... Took the family to the PR twice in one week based off a suggestion from one of the locals. The first time we were already in the area. We got to the restaurant around 3pm and was told the kitchen is not open right now and that it would be open in an hour. Cool! We said we would try later in the week. So we did just that. Tried to call when they said they opened so I don't drive all the way there and be told the kitchen was closed again. Never got an answer. The mailbox was even full so that tells me everything I need to know about the management at least. So got there and of course doors locked. Other patrons were also attempting to get in and were surprised they were closed. They definitely need to get organized. I will not be returning.

M8nnSHSyK84DxTppvNORHg.text: I should give them a 2nd star for location and rooftop, but as a bar, this place is beyond pathetic and I don't want to steer away from that narrative.  I will say that I did see a couple servers working hard, especially the one having to work the rooftop.  I came here on the 3rd of July thinking it might be a decent place to watch fireworks.  I didn't realize they didn't have a rooftop bar on weekdays, so I ended up walking back down a floor to the 3rd story bar.  I don't know if it was this girls first day behind a bar or she was having a breakdown or what.  I asked for a Higher Ground, they said they were out(I later found out they had plenty, they were just too lazy to change out kegs).  I then asked what other IPAs they had and she said she didn't know.  I just pointed at Goose Island and took it.  The next time I walked down to her she was saying how she couldn't open a bottle of prosecco without a wine key.....  I think she might have been dumb.....  I heard her later say that they had kegs, they were just too busy to change them.  But the place wasn't busy, which was strange.  And at least one of the servers was making her own drinks down there to save herself time.  I decided to go to the first floor bar for the next round.  Multiple people behind the bar, none of which could serve beers for some reason.  Yet again, no higher ground, so I went to liquor.  I ordered something easy Jim Beam and Ginger, just to get a drink.  Guy pours it, doesn't know how much it is.  Didn't feel like waiting for the total, so I just threw him a $20.  It was sad honestly.  Like, if it was their first day open I'd still say it was sad.

atBK8Yk1ji7ApUgtDUJg8w.text: Solid / Above Average Comfort Food. A bit pricy.  We got the Chicken and Waffles ($16) & their Huevos Rotos ($13). Although they weren't bad, they weren't quite memorable either. The eggs that came with the Chicken and Waffles looked like buffet eggs, waffles were a bit bland, and the chicken could have been a bit crispier. The huevos rotos was a bit more satisfying with a plethora of spices and kicks but it was a bit spicy. However I'd like to note that the beer selection and service was pretty great. Parking is a bit strange as well.  Overall, pretty good food but a bit too pricy for what we got.  Taste - 3.5/5 Atmosphere - 3/5 Value - 2/5

Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

0PjJgRR5ya4-OVtR9RUsNw.text: My best friend and I came here for brunch.... actually I lied, we come here for the drinks and the view.  My three star review is only for the food.  Our service and view was on point.  We ordered a bottle of champagne  to split.  Our waitress checked on us multiple times.  I ordered the grilled cheese and roasted potatoes.  My sandwich was cold and mainly bread (see picture).  I was starving but only ate half.  The roasted potatoes were pretty good, but it might be because my sandwich wasn't?!  My friend got eggs Benedict and didn't like it either.  Can I be honest though... we didn't care that much.  The drinks and service was really good.  This is a place you go to for the view.  The upstairs patio is awesome.    As a quick tip because parking is crazy over there - you can park in the sherwin Williams parking lot across the street without getting towed (per our hostess).

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled cheese with roasted potatoes
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bottle of champagne to split!

4aSSwVEG-btiarMKNvWBEQ.text: I had heard a lot of good and bad things about this restaurant before going there. The good is obviously the atmosphere (laid back, dining on the roof). The bad is the inconsistencies with the food quality and service.  Overall, I had a really good experience there today. I had a McRabbit burger and bbq wings. Both dishes were very good. I was also impressed with the chorizo sweet potato tot things that I got as a side with the burger. I sat on the roof where there is a great view of the Charlotte skyline.   Service was fast other than it taking quite a while to get our check. I'll have to go back during a peak time and see if the service is any different. For those that don't know, this restaurant is four floors and I could imagine service could be slow if they were busy and they didn't have enough staff.  I probably wouldn't dine here unless there was seating on the roof available. However, not a bad place to drop in to have a beer due to the vast beer selection.

Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mcrabbit burger
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

wUciiEBi7y65p5ESuq1fPw.text: Went on a Saturday evening to try this place as I had never been. Of course, there was a long wait to be seated on the rooftop so we just decided to sit downstairs. The service was veryyyyyyy slow and the drinks were just okay. The hummus we ordered look like some green goop. The wings were hard to chew. They had a special on mimosas and they were very watered down. They gave no reason for me to be back. Another con is that parking is hard to find so go figure!

P2MmBNS_6ZBXVqJtxho9pA.text: Pretty mediocre food. Owner is extremely unpleasant.  Cockroaches are everywhere!!!!! There are plenty other great restaurants in this area. Don't waste your money here!

bGpqBj3wNcOzxfl0v6W-fw.text: Probably 3 stars overall, but 4 stars for the incredible brussel sprouts! Came with a large group and service was pretty good and reasonably speedy.  We got several appetizers to split, and everything was a-ok; nothing too spectacular or noticeably sub-par.  For my entree, I got chicken and waffles which came with a side of brussel sprouts. The chicken and waffles were definitely solid.  Not the absolute best I've had, but definitely noteworthy.  Chicken was juicy, not dry, you got a decent portion.  Honestly, the chicken/waffles were probably great, but were easily outshined by the amazing brussel sprouts.  They were marinated with some sort of balsamic dressing and cooked perfectly.  The texture was just right.  Overall, this place is probably best suited for a quick bite and brew with the football game, boasts a good beer list, and solid eats!

twejKuLHF0hExfwIZFqqZg.text: Nothing like a brunch at a rooftop restaurant. I had the Peculiar Chicken Biscuit and breakfast potatoes. It was amazing. Must say I'm going back to explore more of this restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peculiar Chicken Biscuit Brunch

QVPRR9IfoM9SqofehSfU1g.text: Rooftop view- amazing. Service- amazing. Food- amazing. When can I go back?!?!  We had reservations for 7:00pm and got there a little early. We would have been fine waiting until our designated time, but they kindly whisked us upstairs to the roof to a reserved table. It was a beautiful night with a little breeze, and it was really nice to look at the Uptown skyline from our seats.  Our server explained that the restaurant was just introducing a new menu, and asked us to bear with them as everything on the menu was new. We need not have worried, though, because the food was served quickly and everything was out of this world. Our server was also very helpful in answering our questions (such as how many plates should we order for two people to split, what's the deal with the poutines, etc.).  We ordered The Queen City poutine, which is apparently a staple on the menu (so one of the only items that wasn't new that night). I don't remember everything that was on it, but I do know it involved queso and short ribs. SO GOOD. All the other poutines looked amazing, as well. We also split the avocado fried, with green goddess dipping sauce, which were amazing.   Our third and last plate was the corn dogs. While hesitant about ordering something so odd, my husband persuaded me. The corn dogs were maple breakfast sausages rolled in a blueberry waffle batter and fried. They were served with a blueberry maple dipping sauce. Sounds odd. WAS ONE OF THE BEST THINGS I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. They were awesomely greasy, like a funnel cake, without being dripping with oil. The sausages were large and flavorful. The sauce made it all the better. These are such a cool and special addition to the menu. I highly recommend them!  All in all, I would go back in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog with maple breakfast sausage and a waffle dough crust- came with a maple blueberry dipping sauce.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado fries and green goddess dipping sauce!
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Queen City poutine.

B6nsTQvenenOop7IBFOxTg.text: Good food, mediocre experience. We sat inside on the first floor. We got the gypsy schnitzel, short rib grilled cheese and the poutine. Schnitzel was excellent, other dishes were okay. We asked for the appetizer first, everything came out at the same time and none of it was warm. All the food came out room temperature. Our table was dirty, I cleaned it myself but it was still sticky. The table next to us has old food sitting on it the entire time we were there. They weren't even that busy, probably like 15 customers in there! There was cleaner sitting on the table in front of us for a long time, not sure if that's a health code violation but I wish it had been used for my table. I had high hopes but was disappointed. Probably won't go back.

rFvKw5P4WgrGtrQktKFgLw.text: Kitchen closes before 8:30 pm on a Saturday night! So one star for food. Giving a generous three stars because I can't speak on the drinks, but it is empty and they turn away business on a Saturday night if that tells you anything.

1vM1jFMQC-_4CrcRLjZugQ.text: Came here for trivia night, which was unorganized and too crowded. Waited forever for service. I ordered the short rib grilled cheese, and when I got it there was no cheese on it!

3cjLlqC56hj5mpXxLPgzYw.text: After walking by several times, I am finally convinced that the reason you'd come here is for the view and not much else. The Peculiar Rabbit has an awesome location in Plaza Midwood but beyond that nothing drew me into to love this establishment.   My sister was here from out of town, and we decided to get brunch. With $16 for an unlimited buffet, it sounded like a great pick. My sister and my fiance, opted for the buffet and we're a little disappointed. When getting the buffet option, you can order eggs, bacon or sausage with your waiter and they will bring them out for you. Unlimited buffet, but with limited options. Almost everything had meat in it for us vegetarians (minus the bread options, which I don't need to carbo load) and they did make a strong effort to have offerings of cheese grits, scalloped potatoes and a vegetarian gravy for biscuits, but this gravy is made with mushrooms and I am not the biggest fan of mushrooms.   With my options being limited, I went off the menu and ordered the crab cake eggs benedict with the hollandaise on the side. Solid choice, a little salty, but I can manage. One thing I thought was strange was the side salad. This little salad consisted of 3 greens and no dressing or anything else. Why was it even on the plate?   As a non-beer drinker, living in North Carolina is hard. A lot of restaurants or bars only offer one cider on draft. When I saw The Peculiar Rabbit had Strongbow on draft, I jumped at the opportunity. Well, the waiter came back and informed me it was flavored: cherry or orange. I've never heard of flavored Strongbow but went with the cherry. Naturally, they didn't have it, so I got the orange. Now, let's revisit, this was on draft, but it came in a bottle. It's listed on both menus as a draft so unsure why it came like this and I had mentioned that to our waiter as well. Be warned that if you're looking for a cider this is not the place to come. I wonder if there is a Strongbow on tap and the server just didn't know.   Awesome outdoor seating, and yes, it's dog-friendly.

5AcHmC3MJZ0CWVl44XVO2w.text: As a Plaza-Midwood resident, I've tried to give this place a chance multiple times. The building and location are nearly perfect. Everything else is just downright awful.   The food is outright bad. The menu makes no sense. It is highly overpriced for what you actually get.   The service follows suit with quite an unmotivated staff. Good luck actually trying to place your order or get a drink refilled.   We even attempted to just do drinks one night to see if the place had changed after all the bad experiences.  Can't mess up just-drinks, right? Sadly my beer was undrinkable as clearly a sour or ipa keg kicked so they switched it out to a stout without cleaning the lines or something. Couldn't even finish the beer nor could I find our server to pay the tab. The rest of the employees were clearly ducking/hiding in an attempt to not help any customers. So we just left cash and rolled out.  Such a waste of space in Plaza-Midwood.

1k15DfJGea6EOI-q0sTtOg.text: Good food and location, great atmosphere for the younger, hipster crowd.  Has large selection of food and friendly staff.

5nPtEug7UPWeIWPdNPBRNw.text: Came in for a couple of burgers. Both of us agreed that the meat was tough, dry and flavorless. The kitchen is obviously buying lower quality ground meat. My burger was overcooked, but my wife's was not. So that makes me think that there was an already cooked burger hanging around the grill when our orders appeared. I know that happens in almost any restaurant, but the kitchen shouldn't make it obvious  The Rabbit has gone downhill. The new menu is boring, and the food is sub-standard. Does management think most customers won't notice? Well, that's their gamble, isn't it?

hefOoGQrvm4dlRloWrZQuA.text: This place is okay.  The food is nothing special and is over priced for what it is.  However, it is in a good location and it's fun to come here and get some drinks and snacks.  Just don't get the flatbread they barely put anything on it, stick with a burger and the sweet potato hash browns which are great.

mjfFWnExERV4oGtwY6-htg.text: Foods here, well, I guess you can say mediocre.  We went during restaurant's week to check it out and asked to be seated on the rooftop patio.  We were lucky to be able to come on a clear day so being able to see the sunset of Charlotte's skyline was really beautiful!  This place is perfect for a great summer outdoor dining experiences.  Our server was really nice and attentive as well.  The patio got pretty busy quick but she gave us no problems about it as the girls and I stayed even later to chit chat and catch up with one another.  We really did enjoyed their charcuterries plate though, wished they gave us more because we all really loved it!  Our drinks were ok as well. We had the peach sangria and it was alright. As for foods however, there weren't anything spectacular since I can't even recall what was really good to even mentioned on this post...lol.

Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussles
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. charcuterie plate was so good.

N83O7pHJZG26QEE8AC1KLQ.text: Went with five people for beers and dinner.  We went fairly early, 5pm.  The place wasn't crowded.  If I rated just on the quality of food and price of food, I'd say it might earn 3 or maybe even 4 stars, based on what was ordered.  Certainly everyone in the party wasn't "wowed" by what they ordered; one said "great", but the rest reported an "eh-ok".  The service was poor.  The waitress seemed like she was doing us a huge favor by serving us.  Two of the beers she delivered were not what was ordered.  Oh, and when we sat down and four people wanted to scan the tap beer menu (there was one menu and four beer people), I asked for another copy and was told  "no, we don't have another copy."  What?!? (we got up and grabbed one from another table).  Never came-by to ask how things were going (always had to flag her down).  Delivered a greasy, nearly empty ketchup container that we had to ask for (yeah, and we had fries).  There were other annoyances like that throughout.

kvl2U3fbvEerOtHZ-X4KtA.text: After hearing through the grapevine and keeping tabs on construction for this establishment, we were surprised and delighted to hear that The Peculiar Rabbit was holding a soft open this past week. Had heard that it was going to be "Jack's Across the Tracks" and a few other rumors that made no sense. After seeing another gastro-pub open in town, the time was ripe to check it out! Here's my take:  The exterior and general aesthetic doesn't exactly scream gastro-pub. It has taken an odd shape with some serious standout qualities. My favorite part is the giant logo literally stamped on the side of the building. Definitely makes a statement.   The interior is very chic and a little more trendy than I anticipated. Wasn't expecting to see such a heavy bar scene. Long bar on the 1st and 2nd floors that I'm pretty sure mimic one another to a T. When it comes to a night out in Plaza, beer is always on the menu. I was pretty disappointed with the beer selection. The draught brews consisted of some NC beers, but only Copper from Olde Meck. Think it'd be nice to get some of the other local breweries on board as well. The bottle selection is decent. Had a chance to order a New Castle brew I had never had.  The menu was a bit limited due to the soft open. We stared with the twice-baked potatoes and pretzels. First, the twice-baked were pretty bland. The creme fraiche was very well executed, but the rest of the dish was forgettable. With only three tiny potatoes, I wouldn't look to order this again. The pretzels....divine. The presentation was great and the portions, hefty two-bite sized pieces, were perfectly crunchy on the exterior and chewy on the inside. The beer cheese, which seems to be rather popular as of late, is splendid. Great texture and subtle flavor. Also came with spicy stone-ground mustard.  We decided to split an entree. Went with Banh Mi. My goodness. Talk about divine. The pork was so flavorful and was reminiscent of some other great Banh Mi I've had. The veggies were fresh and complemented well. The bread, sourced local, was a nice touch. Very good stand up for that juicy which.   The views are absolutely stunning. It was an absolutely gorgeous night and the skyline couldn't have been set more perfectly. The roof deck is by far one of the most impressive in town. I'm looking forward to dining there next time!   One of the most admirable aspects is the farm-to-table practice. Great to see the menu littered with local sources and our server had a great knowledge of where specific items had come from. A rather important trait for a biz to have these days to stay on the radar of Charlotte's culinary-minded.   One thing we couldn't really handle was the noise level. We were sitting across from one another and yelling to hear each others' words. Wonder if there would be an option for sound dampening on the 2nd floor? Also, the natural light that comes in with the sunset was blinding. Curtains will definitely be a must in the coming weeks.   My biggest critique is the parking situation. Goodness gracious. Everywhere you can park around the building is permanently taken and other parking spaces around that part of plaza are marked with what seems like "PARK HERE AND DIE" types of signs. If they can work something out with local parking spaces after regular biz hours for surrounding businesses or look into comped valet perhaps, it would serve them well.   I think TPR has some serious potential with that space. Their menu and beer list will definitely see some tweaking and I look forward to the result. Like many new places, there will be many changes made for flow, better service, and overall experience. I'm definitely a fan and the service and experience given to us will have us coming back in the near future. The views alone from the roof will keep us coming back on cool, clear nights!  Glad we had a chance to sample this joint so early! Welcome to the neighborhood!  Cheers.
