tfzPVuT9Z3Yi6XpKnLngGA.text: Terrible service. Went during charlotte burger week. Waiter was not even aware of burger week or the specials. Restaraunt was not even packed waited over an hour for a burger. Before walking out. Water was served in a plastic cup...waiter was rude. Just terrible experience. Will never return.

HFi7Q26OLqzXv_mCVEIjyw.text: I (as promised) have given The Peculiar Rabbit another shot and this time was a definite step above the last.  We came in for a late brunch on Sunday and took advantage of their AWESOME mimosa special $4 all you can drink (yea, you read that right). While I won't say it was the best mimosa I have ever had as the bubbly was a bit too sweet, I can't argue with that price.   My friend and I split two dishes, a potato tart and the veggie burger. The tart was the better option and was served with perfectly seasoned asparagus, it was tasty. The veggie burger wasn't good. It tasted grossly sweet and had and oat-like texture I didn't get any  chick pea flavor/texture as in the description. The saving grace was It was paired with really delicious fries and the brioche bread was tasty.   The prices seemed much more reasonable this time around and my meal with mimosa came to $15. Our service was leaps and bounds above the last and we also had a server-in-training who did a nice job (he had a good teacher).   I still think they have room for growth but I was much happier this time around...

4nAqSRjWjelra8ErVJUTnA.text: Really good service but food is less than ehhh here..   Honestly nothing stood out to me and I wouldn't probably come back here for food. But I did give this place a second star because it's a good place for a cold beer and to watch an intense football game

m8zmQ2XItcIWwdnwVmul4A.text: I really liked the environment/atmosphere at Peculiar Rabbit, but the food was average and the menu was limited.  I feel like this place does not really have an identity yet.  Basically, I don't feel an urge to come back here for anything more than some beers.

vnaxChCKkP8r30JZ0SqybA.text: Last night, I went to support my friend who was DJing at this location. We were on the second floor and the service from the bartender was dreadful. Ordering a drink and food was a challenge in its own. I would have to walk down to the other end of the bar to get his attention. Also when I did receive my food, he did not give me any silverware or put the order in correctly. Overall, it was a very disappointing experience. I typically enjoy coming Peculiar Rabbit for the atmosphere and service.

Zm0NluGocX8pPbhnEUCimg.text: I visited Peculiar Rabbit jan 12th to support a friend of mine and sat at the bar. There was noone else there needing service but me. There were a group of servers speaink with the bartender so i was patient at theat point the bartender looked me my face and said nothing nor did he show any haste in wanting to serve me. I am in the entettainment business and i deal with bars ofeter and det them up hiring bartenders etc. I would never hire him. He did not get pleasant until a group if females came in and then his show began. I woukd never go back to the second floor bar unless supporting a friend.

3tL730rhE4nqC7dmanBEDg.text: Shout out to Zach for the great service! Our group did several small plates and we all were very impressed with the food. Awesome beer selection. Highly recommended.

Rg-lyFHL00clnjvOKzz2Xg.text: I was pretty disappointed with the Peculiar Rabbit. I can definitely say that I will not be back. The food was decent, the drinks were ok--over priced, the staff were nice enough, but the wait!! We went for brunch with a group of 10 and we had to wait close to 1.5-2 hours for our food to come out after ordering--no they were not busy. Then to top it, they brought 2 orders out 45minutes before they brought the rest of the food out. It was a mess to say the least. They were pretty responsive to our complaint of the food taking so long and them bringing out 2 orders WAY before the others by comping us 3 desserts, which we shared between all of us, and comping us one of the orders that came out early.

h37F9ek3j_lZ7kOzP7dIpA.text: Disclaimer: I'm not someone that goes searching for problems when dining out (these people exist). I've waited tables for a few years & totally understand that sometimes there's kitchen issues/servers just have a bad night...but last night was such a letdown :(  I've heard so many good things about this place so my boyfriend and I were excited to try it.  They were very slow, not understaffed, and we were sitting right by the hostess stand in clear sight. For some reason, it was 10 minutes before our server came to the table to greet us.. He brought water, we ordered drinks, and it was another 10 minutes before we received them. (Cocktails were 1/2 price, got The Painkiller for $5, it was delicious) After finishing those, it was about 15 minutes before he stopped talking to the hostess and I flagged him down to order another round... Took almost 10 minutes to get those drinks...Please keep in mind there are 2 people at the bar and only 4 other sat tables around us. This pattern continued throughout our meal :-l  In terms of our food, the beer pretzels were good, but came out with cheese after I asked for mustard (explained to server that I can't eat dairy). Easily fixable, it happens, but just annoying at this point. My boyfriend's grilled cheese (I think it came with shredded beef?) was mostly bread and cheese with barely any meat... My $9 kale salad came out with barely any toppings or dressing..the lamest salad...see picture.  So annoyed at this point that we asked for boxes right away (didn't feel like going through the hassle of sending the food back and waiting another hour)  Since we knew we'd be waiting- and I wasn't driving : ) - I went to the bar and ordered 2 shots of tequila, for $22.....Thrilled at this point.   It sucks when you finally go out for date night and just get terrible service and sad portions, especially when my boyfriend spent over $100 and barely got to enjoy our time spent (which was much longer than we wanted to be there but everything just took so long!) Everyone's food pics look amazing and the atmosphere is great, it was just such a frustrating/disappointing experience :-l rant over

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. $9 Kale Salad minus 1 bite, ordered w/no cheese but didn&#39;t realize that meant minus any of the other toppings or dressing...??

UkLicxh4oN8jSLmantbX5Q.text: Too bad the bartenders think it's ok to serve a different brand of vodka when you order one that is out of stock. Instead of letting the customer know so they can decide on something else.

HG4CLAFBiKDJccUQEJz6jQ.text: Staff is friendly and the location is great. The service could be spotty or great depending on how much of a rush you are in. Everything we ordered came out cold. It's really hard to swallow chicken and waffles when it's at room temp. The biscuits with gravy comes with a fried egg on top. It's a cold, tasteless, and coagulated mess. Bloody Mary smelled like a dirty rag and had zero flavor. Wish I could get a refund. Go here for friendly service, but skip on food and drinks.

U9GgoJy3XjNTBgqsgtw21g.text: Bland tasting food. The kale side had no flavor despite it being lemon drizzle topped. The pulled pork had no real flavor except a hoppy beer flavor. Bruschetta was extremely hard.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kale and bruschetta

8x5EkQnN-hzw-W2Iwn0Xmw.text: Service is crazy slow. Our waiter told us he hasn't waited tables in 6 months and they left him on the floor alone! The "manager" was wandering around talking to people instead of helping folks in the weeds. It'll be a nice way to put yourself out of business. There are other neighborhoods besides Plaza Midwood! Get your act together.

pRgFNfSPmfcXnnnc8ozzLA.text: Very bad service. After getting food not a single server checked to see if my empty water needed refilled.

0LhLBlqjXo4fJHT7nAfqmw.text: Peculiar Rabbit is quite Peculiar. The fare here is quite inventive. Especially love the sweet tea brined wings, sweet tea, and truffle fries. Not a fan of the deviled eggs. Have came a number of different times, although I would say the Customer Service has not always been the best here.

71IOplBrMYqrfQbPhCEAZA.text: Not quite the atmosphere that is advertised. Expected more of a bar scene, but was seated at a table surrounded very closely by families with children (tables very close together upstairs). Wanted the mimosa special and was told ordering food was required. I ordered an appetizer, which was $5 for a scoop of pimiento cheese and couldn't even eat it due to how salty it was. Too much salt in the cheese and the crackers. The deviled eggs were not great either. Food definitely over priced and not something I would necessarily recommend. Drink specials aren't too good either.

di1jyjpFBua--zZxgUGFHQ.text: Best rooftop view of the city skyline! The food is pretty good, nothing mindblowing but I love to go have some cocktails and enjoy the view from the rooftop.  the Chicken wings were excellent.  The disco fries are good if you can get over the fact that your eating fries (already so good for you) with a ton of gravy slopped on top.  The rooftop pulls it up to a 4 star for me.

AFTSMBSjPvmYEDQXCbFj5A.text: Stopped in for a drink on a Saturday night while passing through Charlotte on our honeymoon this summer. Went all the way upstairs and had a beautiful view of the city. My husband tried a local jalapeno beer. It was pretty good. Fun place. Would love to come back and try the food!

omWSkrc4vsaX8P_TmPf7lQ.text: I've been here twice now and have had a pleasant experience during both visits. Out of all the things I've had (we split everything): Fig and bacon app, Ribs, Risotto, Chicken & Waffles, and Crab Cake sandwich the only thing I didn't enjoy was the ribs. I'm a rib lover, and these just didn't hit the mark. Everything else was delicious!! The Risotto had amazing flavor, they do a great job at keeping the traditional Chicken & Waffles yummy and savory, and the Crab Cake sandwich had a great sauce and I love a good gourmet bun! The service was ordinary the second time but great the first time and the drink specials are good. I will definitely be back, and I hope I can make it in for a ladies night out sometime too!

2cJJx9hIihQsvOlDnIOvzg.text: After visiting The Peculiar Rabbit 3 times over the course of 3 months, I can only give this place 3 stars. The first time we visited, it had only been open for a few weeks, and since we live in the neighborhood, we wanted to wait a bit for the hype to die down as well as the kinks worked out.  We sat at the bar on the first floor (the second floor was being rented out, as was the patio downstairs) for dinner our first visit. It was a week night and fairly quiet. The bartender was great, and served us quickly. The beer list was pretty good, and I always love seeing NC beers on draft! We ordered the Pretzels with Rarebit dip & whole grain mustard while we perused the menu. The pretzels were super buttery (almost too rich), and the rarebit dip was a little mild. The mustard was great, but since it was whole grain, it was hard to get it on the pretzel (picky, I know). However, it was a good start! We then ordered the Lebanese Lollipop and the Banh Mi with fries to split. The Lollipop was excellent. The hummus and the flatbread were really yummy, and the salsa fresca served with it was refreshing. The lamb was really flavorful, and I would definitely recommend it! The Banh Mi threw me off. First, the pork was in patty form (ground with spices) and in a flat oval shape. The menu said  "ground pork meatball" but we didn't expect it to be flat! The texture was really weird. Also, there were fresh jalapenos, which made it too spicy! The house made roll was really good, and the other accoutrement (pickled daikon & carrot) were good. The fries are really really good here, but the sandwich is something I wouldn't order again.  The second time we came here, it was just for drinks on a Friday night. We were happy that the bar wasn't being rented out upstairs, as it would have been packed! There were 8 of us and we floated around the second floor, listening to music and playing some of the fun games. We also went upstairs to the outside bar (which has some lighting and heat blowers). There were 3 groups that had taken up the 3 working heaters so we couldn't be up there too long. The service was good, and if we had stayed longer, I know it would have been a wild night!  The third time we visited was on Friday. We didn't have a reservation (oops), and we showed up with 8 people at 7:15. The 2nd floor was being rented out (again, a common theme it seems) so space was very limited. This was originally intended to be a casual, sit-at-the-bar kind of gathering but the bar downstairs was packed and the hostesses said there were 3 big parties expected at 7:30 and it was worth waiting for if they didn't show. So we waited around the bar area (getting jostled every 2 minutes, it was definitely too crowded) and miraculously they made a table of 6 work for our group of 8. The hostesses were rock stars! I ordered the Burger (fried egg, bacon, Mornay sauce) with those irresistible fries. It came out perfectly medium rare which is nice to get in Charlotte. I was not thrilled with my burger, which should have been a knock out dish. The Mornay sauce was an unnecessary addition as it was very bland. The sauce just really drowned out/dulled all the other flavors! My fiance ordered the Fish & Chips, which were excellent. Other people ordered the Tofu Burger (the only vegetarian in the crowd and it was NOT good), the Ribs (came highly recommended), and the Banh Mi with a side of sweet potato & bean soup, which was apparently delicious.  Service was OK, but I know they were busy so I'm not going to knock them for that.  All in all, I haven't been wowed by everything on the menu...it seems really hit-or-miss. I definitely want to get the Oxtail Poutine and the Mussels next time, though! I will definitely come back in another month or two and keep working my way through the menu because I really DO want to love this place. I think the concept is great and the service is pretty good. I hope they keep working the kinks out!

LLY3VCZJEu2ERAcdoDJ8mQ.text: When a friend and I visited Peculiar Rabbit for the first time earlier this week, we were blown away by the attention we received from each and every member of the staff. While our server was great, we were particularly impressed by the Maitre'd, Nicole. She honestly made our visit as pleasant as it was due to her professional demeanor and pleasant nature. We had come on a whim, you see, and hoped for rooftop seating which, sadly, was not immediately available. However, Nicole went out of her way to show us to the various different bars and dining rooms (and even told us about some of her favorite cocktails!) we could wait in while a table come available. As impatient as my friend can often be when it comes to eating (and practically everything else!) I genuinely appreciated the care and time given to us.

uN0sSfvNdFcmlgll_4YjJg.text: This place is the best food in Plaza Midwood. A little pricy but Dee licious!  Sweet spicy regular, vegetarian or meat eaters, they have it all! A must go in the neighborhood! And to top it off literally, they have the best third floor view of Uptown Charlotte in Plaza Midwood! Big fan!

K5HwUaech5P_tQmbM0kzTA.text: This is one of my favorite rooftop bar locations. Good selection of craft beers here and the vibe is great. Food is meh but not too overly priced either.

W_hUL9stpRaRgOnGdqUcxg.text: This place was just so-so.  Maybe it's the fact we went on a busy Saturday night, but our poor waiter seemed slightly overwhelmed, so it could be a staffing issue.  The food was good, I hate to say it about a somewhat nicer restaurant but the pretzel appetizer was the best, it was absolutely delicious!!  I had the pork and although I am preggers and had to get it done well, it was still pretty good but tons of fat.  Cute atmosphere so maybe we'll give it a try during the week when it's not so chaotic!!

H7SyyYHAU5suPRHm0okysg.text: Waiters are rude, all three that were waiting on us... Calamari is aweful! Chili is undercooked. Muscles and wings were ok.  Very disappointed!

kChhrR-s01NNMqWnTJ5t5w.text: You will be WELL served in the liquor department at The Rabbit! Nice rooftop seating overlooking Central Ave. and uptown Charlotte. Great place to hang out with friends!!

8KguC7DwrW_tO2Qj40uSxw.text: The view from the roof is spectacular! Great for taking pictures. I had fish and chips during this visit. The fish is HUGE. Great appetizers. Currently have live music on Wednesday nights

g9XeI_5Ac1mIgK2z4ooQpw.text: Above average food, but even higher prices.  Dinner for two topped $100.  Enjoyed the experience but the food will not be enough to draw us back a second time.  We had the fillet and grouper.  Our favorites where the fig and goat cheese bruschetta and the crispy broccoli.

l-sVSIgyPDNgg5f8QtZiOg.text: Not a fan of this place after overhearing the owner wants to put eb's and t-street out of business. Do what you do, but don't strive to bring others down. Bad vibes, and i really wanted to like this place. Try heist brewery if you want somewhere new. I will NOT be giving PR or jackalopes any more of my business :(

P9UwN57hCaiOBijHQPtAxA.text: Finally made it to this restaurant.  My friend and I sat at the bar on the middle level and enjoyed the excellent view of the Charlotte Skyline.  I read through the menu many times and saw quite a few dishes that sounded good.  I'm a big fan of poutine, but didn't feel in the mood for it.  I settled on the Shepherd's Pie.  I love shepherd's pie and this dish just did not do it for me.  Beer selection was good, view was good, service was good, but the menu didn't live up to what I was expecting.  I will give them another try with another dish later and see if it was just a one-off.

6EieTPhx465oFBX4a4CvaQ.text: I love coming here when the rooftop is open. It is a beautiful view of the city! Numerous times I have been here and like to take friends or family who are visiting because of the great service and atmosphere. Im not originally from the south and when I brought my family here I made them order your delicious Chicken & Waffle. At first they looked at me like I was insane why would you eat those two together especially for dinner? They loved it! Our server was Justin and we he was great! He was fast getting our drinks and apps out even though it was very busy, we didn't have to wait too long. He also convinced us that we had to get a dessert to celebrate my family in town, so we did and that was also amazing. He recommended Devils on a Horseback which was amazing and now anytime I go there I have to have that!! Overall, I really like this place and would recommend it.

M2UpUhbAk6SMWGEayBzUUw.text: We went during the soft opening, and it was packed. Was most definitely confusing for us, and staff alike, as there seemed to be a lack of organization. It's dark in there, and hard to read the menu. Food was pretty decent, however i would like to come back once they figure everything out. We ordered the stuffed figs and lamb kofka skewers over fava bean hummus. The figs were good, but the sauce was too sweet and seemed to dominate the other flavors. Kofka skewers were delicious. The hummus was some of the best I've had in a restaurant. Best part of this place was the roof, the view is killer, and it is nicely decorated. I will definitely return for the regular menu, and once the hype dies down some.

8ZOwDzPC_wKcMrm72JwmRw.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time and got no service for restaurant week.  After 30 mins, of being passed by on a fairly empty deck not even a glass of water.  I had to go elsewhere for dinner.

yXZXwST97N5UmTglkyAfiQ.text: Love this place. Ambiance and the craft beer selection. Our meal was great. Great value. Its a little far from Ballantyne but we plan to return.

eP9AAodlYBMkl-nmc4fuKw.text: I was SO looking forward to this place because I heard it was delicious.  My boyfriend and I had been traveling a lot and hadn't been on a date in a long time and were VERY excited to try this place.  We made a reservation for 8pm and arrived promptly, but really wanted to sit outside on the upstairs patio so we agreed to wait an hour.  When the hostess got us an hour later, she took us to a table on the ground floor, I explained that we were waiting for a table upstairs.  She snapped "Well there are none" and left us to sit outside.  20 minutes or so later a server finally brought us some water (9:20pm) and took our order.  We ordered the calamari salad, bacon wrapped figs, and a duck entree.  More than 30 MINUTES later (9:50) the figs arrived, and you could tell by the heat level and texture that it had been sitting under the heat lamp for god knows how long.  The calamari salad came around 10:00 and was horrible and bland.  It is a cold salad...there is no reason it should take 40 minutes to come out.  The entree arrived at 10:20 (nearly an hour and a half after we sat down) and was absolutely terrible.  The duck was greasy yet dry at the same time and had clearly been under the heat lamp for some time.  It was so bad that we ended up ordering a second dinner at the movies later!!  We advised our server around 9:30 that we needed to be gone by 10:15 to make a movie.  He was the one saving grace of the meal.  He was very apologetic about the wait and did take a beer and our entree off the bill.  I know it wasn't his fault...the kitchen was clearly backed up, but it was one of the worst dining experiences I have had in Charlotte.    Whoever is the manager needs to take a serious look at the staffing of the kitchen and the flow, especially on busy warm weekend nights.  We will definitely not be returning, unless for drinks only, which is a shame because it is a great location and the menu looked promising.

6VwJ85sY2xMWtVAQzbi_JA.text: This is by far one of my favorite new places in Charlotte.  Creative, fresh menu and great cocktails.  How can you beat half price bottles of wine on Sundays??  Devils on Horseback - Amazing....Duck Duck Goose appetizer...so yummy.  Love the pork belly and the sandwiches.  Really cannot say anything negative at all.  Go see it - your tummy will thank you!!

ke_O-9FdjRRpgdW2WMoAAQ.text: Really disappointed in the lack of neighborhood mentality. Charging for parking in a lot that's used by all local bars and then offering a $5 drink if you pay means they're just trying to steal all business from the other local restaurants/bars. Oh by the way, you have to spend $50 to get that $5 drink. What?? It's disrespectful and it makes many people not want to go to this establishment. They should know better in a neighborhood like Plaza Midwood.

XK5aZW9w6fWQ6I50Y4gkow.text: When I heard we were getting a three story bar with overpriced food I have to admit that I was pretty elated.  But I was even more excited to find a section of parking roped off just for the rabbit!  I mean nothing says exclusive like premium parking!  I can't wait for more extra premo establishments to move to Plaza Midwood.  Maybe a Zaxbys or Applebee's.  oh a red robin would be excellent!

UmZILkMbNUvRDVBq5t3B1w.text: Absolutely terrible service, food, and overall atmosphere. Couldn't ask for a worse location and experience. If I wanted a three-story failure I would've run into a burning building. Paying for roped off parking is also the most amazing idea.

ZW6BhskDDHeOGdiuQzrGwA.text: The food overall was great, the scenery was amazing,  and the staff was very friendly.  The only things that was a small minutes was the parking set up for a non Uptown location,  our server forgot my meal drink altogether,  and the lack of lighting at the table we were sat at on a very non busy night.

VdcKDvmvGqIdb3LxwPY6Kw.text: Perfect brunch spot! Great drinks, atmosphere and food! Menu is tasty and eclectic, never been disappointed with anything I've had there. Staff is always friendly and efficient! My fave thing is the Eggs Oscar...poached egg with hollandaise sauce on crab cake and english muffin. And a side of grits! Amazing! If that's not "brunchin"... I don't wana know what is!

4rnp-wOwKCHb0nspePshyA.text: Wanted to try this place out since I've heard a number of good things about it, assumed it was worth a try.  Worst place I have ever been to!  First off, the hostess forgot about us when we stood there for 20 mins. waiting and seated another couple before us as soon as they walked in.  Our waitress was awful, she was more concerned with hanging out with her friends at the table next to us.  We had to wait for over an hour for our food, and even the food was awful!  Will seriously NEVER come back here again.  WORST experience I've ever had at a restaurant!!!

rrbM3nNXHFvWtXFU6ve1lA.text: Had dinner on the rooftop Saturday night before the Amos Lee show at Ovens Auditorium. Food was wonderful, brought out promptly, and served very professionally by Rachel. She helped us make our choices and did not steer us wrong. What a bonus that she's from Sonoma County, one of our favorite places on earth. So thank you, Rachel. Next time we're in Charlotte, we're coming to see you again!

xU4npClT8-DJCp1-Hwvr0Q.text: Such a great night at peculiar rabbit! The soft pretzel appetizer was garlicky deliciousness. Cristi, our awesome server, suggested the trout and the schnitzel, and her recommendations did not disappoint! She was spot on - the trout was amazing, and the schnitzel was so comforting on a nice cool night. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the sunset. The atmosphere was totally fun. Prices were very reasonable. We were just visiting to look at houses this weekend but we will be back when we move here permanently this summer!

UISawMjsnIwyZ5eDLV2tkA.text: Our lunch couldn't be more perfect. A sunny, Spring day, excellent food on the rooftop and fantastic service by our waitress, Rachel.

Ulk-v1JZe82O59UVpR4IqA.text: This place was just plain strange. Started by walking into a completely dead first floor with about 4 hostesses just staring at me. I walked upstairs to meet a friend at the bar and I swear it felt like it had the feel of an empty Applebee's. The music was also just pure insanity. If someone told me to come up with a mix of the crappiest songs from the fifties and the late eighties; I wouldn't have come close to the poor selection they offered. After about twenty minutes of joking about it; they changed it to something bearable. Even though the beer selection was worse than the Citgo down the street; the service was actually decent. Gotta hand it to them- they were making the best out of a pretty bad situation. Not sure how this one gets turned around but someone let me know if that miracle happens and I'll give it another shot.

iAgncyfjkO0sJ9HmGm7ZEw.text: First timer and had high hopes because I know the owner also owns Jackalope Jack's, which happens to be one of my favorite bars to go to in Elizabeth.  Myself, my boyfriend, and our friend walked in about 10:00 PM at night on Saturday and were greeted by the hostess, who asked if we were dining in.  We said no, we were meeting some other friends who had texted us that they were upstairs.  We asked if there was another bar on the upper level and she said yes, then looked up at the telvision above her head with camera views of the different areas of the restuarant/bar and said "It's very crowded up there."  Well, it's Saturday night and we want to be apart of the crowd!  Strange that they have the camera views visible.  We got a drink at the 1st floor bar and the vodka/cranberry that I ordered seemed heavy on ice and not on liquid.  We ended up meeting my three friends on the 2nd level, where yes, it was crowded, but fun crowded, not shoulder-to-shoulder crowded.  They were at a table in the corner, drinking.  We were planning to order a few more rounds before heading to Thomas Street Tavern and were enjoying a nice few minutes of conversation when the server comes to our table and asks if we're ordering food or just drinks.  We tell her we're ordering drinks.  Two minutes later the hostess from downstairs walks up to our table and tells us that she's sorry, but since we're not ordering food, we have to leave the table.  It was as polite as possible, but still, I looked around and saw no one else at the tables surrounding us having food on them.  We were still going to be ordering items, just alcoholic ones.  We debated ordering an appetizer, but were put off by the whole scenerio.  What made it even worse was that when we walked downstairs, there were plenty of tables available for people who want a meal at 10:30 PM on a Saturday night.  Really, Rabbit....very Peculiar indeed.    Needless to say, will NOT be going back anytime soon.

9ysZRSlh9MbQ-cU73Mkh5A.text: Went for lunch. I think they have gotten the Yelp message about mediocre service. All through the meal drink glasses were attended to and I think every employee in the place came by to see if all was to our liking. I would go back, the food was about the same level as the Terrace Cafe. Food is good, their house burger was a bit messy to eat but quite good; fries were good. For those who had a bad experience you might want to give it another try.

bOwnOGa1XpTJ8vUZjqKkYA.text: OK- so I had low expectations to begin with as I love the Common Market and the Diamond, but I thought what the heck- try lunch. Firstly the menu for lunch is very limited, I also took my kids- no children's menu. I am aware that it's a "sports bar" but when you are in this neighborhood, during lunch you should really consider catering to families. They were completely empty and it still took 45 minutes to get our food. The portions were small (which I like) but the prices are a bit high for  food that is just ok . The server was nice, and attentive but we were the only table seated. I will stick to the places I know in the neighborhood, the tried and True standbys.

MTaskJMSvyEv6DkA_Y3Gug.text: I post reviews under two circumstances; a place is REALLY good, or a place is REALLY bad...and the former certainly applies to The Peculiar Rabbit.  First, I am not all that familiar with Plaza Midwood or the surrounding neighboorhood, but the location felt hip and trendy without being too young or too old.  The atmosphere downstairs was great; I did not see the bar or view upstairs.  I ordered the Bibb Salad, which was excellent.  Portion size was great, ingredients were fresh and expertly prepared (especially the walnuts).  For dinner, I had the Wild Mushroom Risotto; I'm not vegeterian, and rarely order pasta at restaurants, but the description sounded great, so I went for it.  WOW.  WOW WOW WOW.  Seriously, maybe the best risotto I've ever had.  Risotto is really easy to screw up, and those I've had at restaurants in CLT are average, but this literally blew me away.  I don't know how you make mushrooms and rice taste like that, but it was just so damn good.  WOW.  For dessert, I shared the fried ice cream...which is bacon ice cream.  Yup, bacon, in the ice cream.  Ice cream...with bacon.  I don't think I need to say more than that.  It was awesome.  Wine list was nice too; fair prices for healthy pours.  The Argentinian Malbec was very good.  Having read other reviews of this place, I'm perplexed. I think the folks who gave it 1-3 starts are delusional.  Granted, I had one meal there, but I'm super critical of restaurants, and I couldn't find a flaw.  I can't wait to go back.

A8ztGlm_pAuz8kIVNyuJwQ.text: This place is great!  Food, cocktails and service exceeded all of our expectations.

ho9yxItEa3Gw7Atx3ZmWLg.text: Had great drinks very strong!! Major plus, & my server Stephen was very kind!! He was on point!!

wjAbRpVUJxJTKuaOhEfxGQ.text: As I posted in my tip, I won't be back. I don't eat meat and wasn't in the mood for a veggie burger or to pay $21 for scallops so I tried a salad and app instead. The southern bean salad was dry and the beans were mush. The pimento cheese app was too salty to eat. The atmosphere and staff were great, but that's not enough to bring me back, unfortunately.

ZqEu2e3zAyyaCIuU36KE9Q.text: Peculiar indeed.  I have watched this place with great anticipation for months, wondering what, when and how ..... last night saw that they might be open, called to confirm and stopped in after dinner elsewhere.   My observations echo many of the preliminary impressions. Considering the size of the exterior I had an assumption of what the interior might be... Unfortunately you know that old cliche about assumptions.......  We walked up to the door and there were 2 people chatting  sort of said "hi " ....were they customers, employees, door people, friendly loiterers ?? not sure.  A few steps in get to the hostess stand, 3 girls behind podium, no recognition as they decipher seating charts like they were cryptic treasure maps. The downstairs was 60ish % full ... but were told there was a long wait on all floors ! hmmmm  We decided to check out the space, from the  outside I expected a spacious inside. I was wrong. Very choppy, small staircases that serve both customers and waitstaff carrying food / drink, and low feeling ceilings.  On the second floor there were many (many) open tables, I asked if I could grab one and was told I had to go back downstairs..... hmmm .... we continued the journey up the tight stairs to the "rooftop deck"    Shauna is exactly correct the deck is DARK... it feels like they are going for a "Miami Lounge" feel, if so it doesn't work, it is also much smaller than it appears.  We looked around and noticed no bar, hmmm,  a group after us said out loud "what no bar ?" ......   We head downstairs and I notice a backroom with a sign that says "Snooker" ... think to myself "cool ... Snooker in Charlotte, maybe some redemption for this place" ....  walk in the room and WTF pops in my head, as I flash back to being 12 years old ..... Bumper Pool maybe fun ? but it is Not Snooker !!!!  As we walk out there is a guy at the door who smiles and says thanks while drinking red bull..... We head over to W.W.   In Summary... the menu looks good, but not sure... very dis-functional design inexperienced and untrained staff  I will watch the reviews and give them several months before I go back.....

TSh0XHbmQyi4Gb7vEiqJ9w.text: Everything we have had here was amazing, but I had to give 4 stars because of the SLOW, SLOW service! Not bad service, just slow so don't arrive too hungry!

wamVwfCxOn0nrXsM_shjCw.text: Not impressed by the service at The Peculiar Rabbit. It took over an hour for our food to arrive and when it did it was the wrong items and they were cold. I wouldn't recommend this place on a weekend night as they are not prepared to handle a crowd.

gU2E1OZEUE-CzGWiE-a4Pw.text: If you are planning a career in the food and hospitality business, you should go here to learn how NOT to run a restaurant.  If you considering going here as a customer, don't waste your time.  The service staff is confused, the kitchen is slow, the food is just okay, and the cocktails are subpar.    There are plenty of better options.

JVKZ5XFJLma9rvIP7_kGgA.text: The second floor was at least 90 degrees.  We waited over 30 minutes to order drinks, and subsequently reorder our drinks.  It was not peak hours, and the food took 45 minutes to come out.  The waitress was apologetic, but also commented that the food comes out slow when they aren't busy and it doesn't make sense.

gJ8k0n4tr4bn88Vq-5WNFw.text: Good food and drinks for adults. Don't bring kids here. The menu, food, and service do not cater to kids.

QHvy5u6CgzF4v6-UCGHmcw.text: Worst service ever, hostess couldn't have been more rude would never come back we walked Out after she talked to us like we were stupid for trying to eat

po3BOw0CZ23UXs6RmthYDg.text: Went here before a concert for a quick bite.  Didn't go upstairs to see the view because I forgot about it.  Decor is plain with that rustic wood/metal box vibe.  American Gastropub Asian Fusion are the tags on Yelp.  The only Asian I really noticed was in seeing something that sounded really good at first glance to noticing the Sriracha on things that I definitely wouldn't want it on.  They should just put in on the table.  Sat outside the bar area at the hightop tables.  It was nice and not too loud, but please - the 80's music was killing me.  Right before we left it was switched over to a much more eclectic mix, so there's no excuse to play 80's music, ever. (rant)  Service was prompt, efficient and friendly.  Food - salad $7.00 - good, burger $? - good.  Slab of Pumpkin Pie with Cinnamon Ice Cream in a trough & two spoons...priceless.  I'll have to go back for a more complete experience of their food and that view!

9ZuatzVRCcAvhoUqqyVo0g.text: I have mixed feelings about The Peculiar Rabbit.  I came here for the first time with a Amazon Local coupon, woohoo! This neighborhood is my jam and I was itching to try the place out. Unfortunately, I didn't have the greatest experience.  The vibe of the interior is nice. Kinda dark and pub-like, but clean and distinguished too. We sat on the second level.   The worst part of our visit was the service. Our waitress was just horrible. She wasn't mean per say, just a total airhead that kept us waiting forever on drinks, food, our check, refills. You name it, she botched it. She even messed up our coupon. She told us we had $5 left, so we ordered dessert, but she didn't add the dessert to the coupon, just gave us a bill for it... wtf? And when she was refilling everyone else's water, I slid my over for a top off... but she totally ignored it and sauntered away.   Another thing that bothered me was all the unnecessary frou frou labeling on the menu. This is a bar, not an elite restaurant. We had to ask endless questions about everything, which was annoying for our server and ourselves.  Also, the prices on our check were higher than what was on the menu! That's a no no! Come on!  We split the OMG Pretzels as an appetizer. They were okay, but nothing special. A little too crunchy and the sauce a little boring and stingy on the portion.  My mom ordered the Classic Burger and was happy. It was simple and she enjoyed it.  My friend and I split The Veggie Burger and The Pub Grilled Cheese. The quality of both of the ingredients in these both was really great. The Veggie Burger was hearty and filling, but the flavor was bland and boring. It needed some sort of zing to step it up. The Grilled Cheese was really good. Thick crusty sourdough bread, gooey cheeses, and tomatoes (which were pretentiously called "tomato confit"). I would definitely order it again. As my side I ordered The Ginger-Butternut Squash Bisque.... SO YUMMY. This was my favorite thing I tried. Rich and thick but a rather small portion.   We split the Creme Brulee.... 2 thumbs up. It was great and the texture was just right.  I think  I'd give Peculiar Rabbit another try in the future, but please give me better luck with the server.

Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pub Grilled Cheese
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Burger

QgmcfiOgeePmqBANnN9WZw.text: Roof top was great. Waiter / service was awesome. (Our server, at least...one of the others I noticed was a bit rude...) Menu and food were delicious...Portuguese flatbread was a little spicier than I thought it would have been, but both that and the sweet potato hash were delicious. Three floors of bar and dining room seating...funky atmosphere, would definitely go back...even if just for drinks on the roof!

5CRZakeNiNjEJ_WMsiHI_g.text: The last couple of times we stopped in here, things haven't gone so well.  Service has slipped tremendously and the food has followed suit. Very disappointed in this once-promising place.  We stopped in for lunch today at 1.  There were plenty of people on staff and only a few tables occupied but somehow they still found a way to ignore us for large chunks of time.    We watched our waiter hanging out by the door while our water glasses stayed empty and our food sat in the kitchen.  My wife had to walk to the bar to get her water refilled.  It took 45 minutes for our food to come out which is ridiculous considering the small number of people there.  When it did come, it was not warm and it was dried out which tells me it had been sitting there for some time.  Our waiter didn't come by once to see how the food tasted or refill water.  He probably realized that things weren't going so well.  Meanwhile, the manager was running around trying to do the work that waitstaff seemingly wasn't handling. The whole situation was a debacle and it went from a nice Saturday lunch to both my wife and I sitting there annoyed.    Why would we ever spend money to go through that again? Answer: we won't.

zsmHpVTR2DRs21S04MUe6Q.text: Very pleased with both the service and the food. Our waiter was friendly and right on top of everything. It took a little while for the appetizer to come out (but I didn't notice because I was enjoying the company I was with) and the only reason I knew that was that the waiter brought over a second appetizer as an apology for it taking so long! Started off with the shrimp tacos-- very yummy but the soft taco shells got soggy and fell apart but the flavor was AMAZING , and also got their wings (personally the wings were nothing special I'd stick to the shrimp tacos). Then our waiter recommended the chicken and waffles-- another fine choice. They were served with a sriracha maple syrup and some tasty spicy brussel sprouts. Last but not least the dessert--FRIED OREOS! really you can get one order and share it among 5 people. One is all you need. All in all I went home a happy foodie (with left overs of everything, the portions are huge) Im very pleased with the service and the food and cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp tacos
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oreos

OlfutHJroUV0hXUt-XRzug.text: Had dinner here last night. Chose to try restaurant based on interesting menu on restaurants web site. When we received a menu it was totally different and a bit boring. We were casually told without apology the web site has been wrong for a long time. We ordered and food was average at best. Food was delivered before we were given any silverware. Had to ask multiple times for silverware while our food got cold. Service was beyond terrible. Server was indifferent to our presence. Will not be back. This place is more of a bar and should limit the food to nothing more complicated chicken fingers.

mF5Dd0cn1Txr8nnqLwQiAA.text: I was excited to try this place after passing by it many times only to realize, I should have KEPT passing by. The customer service was horrible and the food was forgettable. We were seated around 9:15pm and unbeknownst to my party - which was a total of five kind and cooperative people who barely ordered anything - this was 45 mins before the kitchen closed, even though the place stays open until 12am.  After we had been sitting about ten minutes, the grumpy manager came and started setting down some napkins and silverware without a greeting or even a smile. He made sure to let us know with his body language and lack of response that this was a huge inconvenience for him. After we had already got our food and started eating, it was a few minutes to 10pm and one of us asked for extra dressing for a salad. The waitress returned about 5 mins later and told us the kitchen is closed and that specific dressing was house made, so she went to get a different dressing and when she returned, with aforementioned manager grump in tow, she told us that he wanted her to let us know that the kitchen was now closed and someone should have informed us of the kitchen close time when we walked in the door... Um, ok? We already ordered and were eating our mediocre food...  ...So at that point, it was just rude and unnecessary. Even after all that, we were still very nice and polite; the waitress, Brittany, and more specifically the manager need an attitude check. Will not be returning unless I hear of them getting new management. Such a shame since there were a few things on their menu that I'd love to try.

gw0_wSiTermYeVyZYLFlWQ.text: Fun place to grab some drinks, never had the food.  But, I hear the brunch is killer.

duFezei7sEZRVSzpxEYW3g.text: Sad that I wasn't able to sit on the rooftop for lunch like I planned because it isn't the season for that.. but I got a salad and added chicken and it was delicious. Also got 20% to come back and eat lunch again! Will go back!

ujvbt-qKmerUJIy30d_tHw.text: If you are looking for a place to have a drink with a great view of the Charlotte city skyline, especially if it is nice enough outside to be on the roof, this is a great place.  I would give it 4 stars for that purpose.  The 2 stars is for the restuarant portion.  As others have commented, this place used to have a very eclectic, interesting and flavorful menu.  It was also a place where you could find a table where you did not feel you were part of the bar area and have a relaxing meal.  Those days are gone.  It seems the Rabbit is changing into a sports bar of sorts.  Better food than a typical sports bar (though a bit pricey), but no longer a "nice restaurant" destination.  We visted last weekend to have a quiet VD dinner. We were seated in what used to be one of the only quiet spots in the restaurant on the first floor at a table against a wall which had a 50"+ TV which was just 6" up the wall from the table top.  We literally felt we were in the front row of a theater.  Extremely distracting bordering on the ridiculous.  Not condusive to having a relaxing dinner.  The waitress however realized we were not happy and immeadiatley pulled the plug on the TV.  Kudos to her and her service.  The specials were pricey for the average quality of the dishes we received. Not very special "specials".  The menu is vastly different than when it originally opened and not very enticing in our opnion.  I know the original chef left a year or so ago.     I hope they find their identity in the near future, but until then ..... have a drink, soak in the view and move on to dinner somewhere else.

JCMG1Nveot9AMVW0QvLkxQ.text: Overpriced, mediocre food. Bland atmosphere. Completely out of place and awkward feeling. Peculiar Rabbit is what happens when you have no vision of what you want to do, but decide to try and capitalize on the success of other businesses in an area. None-the-less, considering who owns it, I'm sure they will spend all the money they can to try and turn it into the go to spot... Even if people only begrudgingly go there.  Case in point: After a dismal turnout for their first 2 months, they decided to start paying $2500 a month to buy up 210 parking spots (far more than necessary for a business of this size) that were previously used for free community parking for all businesses in the area. Now, these spots have been turned into $5 premium parking spots. As a reward to anyone who pays $5, you get a $5 credit at Peculiar Rabbit! Nice, right? No, because you can't just swing by for a drink and get back your money... They expect you to build up a $50 tab at their overpriced restaurant first, before getting that $5 credit. Needless to say, the $50 catch isn't posted on the signs when you pull into the paid parking area. This is the bait and switch mentality of a failed business idea being forced upon a thriving neighborhood.  None-the-less, find some free parking and check out some of the great bars and restaurants in the area who don't need to turn their customers upside down and shake them to get a couple bucks. For breakfast / brunch, I suggest checking out Zada Janes, Bistro La Bon, or Soul. For lunch / dinner, I suggest Midwood Smokehouse, Soul, Dish, Diamond, Fuel Pizza. For drinks, check out Elizabeth Billiards, Twenty Two, Common Market, Thirsty Beaver, Snug Harbor.  Don't waste your time here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. You&#39;ll find this wrapped around the 210 spaces Peculiar Rabbit bought up. Keep in mind, you have to spend $50 to redeem.

kRgxHTJkWMggvpupuWRj6g.text: Food is pretty good, the service matches... With the excruciating exception of the hostess.  We called one night to try and get a reservation.  We were told on one call that the wait was an hour.  I asked if we could call back in a few minutes to check on what some friends wanted to do to see about making a reservation.  We were told that was fine.  Called back and was told they didn't take reservations when there was already a wait list.  Called back the next day and made reservations and told them roof seating.  When we arrived, we were told that it would be an hour wait... We then sat in the bar area where we watched several parties come in and go straight up stairs to the roof.  Not sure what social club we stumbled upon but this is the first and last time we'll be here.

1tOnOzSVuP2NdXJWqlV8vQ.text: Love the hot bacon and tomato salad with fingerling potatoes and added Salmon! The menu is simple yet tasty and has delicious options. I like the meat loaf & lamb burger too! Good service and beer choices.

0RnZnTRzEmX_wQlwTzpo8Q.text: So after thinking of going here "one day" we finally did. First of all, do not let my 3 stars change your mind about going to this place. The food is a-mazing. But my lack of 4/5 stars is heavily influenced by the noise level here. Omg, forget hearing what the people across the table were saying, I could barely hear what my boyfriend was saying, sitting right beside me. Their music is loud, and there are people around yelling on top of that and by the end of our evening I had a headache. Maybe it's different if you sit outside or upstairs, but we were on the main floor.  That being said, all the food at our table was good and there wasn't a single thing I didn't like. For appetizers, we had the Devils on Horseback, OMB Pretzels and the Disco Fries. The first two were awesome, the disco fries were a bit soggy. For entree I had the Bahn Mi, my boyfriend had the Peculiar Burger and the two others from our party had the Peculiar Rabbit and the Pork Belly. The Bahn Mi was totally mind-blowing. The Peculiar burger was good, but nothing great. Probably not worth $11 I would say. The Peculiar Rabbit was alright (yes, it's rabbit meat) and the Pork Belly again, was really good.  My only complaint about this place really is the noise level. I know I said it already but it's worth stressing on because it really was annoying. We will definitely go back, and sit outside or on the roof, since it looked really nice out there. I would probably have the Bahn Mi again though.

20ugOVfT9nUpOdFW2nbpTQ.text: Please, do yourself a favor and do not go here. The service is absolutely horrible and the staff are rude. We went at a non rush hour time, barely 10 people, and we had to get up and search for a server to get some drinks. We saw a ton of cockroaches, and the bathrooms were beyond horrible. This place is disgusting and unfortunately we ordered food before we saw the roaches. The food was hard and gross.

FXFuL_jAua8aoiZEyg82JQ.text: Plaza midwood neighborhood has been a staple since I was a little girl. The peculiar rabbit, relatively new is offers pretty decent food, drink options, and view of the skyline. Definitely a bit of peace in the now busy area. It's worth a try.

ORO51Z0EKQ5ZZfN3OZRBig.text: What happened to this place?  I went here exactly a year ago and was blown away by their menu. They had an awesome poutine selection, lots of other impressive menu items and these sausage rolls that were wrapped in blueberry pancakes that were absolutely one of the best things I've eaten in Charlotte (which is saying a lot). So I find myself asking, what happened to this place since their menu selection is vastly different and even things like their sausage rolls are dreadful now.  I went with my wife on Saturday and we sat on the street level patio which is apparently smoking seating in Charlotte? Weird. Anyhow the service was so-so. The waitress was very nice but barely there. I ordered the sausage rolls which did look a bit different then last year on the menu. Regardless I hoped they were still close to the same.   Wow was I wrong. They were terrible. Different kind of sausage used, it tasted more like a turkey than a pork breakfast sausage. The outside was just this boring bread concoction instead of the super tasty pancake outside like last time. There was no maple dipping sauce, instead it was topped with this awful new sauce that was a tomato base or something. It was so awful I didn't even finish it.   I also had their watermelon and pork belly salad. The Watermelon wasn't ripe or very flavorful at all. The pork belly had a very odd consistency. It felt like they were trying to recreate Soul's famous Pork Belly & Watermelon tacos but in salad form and just failed at it.  The entire meal was such a  disappointment I wanted to get out of there quickly and find food elsewhere. I'm shocked at the drop in quality from last year to now. I'm not sure if they had a change in management or turnover in the kitchen, but this place is a shadow of it's former self. Until things improve you really should go elsewhere since there's so many better places to eat in that area.

XL3axtgRWCqgyU3xXfs5cw.text: This was our 3rd stop on a bar crawl.   We enjoyed the layout of the bar. Lots of places to stand and or sit. Nice tv's. Great people.   The bartenders were a little off tilter. Not a real warm feeling this night. But the drinks came fast and were good.   There's a cool attached room with a pool table, skee ball and a basketball game.   We'll definitely be back especially with the nice outdoor area they have in front.  This was our 3rd stop on a bar crawl.   PMBC 2017 Plaza Midwood Bar Crawl  December 29, 2017

4Q4MFkUqQYCLe0ojmvOsfQ.text: Mambo Fridays! We were going somewhere else when we hopped out of our Lyft and heard the Latin tunes spilling out of The Peculiar Rabbit's beautiful rooftop! We looked at each other without saying a word, and went forth! I think the cover was five bucks, and well worth it! The DJ was so good playing classic and newer music. Salsa, bachata, merengue, cumbia... he had it all in his repertoire, and kept us moving for hours! We danced our butts off! The best part was grabbing a local beer from their fine lineup and getting back on the dance floor to dance some more! What a fun night!

_YK1ZbPNPvFoWhE_fNz40g.text: I wish I could say good things about this place, but unfortunately I can't.  They are located in a very nice area with many restaurants and bar. This place always caught my attention because they have like a rooftop with a nice view, specially at sunset. We were a party of 20 people celebrating one of my friends birthday. We got there around 7pm and were sat on the second floor. The place wasn't busy at all. The waitress came and got or drink order. Unfortunately they only had beer and wine to serve, since they are changing their menu all the special drinks were not being served.  The food options are kind of weak and pricey. I am glad they are changing their menus.  The decoration inside is interesting and they can fit a lot of people  in there. Our waitress did a good job but she could've done better.  Our food took around one hour to get ready, take in mind the place wasn't that busy for the food to take so long!  My husband my friend and I decided to order the Korean Bbq fried chicken. The portion of food had no consistency at all!  I had 8 pieces of chicken, my husband 7 and my friend 10. How come they have no consistency on their food portions? Also the wings were just okay, definitely would not order again! I tried some of my other friend risotto and it was no good. I love risotto and can tell that was one of the worst I've ever tried.  As you can imagine I will never be back, which is sad since the place is nice and the service was good, but the food and the wait just terrible!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

oUfRPCBs96de5yh-E1N7og.text: I honestly just come here for the views. I mean... Who doesn't? To add onto my honesty, this is probably my least frequented spot (next to Whiskey Warehouse) in all of Plaza Midwood but it's a decent place to take friends or family from out of town.   Definitely grab a drink at the bar, and if the weather is right, head on up to the rooftop and enjoy Charlotte's beautiful skyline. Take your boothang and impress them! ;)   The food here has been hit or miss for me. Couple years ago, I came here for a post-work Team Bonding event and they had great food for dinner. I thought I recalled more burger options? Most recently, I came with clients and the food was so-so. I have heard that the weekend brunch here is really great though and a totally different menu so I won't totally disregard them just yet!

TJyNI3LB2IxNA53FN_oqxA.text: Pros: Great roof view Drink specials Good beer list    Cons: Bad food Bad cocktails AWFUL service SO SO SO slow  I've been here multiple times and every single time I am disappointed with my food. It's cold or too greasy or not as expected or just.. bad. Also, it's consistently the slowest restaurant I've ever been to. It takes forever to get your drink then even longer for your food. There are much better restaurants in plaza.

lo_MCkKFlxHXE9LI-mWlFQ.text: I've gone to this place a few times now, to come up with a collective review of the establishment. We went for their Sunday brunch. I got the chicken and waffles. They were pretty good. I would say this place is a little over priced for the proportions they give you. But the chicken was amazing! I received one chicken tender, and a waffle for 16 bucks. I will say, it was a harty tender, but still across the street they're serving the same thing w more tenders for 11 bucks.  You can do the bottomless mimosas for 25 a pop per person. Don't think you're about to share this, they will quickly shut you down. A cheaper alternative if you're not wanting to go that route would be to do individuals for 3 bucks a pop.   In short, I will be returning. The service here was excellent.

KC8PegAziB4DwaetTaMoMA.text: This is a sneaky place for brunch. It is a bar. But I couldn't find a place to take my wife and baby mama for Mother's Day so I opted for The Peculiar Rabbit despite a low review score... And I was rewarded with the best breakfast/brunch I have ever had. The fluffiest eggs I have ever had. Everyone in my party; wife and three kids, all loved their meals. Chicken and waffles, biscuits and gravy, even Avocado toast. Amazing food and great service.

dPTeGgeCFaYp4oVPy6-hLQ.text: The owner or manager has somehow gotten my name on his email list and has been persistent in trying to get me to come to this restaurant.   I think they think that I am a still a manager in the pharmaceutical industry and they are trying to get me to recommend them for catering meals in doctors' offices.  I was a little bit surprised to find that this feels exactly like a pub with bar food.  Its atmosphere was somewhat dark and it definitely had the Plaza Midwood funkiness!  Tom and I sat on high top bar stools and had a waitress who was fun and fit the place like a glove.  I ordered the fish and chips. It was a very large portion size.  I would say it was average for what it was. I didn't finish it because I just got full and tired of eating.  Plus, I normally don't order fried food.   The menu was full of different burgers and sandwiches and salads.  For me, it just felt like a good day to order the fish and chips, instead of another day for salad. Sometimes you have to take off your Bugs Bunny hat and eat real food!   I am not sorry that I went here, but would probably not be in a big hurry to return.  I am surely not their demographic ideal. It is a long way from my crib.  But, if you are into restaurants with a funky bar scene, this might be the right place for you.  If you are into fine dining and are a foodie, you may want to choose a different restaurant.   I DO like their marketing and their persistence. It won me over.  And just yesterday, I received an email offering me a free appetizer.  Obviously, I cashed in on this and ordered some chicken wings.  That may have turned out to be my favorite food item today!  The wings were plump and really good with the blue cheese dip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

mfkUDnq0Fs-Nc3rq2RjE6Q.text: A bar in the middle of Plaza. It's got a great vibe and a good mix of indoor and outdoor spaces. Skip the food which is just OK. Go for the drinks and the fun.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The menu

7fklcKvr-dLDEkn6bYcBOg.text: Sooo disapointing... labor day weekend and my in laws are in town ... and took them to lunch. They both ordered a medium-rare  burger ... the service as already the worse EVER , no napkins no silverware until we had to get up and get them ourselves and fill our own cups ... the burgers were RAW ... so disapointing and disgusting frankly

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

WfzMby-qiiKUbSUujtXcEQ.text: For it to be 12:50 and one group with 3 people who received their order ahead of me and for my fries and burger to be  at or less than room temperature is less than stellar. I didn't bother to tell the waitress because she's not the chef. But this was my first visit and it will be the last. I don't like wasting money. Especially when it's empty.  No excuses.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

QUCsTXzok-VUIIUi-ofQpQ.text: Let's just say for our first visit was not bad. Could it be the service or just good friends, either way we had a great time. Our waitress Jessica was cordial and made it a fun night. Today I got promoted and we chose this place due to the fact it looks like a fun place from outside. I am glad we we went here the food, drinks and atmosphere was on point. We will most definitely visit it again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Time is right

Zwur81Pj5F2eSpSQz4UwLQ.text: In looking at the handful of negative reviews on here, I really don't know what people are expecting from a place like this.  There is absolutely no excuse for an unclean environment (I never noticed this during my recent visits) but giving a place 1 or 2 stars because they didnt have carrots to go with your wings or you saw bugs while eating outside is a bit much, to me.  I wouldn't call this place a dive, per se.  However, it doesn't pretend to be an upscale joint, either.  For being a super casual pub-style venue, this place has good food and excellent drinks (for example, try their Kentucky mule). My second time visiting, we went on a Wednesday night and they had good live music.  Restaurants don't often offer such amenities, especially mid-week... because it can cost a lot of $ extra.  This place seems to be more about guests having fun and enjoying good bar food in a laid-back atmosphere.  I've only encountered friendly staff, quick service, and a welcoming environment.  All of that said, I have seen a lot of complaints about unprofessional staff and I did see our server eating his dinner side-by-side with some lady (by their seated positions, assuming to be girlfriend/wife), which I wouldn't normally expect at a restaurant. Every restaurant I've worked at allowed eating on the job, but in the back or otherwise out of sight of customers.  It does seem like the management here may need to run a little tighter of a ship here.

Khxisg8X3E5_2axr83VIqA.text: The food here is really quite horrendous. We went with a group for brunch, and the majority of the group was disappointed by their meal. I had the salmon benedict, and in retrospect, I made a mistake by ordering this after taking a look around the place. My friend's avocado toast looked like a plate of vomit. Tasted like it too. How do you screw that up?? Service was fine, but the food was awful. Would never return.

pgsOXJNInTShNBS0e8xfMw.text: No matter how many times I come here the food is blah. I know I come back because the vibe is good and I love the outside seating and I'm a sucker for outside lighting. I wish the get a new menu and better chefs. I thought it was just me but talking with some folks at the nearby Common Market and they all felt the same way. I guess it's cheap considering other close by eateries. They have live music sometimes which is part of my 3 Stars. The menu is limited and they switch out in the middle of shifts. I could only get one of two drinks out of 7 on the menu. Needless to say I was confused but ok. It's a staple in the NoDa community so it's here to say

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

OOm92u_F6Urfee45Y46-uQ.text: Peculiar Rabbit is probably best known for their rooftop bar with skyline views, but don't sleep on their food (or cocktails).  Although it looks a bit divey both outside and in, Peculiar Rabbit makes high quality food and drink. They have a seasonal menu, and I've had great meals there in both summer and winter now. From a loadedgarden burger to their Summer's End Salad (which gives salad a whole new meaning), you can't go wrong. They also have awesome fries, which is a high compliment from a fry snob like me. They're thick-cut and seasoned, almost so delicious you don't want ketchup (but I still want ketchup because I love that too).  On my last visit, the Goose and I bypassed their crumpled draft beer menu list and found the cocktails on the back of the menu. They had a good range for all liquor preferences and were all reasonably priced as well!

XOdBN4kPNjgBd1LXalx8HA.text: Zero stars isn't an option. But at the end of the day, that's what this place deserves. We went by at 1:15 and we were told there would be an hour wait so she put our name down for 2:30. Fast forward an hour we go back right at 2:30 only to be told that they can't seat us because they are closing. I understand that places have miscommunication errors, occasionally. That wasn't the issue. It was the attitude that we got from both the hostesses. No apology, just a shrug of her shoulders and a "there's nothing we can do about it now"

K-v1ZR5O6YQUoz4iz3SvNA.text: Went here on a Sunday afternoon.  There was a rather long line, so they gave us a pager.  After waiting 30 minutes we went in to inquire. We noticed several empty tables so they seated us.  The pager never went off - guess they forgot about us.  A quick round of drinks and we placed our food order.  Another very long wait due to a kitchen backup.  When the food finally arrived, it was quite good.  I rate it 3 instead of 4 stars due to service.

uZpjw9wss6wOK_V7CKalsA.text: Our family of five ate at the Peculiar Rabbit yesterday. We had appetizers of Korean BBQ, calamari and pretzels and all were exceptionally tasty. The boneless ribs reminded me of my last trip to Seoul. Our entrees consisted of burgers, crab sandwich and the delicious Vietnam pork sausage sandwich. Service was pleasant, friendly and fast. This is probably the forth or fifth time that we have eaten there and each time it was wonderful.

4wHPiiIPIaiBIxeBQGS-tw.text: Our server tried so hard but he was hampered by a kitchen that was obviously overwhelmed. We arrived at 8:30 on a Fri evening. We had reservations and were seated on the roof top. The noise was incredibly loud; it was hard to hear anyone talk. Our food took 1-1/2 hours to arrive. Most was good but my skewers were mostly fat. I probably wouldn't return as there are too many good places in this town who have done better.

IXVcx7fMg7qkpnyrtGXC2w.text: Amazing spot! Great food, great drinks, great staff, great environment. I'm just sorry we didn't get here sooner.

pgf26E9uX1eWt1BxLBfu7g.text: Great location.  The rooftop has one of best views of the city.  The service was pretty good (although we heard the waitresses fighting over who had to serve us-- which ended up being fine but a little unprofessional).  The food was good.  Had the Bahn Mi-- which was NOT a Bahn Mi and I would not recommend.  The meat tasted like Gyro meat (processed pattie).  Also had the fried green tomatoes.  Also just OK, certainly  not the best.  The Onion soup was good.  The rabbit was great (i would hope) and the pork belly was also very good.  We thought the prices were good for the quality of food and setting was great.  One small drawback.  It's a three story bar with only two single service bathrooms.  Both bathrooms were locked for long periods of time.   Need to build out the facilities a litlte bit.  Overall, I would go back and would recommend to others.

ZW9sYtRqjwDRqVTRget2fw.text: This is a great place for brunch! Went there on a Saturday morning. My friend had the French toast. She said it was amazing. I had the Eggs Benedict Oscar- with crab cakes and asparagus. Came with stone-ground grits- delicious! A little mishap with the pepper shaker- the cap came out and pepper dumped out everywhere. No problem- the waitress cleared the area right away, apologized and had a new plate for me in no time. The coffee was piping hot and the OJ tasted freshly squeezed. There was lots on the menu I wanted to try. I hope I get the chance to go back!

LzTQ8dg9zPzAktXN0mIueQ.text: The service/waiter was excellent. Most of the food on the other hand was disappointing. Ordered the Lamp Lollipops for an appetizer and had to send them back because they were under cooked. For dinner I had the pork belly... it was dry and overcooked. My wife had the Lobster Mac & Cheese and it was good- not swimming in butter and cream like many restaurants prepare this dish. I will say the parsnip and leek soup was  excellent. We shared a dessert - the layered sour cream pound cake with almond cream and strawberry's  which was difficult to share due to the narrow opening of the small mason jar it was served in and lacked consistent flavor through the layers.

aizdiOE8oCk3O5nUnnJaLQ.text: Let me begin by saying if you are looking at the menu here on Yelp, or if you venture over to their website to look at an entirely different menu, surprise!  Once you actually get there you will find yet another menu.  So, if you are looking for something in particular that strikes your fancy, don't get your hopes up, it's probably no longer on the menu.  Wait you may say, the menu probably changes often?  No!  According to our server (who was excellent) the menu hasn't changed since she started in February.  We decided only to have several small plates and share..some were hits, some not so much.  I think we all agree the Disco Fries were the best thing we had and the Beef Wellington was really good, but it would have been nice to note on the menu somewhere it was actually de-constructed Wellington.  The pulled pork slider with a sugary glaze on the bun was just weird, some heat or spice to counter the sweetness would have been really nice.  Too bad the wait at Soul was so long, I know at that place, the food is done right!  Live and learn, next time it will be worth the wait.

dluEriUN6W3GZA-7202DvA.text: The ambiance is nice here, much different than when my sister owned it as the Goblin. A unique building that used to be a church, they did a great job renovating it. Great seating, love the upstairs patio, great view of down town. The food is not what I would consider high end. I got the chimichurri steak, expecting a modern take on the Cuban style. There was no discernable flavor of chimichurri, and I kind of expected some actual chimichurri sauce, but they didn't have that. It just tasted like steak, nothing at all special or rememberable. My steaks at home are much better, and for $27 I could have gotten steaks for everyone! Plus it was overcooked, I asked for medium rare, it came out medium to medium well. I couldn't even finish it it was so tough. The "salsa" on top was made from canned tomatoes, kind of gross. The black beans tasted straight from the can, I know because that's how I do mine. If I pay that much for a meal I expect better. The corn casserol was so saturated with butter that the butter seeped out all over the plate. The only thing cuban about this was the sprig of cilantro. My boyfriend got the sheppards pie, and said it was fine but the portion was small for $14. The drinks were well prepared. The dessert was pretty good, a little rich for us and we couldn't finish it. Overall I would return to enjoy a beverage and look out into the skyline, but I will never eat here again, waaay too overpriced for par food. If I pay that much I expect it to be worth it.

iBmDics2OJEwdnNzxRiWxg.text: We threw my mother's surprise 50th birthday party at the Peculiar Rabbit and had a fantastic experience with the venue, food/cocktails, and staff.  My father worked diligently with the event coordinator, Suzanne, and with her expertise they were able to successfully pull off the surprise.  Suzanne was very helpful, efficient, and organized.  The staff at Peculiar Rabbit were pleasant and very professional.  They assisted with decorating the venue and with creating the theme of the party.  The weather created an unexpected twist as we had planned on having the party on the rooftop, but we decided to have the party inside (due to rain), Suzanne was able to reserve the second floor for our private event with no hassle from other patrons.  The travel theme provided an array of their delicious food (jerk chicken, lamb, etc), which Suzanne and her staff provided the leftover wrapped up at the end of the evening.  We highly recommend The Peculiar Rabbit for any private party needs!

YLufge_aWvY2jls49thk0g.text: Went to Peculiar Rabbit this morning for brunch. I've never been and am glad I didn't read the reviews prior to going or I probably would've changed my mind.   Really cool atmosphere. Clean, cool views of the city, nice decor.   Food: First, our server brought out some delicious chocolate nut banana bread which was a tasty surprise. I ordered the chorizo omelette at the recommendation of our server. So glad I did, because it was so full of flavor. The chorizo was really tasty and perfectly cooked. Paired with home fries, it was a delicious combo. I also ordered a cup of coffee which wasn't too good but that's ok, the omelette made up for it.   The boyfriend ordered the French toast which I snuck a bite of and it was also really good. He loved it too. Peculiar rabbit is generous with their portion size, so go hungry.   The service was attentive and quick and friendly from the time we walked through the door.    I definitely plan to go again for dinner and check out the rooftop seating. Give this place a try!

OvEFtT16-HeDJeO1pAf0yw.text: This was the worst service I have ever experienced.  I have traveled and ate all over the country too.  Our server was completely incompetent.  We were seated in the downstairs bar area after calling ahead with a reservation for a seat upstairs.  They were not accommodating in the least.  Then it took almost an hour to get drinks.  They were out of beers but didn't tell us until after ordering.  Ordering took another thirty minutes to an hour with food coming out cold, burnt and not together.  My salad took almost ten minutes after the other entrees came out.  We complained to the manager, who we thought was going to help.  He did comp half the checks, which was nice but then everything continued to go down hill.  Our checks were a mess and that took another thirty minutes or longer for them to run out credit cards.    I will never go back here.  The service was awful and food was ok at best.  Also the server was rude.  Sadly, it was my friend's husbands 40th birthday and we expected better than this.  What a horrible evening.  I think the one star I gave this was very generous.  Likely they will be out of business if they continue with these idiots running the show.

1H6t3ISbzx7bOv8V4RcKMw.text: Friendly Staff. The drinks weren't too good though. I wouldn't come back but I'm giving it three stars because of the amazing view, awesome location, easy parking, and the cool bartenders.

qSbsL9ehDB3aaEPkcdf8Ng.text: Great brunch and amazing mules. I tried the grapefruit but for a sweeter choice peach is delicious! Friendly staff as well with patio seating and great views of CLT.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon omelette with cheese grits and grapefruit mule

C1BoGg2lV16IT2MK1EtCcw.text: I adore Peculiar Rabbit. Have been coming here for a while. Love the food, awesome staff, and they always have something fun going on.

rD9wdywcMe2cnBcDj5HFpA.text: To start I will say reserve a table like we did or you might be waiting awhile before getting a table.   Atmosphere was nice and relaxed and priced pretty well. Inside was pretty loud but nothing too crazy.  Took forever to get food. Went with three others and they got their food a good while after we ordered. I got mine about 5 to 10 minutes later. Before that I was approached by the manager and was told they were having to remake my food and it was on the house. Pretty awesome on their part for owning up to it.  Sampler plate or something named similar to it. Eggs, biscuit, cheesy grits, and bacon. Grits were pretty awful. Eggs had no flavor. Biscuit was dry without any flavor. Bacon was good.  Friend got the chicken and waffles. Looked great tasted okay but  without a lot of flavor.  Wife and other friend got biscuits and gravy. Which was totally awesome. Seriously I can only recommend that dish because it was the only thing that had flavor to it.   I will give this place a second chance maybe later and get something off the dinner menu.

ZAKGUO1fZw1cCwNcK22L6A.text: We went to The Peculiar Rabbit on a Sunday evening around 7:30. There weren't very many people in the restaurant so we would have expected much better service.   We were sat in one of the small back rooms with an unstable table, which we didn't notice until our beers started sliding. Our waiter asked if we were ready to order not long after we sat down so we asked for one minute. We subsequently waited a long time until we had to flag down our waiter to order.   We ordered the poutine fries and pretzels as an appetizer with the short rib grilled cheese as an entree. After waiting 20 minutes, the short ribs grilled cheese entree came out. The creamed corn side was cold which had me concerned about the state of the appetizers we still hadn't received. After I had flagged down our waiter again, I had to ask him to check on our appetizers.  Luckily the appetizers were warmer and had more flavor than the entree. The pretzels with the beer cheese were good. The fries were also pretty good (especially after we added the beer cheese from the pretzels since there wasn't much cheese on them originally).  All in all, our opinion of the restaurant would probably be very different if the service wasn't so bad. I'd give them leeway if it was a busy night, but on a dead Sunday evening, I'd expect better.
