7xg2b4r6ldJAhOJ0yIUW8Q.text: Knowing that it was going to be an awesome Saturday evening weather-wise, I booked our first reservation on OpenTable for the Peculiar Rabbit, hoping to dine outside.  When we arrived, the hostess "couldn't find" our reservation (but OpenTable was quick to send me an email later letting me know that I didn't show up for the reservation I made), and we were seated in a "dining room" in a side room off the first floor, back in the very corner.  It was great for conversation in an otherwise noisy bar/restaurant, but the room had no atmosphere whatsoever.  It felt like a cafeteria dining room, and put an immediate damper on our first impression/visit.  We stuck with it, though, trying to make the most out of the situation.    We started with the pretzel bites appetizer because it came with a "beer cheese dipping sauce."  You only get a tiny ramekin of "dip," which was actually just the beer cheese soup.  (Our server did kindly bring us more upon our request, though.)   I assumed the beer cheese dip would be different than the beer cheese soup since they'd require different consistencies, but since I'm not a professionally trained chef, what do I know?  I know not to order them again or recommend them, that's what I know.    The pretzel bites were a bit greasy and we realized that we had to ask our server for napkins/silverware, which the hostess neglected to give us upon seating us.  (Seriously--is checking off reservations, seating people, and bringing them menus & silverware too much to ask of one person?  Is it too much to remember?)  My partner ordered the Vegetable Wrap and loved it.  I ordered the Lamb Burger and loved it.  It was juicy and had a lot of flavor.  As a side, I went with French Fries, and they had a lot of flavor, too.  They had a crispy coating on the outside and were an excellent complement to the burger.    Having never dined at the restaurant before, I asked our friendly server Christian about the other floors of the building.  He told us about them and recommended we walk up to the rooftop for the view.  The second floor wasn't that great for dining, but when we got up to the rooftop, we loved the view and saw open tables.  Why wasn't this an option for us?    So because the food and service was great, we'll return, but we'll know what to do next time.

hPctxrMjbJjl10YlAfBcig.text: The beer selection is pretty much limited to IPAs and basic lagers. Food is mediocre at best (and that's being generous). The food used to be better, but it seems like there is a different head chef who works back there has really been blowing it. Wait time for food is ridiculously long. The location/rooftop patio and staff are great which is why i gave it two stars. Other than that- the kitchen needs some serious work before I would recommend this place to others.

hOB6ADKeWmGptUyhxgNfmg.text: This week's Exciting about Eating journeys to the Peculiar Rabbit, a farm-to-fork gastropub in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte.  This neighborhood pub attempts to make everyone feel at home with their comfortable interior and friendly service.  Dora here. Oops. Forgot to snap a picture of that comfortable, inviting interior. I was so impressed with all the beautiful exterior seating.  While we waited for our appetizer, the server dropped off complimentary scones. Fresh out of the oven hot, the coconut pineapple pecan scones melted in my mouth although I couldn't really taste the pineapple.  Dora here. I'd go back just for the scones! Soft, light and delicious!  The Mexican Street Corn Fritters may be some of the best I've ever eaten! Roasted corn on the inside, good texture and golden brown on the outside. The honey-lime cilantro aioli paired perfectly with the fritters.  Dora here. Such a wonderful blend of textures with the crisp outside and soft inside, and loaded with corn. Loved, loved, loved the lime aioli.   The Chicken and Waffles dish was huge! Chicken battered in 12 Herbs and Spices, malted milk waffles, Vermont maple syrup and two soft scrambled eggs. The eggs and waffle took a back seat to the fried chicken. Crispy, tender and moist. Outstanding!  Dora here. I visited Peculiar Rabbit with a dear friend a few weeks ago, and I enjoyed it so much, I was anxious to bring Ernie back. The last time, I sampled the PR Burger. Awesome, btw, but this time I ordered the Chicken Biscuit. A giant cheddar biscuit with fried chicken breast, American cheese, hot sauce and mayo served with crispy breakfast potatoes. Yum! A tad spicy, which I like, but I preferred to eat the chicken and biscuit separately. The breakfast potatoes were tasty with the perfect amount of seasoning. I wanted to cry that I had to leave some on my plate. Maybe the next time we'll check out that rooftop deck. :)  ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

95LKbnWSHVYuGN-MVUDVJw.text: Went here a few weeks ago for breakfast on a Sunday morning.   The first thing that strikes you upon entering the Peculiar Rabbit is the peculiar environment and Peculiar ambiance that exist within the walls of this Plaza Midwood gem.  Its hard to describe, its kind of dark, feels like your eating in an old house that was remodeled into a restaurant/bar.    As far as the food, I thought it was good not great.  Although the service was a little slow, our server was very polite and friendly and I would definitely give their Sunday brunch another shot.      I would definitely like to check this place out on a weekday evening for dinner an drinks just to see what its like.

WU1wlkx_op4SQa0qEJmFUw.text: Ok so I just stopped in here for dessert today and will need to come back for a proper meal and full review, but trust me, this dessert deserves its own review!  It was a funny coincidence because I was with a friend and had just been telling her how much I despise absolutely everything about bananas, the taste, the smell, the texture... Then we walk in and the bartender immediately suggests that we try The Elvis, a dessert comprised on banana nut chocolate chip bread, peanut butter ice cream, salted caramel, candied bacon and whipped cream! My friend's eyes lit up and 4 out of those 5 components sounded amazing to me so we gave it a shot! We'll it was beyond amazing and the banana flavor was faint enough that I was still able to enjoy the dessert. Every component of The Elvis, including the banana bread, was perfection and this experience definitely makes me want to go back and try some of their other items!   I also found out from the bartender that they employ a pastry chef who is solely responsible for the dessert menu and thought that was very impressive, especially for a gastropub. I would never have thought of The Peculiar Rabbit for a romantic date of dessert and drinks, but now this will go straight to the top of my list!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Elvis

xtizrSEYgzu-5aeSXp0Utw.text: Peculiar Rabbit what happened? You used to be one of my favorite places to eat and drink. Now the wait staff is no where to be found and if they do come by watch out for the attitude. No cocktail menu anymore. No deserts just "fried Oreos"???? What the heck. My stop there last Saturday was terribly sad except for the view from the rooftop. I will not be back for a long time. Should have checked recent reviews before I went.

OUA2Fvvp-CSF28cAAm7-rQ.text: We were there for our pre-anniversary dinner and as promised, the view of downtown was great! Ashley was serving us that night and she was perfect! The food was great and portions just right. We ordered the chicken wings with the lemon rub which was OK-would have preferred it baked, but that just might be my choice-by husband enjoyed and devoured it. The Pork schnitzel was amazing with the jager sauce! I had the salmon which was perfectly cooked and we got an extra serving of the jager sauce which went perfectly well with my salmon too. Definitely going back here soon!

CB_FKDEFhxj6IQsy6gCeRg.text: I have been to the Peculiar Rabbit probably 4 times, including once for brunch.  This place had potential but just never made it even close.  The food is just not good and drinks are pricey.  The largest problem, but one that seems to fit right in with the subpar food, is the hideous tarps they have over the front patio and rooftop.  Looks absolutely awful!

SJsmEZywkrp9517mCikFrw.text: Went for brunch this past Sunday and was a first timer there. Sat on the rooftop as it was absolutely gorgeous outside. The view of the Charlotte skyline was nice to look it. Enjoyed my meal and mimosas but the service was absolutely awful. There were multiple servers on the rooftop and each only had a couple tables and it took forever to get a refill, to have our order taken, and to get our checks when we were ready to leave. They had a handful of brunch drink specials including $5 mimosas. Overall good experience just plan to be patient as service levels need Improvement.

1HD76Vv360JZauVkzlbs7w.text: Is it okay to write a review even though all I had was dessert?  For me, desserts tell a lot about a place.  I look at the dessert menu before I even order my meal typically because I want to know what I have to look forward to.  I also like to see how creative the chef is and if they have gone the extra mile to hire a pastry chef at some of these establishments.  If you put time and money into dessert then you clearly want your patrons to have the full experience and you care about the details.  If you slap on the usual (NY Style cheesecake, molten lava cake, carrot cake, brownie with ice cream, etc) then I have to question your loyalty to your customers.    All of that to say, I was excited to see some creative options when I was handed the dessert menu at TPR this past Friday.  My eyes immediately went to "The Elvis."  It was described as a chocolate chip bread with peanut butter ice cream, whipped cream, etc.  I was so excited but once it came out and I took my first bite, I was so distraught.  The bread was so dry!  What was it? Ezekiel bread with some chocolate chips smashed in?  The ice cream layer was so thin that you couldn't even take your spoon to get scoop.  it just melted into the hard, dry bread and it wasn't even making the bread soggy if that tells you anything.  How could this be?  How could something that sounded so good, be so awful?  I have to say, this was probably one of the worst dessert experiences I have ever had.    Good thing they have a fabulous rooftop and are in such a great location.

mcd5dacwAlK4MlujqXWMxw.text: Such a great environment! The best Shepards pie in Charlotte..melts in your mouth. Excellent  cocktails. This place has a rooftop with wonderful view of uptown as the backdrop. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good place to eat in the area.

NsvLk1S6xYGye9TzSFnIWA.text: Visited for a quick drink and bite to eat at the bar before a concert. Parking's tough, but service was friendly.   Ordered the corn fritters, and it took about 25 minutes for them to come from the kitchen, at 6PM on a Thursday when the restaurant wasn't terribly crowded. This meant I had to wolf them down quickly in order to make it to our concert on time.  I really wasn't impressed with the dish. The fritters were oily and tasted burnt. It tasted like the fryer oil hadn't been changed in some time, and there had been several items burned in it previously.  The fritters were also lava-hot, which is normally a plus in a restaurant when you have time to eat them, but not in this situation when I had only about 5 minutes to finish all of my $8 dish.  I wouldn't go out of my way to visit the Peculiar Rabbit, but I hear they have a great rooftop view (haven't been up there) and they are rather close to Oven's Auditorium so if I'm back in the area, I'll give them another try.

aVf87xSSxLNUBYVSOcxWLA.text: I can't rate this place on the food, but my sister and I stopped here for the beer & pool to kill some time while visiting Charlotte on NYE and we were quite happy with both. I got whatever was on tap by Holy City...can't exactly remember the name, but it was a coffee porter. Really really good. The pool was free, so I can't complain that the table didn't seem to be 100% level. The bartender was really friendly too, which I always appreciate!

8W66unV4yoW_ZcQX8E6Awg.text: Me and the girls heard this place was closing so we decided to give it a try. We came last weekend and found out it was bottomless mimosas during brunch. And lets just say we got our moneys worth. I had to leave my car and get an uber home at 2 in the afternoon LOL. Pretty sure if i drank 1 more mimosa I would have been bottomless LOL  -Karen

53TXJlRBLlhz6ZYxtoxVVw.text: Food was amazing. (See Pictures) The flat bread was unlike anything I ever had. I love Brussel sprouts - and they did Brussels right in both the dishes I ordered. Every ingredient on the menu could be tasted. It was my first time eating at Peculiar and the food did not disappoint!   My group was also able to sit on the rooftop, the view + amazing weather + great food - pretty good combo.  The service was not the best, but our group came at an inconvenient time - and they let us know it. When we got there the hostess told us brunch would be over in 30 minutes, we were actually turning around to leave, but she called us back and said if we ordered quickly it would be fine.  We got sat down, the area was pretty full of people who hadn't gotten their food. We immediately ordered, didn't get our drinks until 15 minutes after and food about 40 minutes after.  Once we got our food, about 10 minutes the waitress was already rushing us about the check and asking if there were any plates she could take away. The whole patio was filled with other groups eating, so we tried not rush enjoying our food - but naturally we rushed. We did decide to just sit and enjoy the view/weather after our plates were taken away.   Nonetheless, food was amazing (5 stars in my opinion) and at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rumbledethumps Brunch
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Winter Veg Flatbread (Brunch)

ylG1ClBWZ6VpXpvhhry1pA.text: Stopped by here after work. For what it's worth- the food was amazing. I got the short ribs, mash potatoes and sweet potatoes fries- that's a whole lot of carbs  The ribs was extremely tender and very flavorful. It was a bit salty but I did not mind cause it went well with the mash potatoes. The potion was a bit small, but a value the quality over the quantity. The fries paired perfectly with a beer. Highly recommend and would come by if I'm ever in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short ribs, mashed potatoes and sweet potato fries

Fwl7EtpJQX5l1MvtR6d20Q.text: This place used to be my favorite, but I took a guest from out of town there this weekend and was very disappointed. I felt as though I had to justify everything and tell them how amazing it once was, but isn't anymore. There were three of us there and we ordered our food and drinks. The drinks came in plastic bar cups like you would get at a night club...I didn't like my mimosa from a plastic cup. The Bloody Mary was watery. When the food finally came out, there were only two plates...they'd put in the completely wrong order for the third. The waitress hardly apologized and never came back to check up. Finally the food came out, after the rest of us were totally done eating, and she said nothing other than, "sorry, here's your food." There was no real sympathy or apology, no offer to comp anything, nothing. I was so disappointed and probably won't return.

4pJnumJ95voUvfmV0mFUpA.text: This place is shitty  came to a event Parked across the street and got booted fir 125 I wouldn't support no event or restaurant here again

ntnnanIi2bcELRPC9B7ZAw.text: Me and my friends came here tonight and we had a wonderful time. The drinks are a little pricy and it was not water down which was wonderful. It's is 3 levels which made space once the rooftop get crowded. The bartenders were friendly and respectful. This was my group 1st time here for a big event. Each if us enjoyed our time out here.

fU3eUw4j5DS4A02OkYE-hQ.text: The majority of my visits have been for a drink or two, but this past weekend I dined in with a few friends. Upon arriving, shortly after 7:00pm on a Saturday night I was surprised to see how empty the place was, only two other tables and a few people at the bar. We had a large party and were seated in the side room. Service was pretty slow and the food was just okay. I had a Cheeseburger while others had Wings, Salads and Ribs. With the restaurant being as quiet as it was I would have expected are service to be a little bit better, but did appreciate they were able to split our tabs and everything was split correctly. Overall, may stop in for a drink again but not sure I would stay for food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Rack of Ribs
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger with Fries
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

y4fs8dEOm6wpXkCIA3bvBQ.text: I wish I could give more stars, I feel like 2 is pushing it. I've continually had terrible experiences at The Peculiar Rabbit and was hoping that would change, but it seems to be consistent.   I will review solely on my most recent experience, but again, it was very consistent with the last few times I've been there.   We went in on a week night, it was around 5:30pm--so around dinner time. When we first entered, all the staff was gathered around at the bar and someone said "Look alive people, look alive!" what concerned me about this, was that it wasn't just staff members who were working--it was staff members who were there hanging out and drinking, so this didn't appear to be a "huddle" before the shift, it looked like they were just hanging out. There was only 1 other table seated at this time. Throughout our entire time there, the staff was yelling to each other across the room or sitting at the bar or playing around right by our tables. It was so unprofessional. Not a single staff member took the initiative to say it needed to stop, manager on duty and bartender included.  We ordered the salmon flatbread to start, it was tasty--but small and came with one quail egg on it, was expecting a little bit more. For entrees we ordered the short ribs and fish and chips. This took quite a while to come out. Our waitress was mediocre at best. We had to ask for silverware after the appetizer came out, and it took 5 minutes to flag her down after the entrees came out to request salt/pepper and ketchup. Once the meals were on the table and we started eating we almost had to ask another server for water because ours was not paying any attention.  The short ribs came with a summer succotash that was SO salty we couldn't even eat it. To be clear, the entire meal was incredibly over salted, but the succotash literally burned your mouth. The fish for the fish and chips was impressive in size, but dripping with grease and mostly breading--I would cut off big pieces that were nothing but breading. I totally get wanting to go for the appeal of how it looks, but to sacrifice quality seems wrong.   The kicker was the bathroom. At this point we've had poor service, poor food quality and then we find out the bathroom is a complete DUMP. I went in right after a staff member to find there was no toilet paper, but they had moved the paper towels in front of the toilet...sitting on the floor. The trash can had no bag in it and was disgusting. It just killed me to know that a staff members saw that and didn't care. That sums up the experience at Peculiar Rabbit, it's like the staff just doesn't care.   Lastly, when I checked into Yelp--it said the soonest they could seat us was 9:00pm. I'm not sure how that is handled, but the place was completely empty other than two tables...had we checked Yelp first, we wouldn't have stopped-in thinking they couldn't seat us. So I'm not sure who handles the Yelp account, but they are either not doing their job, or purposely putting they cannot take tables to keep people out. I'd look into that one if I was the owner.  We've given this place multiple chances, it's just not improving.  At this point we've accepted it is what it is, we won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shocked and disgusted.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. I was shocked to walk into the bathroom, after a staff member was in there to find this. No toilet paper, just paper towels...on the floor
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short Ribs

0s8a51dtZqOrMW3OS4aNmA.text: Came here for the city views and brunch on a Saturday morning.  We were seated outside on the top deck at our request.    Friend and I ordered Bloody Marys and they were just ok.  They were out of olives, which happens to be one of my favorite parts in a BM.    The restaurant had opened about 30 minutes before we got there and the top deck was dirty and didn't look as if it was swept or recently cleaned.  There were broken glass pieces  (larger pieces) on the floors between us and a table next to us,  the table Next to us had a young child walking around, so that was our concern.  We told our waitress about the glass all around us and she wasn't surprised and told us ok.  It was very flippant reaction.    So our food came and most of it was just ok - nothing to write home about.  Home fries and eggs were decent, however the biscuit was HUGE but too dry to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

XYyNx-ZRnoj1gp1EcptA9w.text: My boyfriend and I came here for brunch as newcomers and we enjoyed it. The location was nice and we ate outside under the pergola (very relaxing). He ate the chicken and waffles and I had the "redneck garbage plate" and I loved it. The menu was a bit limited though.

n5_TEiS41iMgIoQjZ7A2XA.text: Food was great, but honestly worst service of my life. The "host" told us they were understaffed and that's why he was quiet. As someone that works in hospitality, you don't make it known if there's a problem, you fix it. Also.... it was empty. But now I know why. Please train your front of house, but again, great food. Ps when my entree came out with the sauce on it that I asked for on the side (no big deal, I get mistakes happen,) he said...."the cook is gonna be mad."

fdWEuoUNdipZVGbJKN76yA.text: The rooftop is a great atmosphere! We ordered the short rib grilled cheese, and it was pretty good! The wings were also good.

qQnpwCQsc_dCzrOik4KlqA.text: My friend and I stopped by for a drink because of how cool the building looked from the outside. We ended up having the watermelon sour beer and it was delicious! They had a band playing on the second floor and the owner made sure to stop by and say hello. Really unique place and the food served around us looked great!

Wf59EIxU_RPhfqBwlmfGiQ.text: My wife and I went here for one of her friends birthdays. So there was about 15 of us. However, this place doesn't seem well equipped to handle large parties as the service was really slow (not due to wait staff). Our food took about an hour to come out.   To start off the menus they handed us, the drink specials on the back we're not even being offered. We were told a new menu was coming and that was the reason. Okay, not a huge deal. I have never been here so I didn't really know what to expect from the food menu. My grandmother was British so I grew up eating a lot of English style food. A lot of their menu featured items I ate as a kid. The biggest thing I noticed right away way that a lot of them were kind of British but not the traditional/classic versions. Almost all of the menu items had a twist or spin on them. So if you want traditional style British food, look somewhere else.   Being that a lot of the revisions turned me off from the British items, I decided to try the Korean Fried Chicken. The menu said it came with Drums and Legs. Which are the exact same thing. The drums were not that good. They tasted like old microwaved chicken. The sauce had too much vinegar in it. If you like Korean BBQ chicken, look somewhere else. To make matters worse, my wife and one of her friends both ordered the same thing. Her friend received 10 drums, my wife 8 and myself 7. But we were all charged the same price. The drums were $11. Which I find was overpriced for what I received.   The wait staff was decent but nothing exceptional. But it is a pub, so I don't expect high levels of services. Some of the other people with us enjoyed their food, but my experience left me very unimpressed. I didn't even eat all of my wings, they were that bad. I've had real Korean BBQ wings and this were not even close to what I was expecting.   If you want a place to hang out with some friends and grab some drinks, then this place would serve you well. Other than that, I can't recommend this place at all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

1ZOCSQM24p1R9cjwGNEcNQ.text: I got the avocado toast for brunch. It actually had a good combination of flavors and was just the right portion size. I got the sauce on the side and good thing I did as I was not a fan.   Since it does have a strong bar presence there were a lot of people drinking and the acoustics were so bad I had a hard time hearing the person I went with. I don't recommend going out of your way to try the brunch but if you happen to go I would definitely recommend this dish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

DZsyhebSrp02OEb6Va-Pag.text: This is not in complete sentences...excuse my laziness. Went for a friend's birthday and had a waiter and his trainee. Took forever to even order appetizers...main entree came out literally an hour later and we waited for the check for another 30 minutes after demanding it.  Often our drinks were empty and to try and smooth things over the waiter brought out disgusting shots that no one drank because...we all had to work the next day and didnt want to waste empty calories on over sweetened pineapple upside down shots....complimentary appetizers would have been a better idea.  Had to remind the waiter to bring out the birthday brownie...and this was after we received our checks which was a little tacky. The excuse for the suckiness was..."we had a large party" to which I responded...who's fault is that??? The food was not really that good either...the hummus lacked seasoning. I looked forward to the lamb burger which was dry and dull...the disco fries were pretty good. I think this restaurant is good for brunch but dinner is not their bag for sure. To add, parking is terrible even on a slow night!!!  Lastly, the waiter forgot to split the checks and put the birthday girl's check on everyone else's check and instead of letting us know this he sent another waitress over to inform us because he was embarrassed...this was also tacky and classless as well. Not to mention, Im sure the trainee learned how to suck at her job in the future...will never return for dinner ever again.

vCImZxCW0ZPpIiTgb3oCTw.text: I REALLY want to like this place, but it after numerous visits I haven't had one good experience. The menus aren't my favorite; there have been a couple of times I haven't eaten because there isn't a single item that sounds good. Then, if I do order, it's either bland or mediocre.  I DO highly suggest this place for cocktails and beers; especially when you sit on their rooftop or street-level patios. They have a great bar.

_02-NQ0UaSnlFOJalPl8Jg.text: A few friends and I went here for brunch on 3/18. The location is not in the heart of uptown, but it's not far away. My friend lives right near the Panthers stadium and it was a quick uber ride to the restaurant. Since we took an Uber, I am not sure about the parking situation because I just wasn't paying attention to that. We made a 2:00 reservation, but were having issues with our Uber and called the restaurant to let them know we were running behind and they were understanding and gave us a little more of an extension. We arrived right on time and were immediately seated. We were seated in the front of the restaurant near the bar and it wasn't really busy. The restaurant is large and they have an outside patio and a rooftop area (with a fantastic view I might add).   They are doing a brunch buffet right now so I decided to take a look and see if I wanted that or their plated meal options. The buffet was small and OK. It wasn't bad, but not great either. I did decide to do the buffet since I could just get as much as I wanted for about $17. Some of the items on the buffet include: waffle station, carving station (there was pork and beef on that particular day), biscuits and gravy, meatloaf with cabbage (that was so good!), corned beef hash, cookies, salad, pastries, etc. You could also order eggs, bacon, and sausage made to order in the kitchen and brought out to you. The food was really good.   The drink specials were $5 mimosas and bloody marys and $10 manmosa (2 mimosas and a shot of vodka). I ordered a manmosa and it was good. Strong and good.   I would definitely recommend this for lunch, but I will try one of the plated options next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from upstairs
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch menu
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

1MZjaavxhn9DYsIKh_cWUA.text: This place is consistent. They consistently have slow service, sub par food, internal employee drama displayed to the customers, and extremely overpriced drinks for what you get.  Management obviously needs to retrain their employees / hire competent ones who aren't talking behind the backs of other waiters/waitresses to their customers. They need a hostess who is actually at the hostess stand. They need to remove their Bloody Mary from their drink menu. The gamechanger as they call it "has won many awards" however you will be extremely disappointed when it comes out with no toppings and a very very,basic probably store bough,  Bloody Mary mix.  Parking is a nightmare as well.   Been here 5 times (yea why do I keep coming back lol, stupid friends) and they are consistently bad!! Not worth the price.

yoXgOBFwhFL9SvPLKmFcuw.text: We came here for brunch and the food was not impressive. The guy bringing out the food had no idea who it was going to, 2 peoples food had to be sent back and one guy didn't even get his. The waitresses don't really care and the food is NOT worth the price at all. Definitely wouldn't waste your time on this one.

jSShwNviusrWs_2bv5G8Rg.text: Friendly service but i found it really cold in there, theres an outside area but a not a lot of seats i had pancakes there in the morning and they were good but i dont think the place is kid friendly if you are looking for a quick place to go for a bite to eat in the morning i wouldnt recommend it.

slgpYhPKEQl9UvoYYxl0dw.text: Great place to meet friends for a drink, the food however is just ok. Great patio seating though, and nice view of the skyline. Will go back again.

sBpwt-c7WbkurawVWSf3pg.text: Stopped in here for a late lunch the other day and it was wonderful!! I can't remember the name of the entree, but it was chicken with a light sauce on it that was out of this world! The service was great. The only down side was how dark the interior is, but if you sit on the patio that will remedy that. I've been there twice now, and the food was great both times.

slUUTmRG_w-lbvPqydFiTw.text: I gave this place 3 stars, which is kind of generous. I wanted to like this spot, it is in my hood and I love the rooftop. It started off great, but somehow the kitchen stopped giving a darn about the quality of food they put out. Maybe they changed the head chef? We have probabaly been here a total of 8 to 10 times, but the last several visits have been a disaster. The brunch was cold and tasted like it had ben sitting out for several hours before it was served. Not to mention, every time we called lately we got a different answer on whether or not reservations were needed. We were turned away last time, because we did not make reservations, but I was told on the phone we did not need them? Get your act together people, and for our sanity please hire some decent waitstaff. I know this is a hipster part of town, but you do not need completely green wait staff working at a place that requires reservations, or do they?

_oc7Vow2LkNNxN3jLFbEEw.text: I went here for the first time tonight. I was hesitant because the reviews weren't that great. My parents were visiting my bf and I, so I wanted to make sure we had a good dinner. We all LOVED this place. Our server was great. I think his name was Cameron. He was so knowledgeable about the menu and beers and he treated us like we were his only table. Our apps were delicious!!!! The figs wrapped in bacon were my favorite!! All of our meals were amazing too!! I had the meatloaf. Best meatloaf I've ever eaten!! Everyone was so happy with their meal. Overall, great experience and we will definitely go back!

VvnqaMprL2BX1PM2Y5wY2Q.text: Average bar food and incredibly over-priced for what you get. The menu items are not as described. Great atmosphere, stay away from the food, go for drinks only.

Y5JBGGO_2e8bTt08A1OyyQ.text: Definitely one of my favorites in Plaza Midwood.  Always a great spot to bring out of town guests for the spectacular view from the rooftop.  Service has always been really good.  Menu is a little funky but I usually find something good.  I don't come for the food really though.  The atmosphere, drinks, and people are awesome and FUN!

EBxVdtRISgmL3SxL-i9Pzg.text: Wow, hate to see people are not liking it here!!  I went for the first time last night with a friend and I will definitely be back!!!   We had reservations and were seated immediately!!  Our server arrived quickly and brought drinks out while we browsed the menu.  She stopped by again and answered all our questions about the menu in detail with lots of great recommendations and suggestions!!  I had the cornbread mac and cheese appetizer.  It was amazing!!  Perfectly creamy with a little spice!!!  I honestly think its the best mac and cheese in the city!!!!  Really really good!!  Came with a side of bbq which was also good.  That really in itself would have been a meal but I ordered the wild mushroom arancini omg phenom too!!!!!!!!  The risotto croquettes were to die for!!!  Very rich and very delicious!!!  I had a brownie dessert that was decent but nothing special but the app and meal were so overshadowingly yum that it was ok!!!!!

anVsTw1XbMajcyEy19P7fw.text: do NOT order the deviled eggs, the flavor is all wrong. honestly they really need to step up their food game.  the concept and intention is there but it falls short at flavor.  calamari was not crispy at all....please improve the batter.

ItFcFXdKE1R7jM6SrEAhVg.text: Boyfriend got the draft mocha stout beer, very reasonably priced. For an appetizer we got PBR mussels. We both loved them, but they did have a little kick to them! For a meal I got the pork belly. It had a lot of fat but once I got past that and just ate it it was actually really good. Probably just the cut of meat. The only thing I didn't like was the celery mashed potatoes. My boyfriend got the peculiar rabbit and really liked that as well as his mashed potatoes. He was impressed at how tender the rabbit was. Lastly, we split two desserts: the apple rhubarb crumble with honey wildflower ice cream and strawberry panna cotta. He doesn't like sweets but really loved both of them. I liked them both as well. I think the other reviews have been too hard on TPR especially considering they just opened a week ago. Give a brother a break!

_nJ4BDqVYY-mqjDjn1f-Jw.text: Great place. Quiet but still cool.  Two great outdoor patios. Upstairs and down. Love the Sunday Bloody Mary and mimosa specials. Def worth checking out.  During football season great place to watch the game with fighting crowds.

WLeMR-qSuR7pubYibRflvw.text: Fish & chips - a big piece of soggy, mushy, bland fish, with a big pile of lukewarm fries, during lunch when there was only one other table occupied.....I don't think so..

HNYjoKC6w-WNaAYQ6jaHWw.text: Great atmosphere on the patio in this nice weather this weekend.  Our server Rachel was very fun and did a great job.

XkSgajHcCM0381wTxxiWnQ.text: So...my husband and I were a little leery of a giant restaurant owned by Jackelope Jack's in the heart of our neighborhood. Maybe rightfully so. This week we've been there twice, on a Monday and a Wednesday. The first night we hung out on the second floor, in the game room and at the bar. We sampled their selection of beers and besides the service, were pretty pleased. The bartenders didn't seem to know anything about wine and little about beers (except for what they didn't have) and were pretty uninterested in us for the most part. The shoddy service might be a theme, as it just got worse on our second visit, not what we expect from a restaurant in PM. This time we felt like the server was rushing to get us out since we only had a beer a piece and split two apps. We were only there for 45 min. He kept trying to take a menu from us that we we kept in case we wanted to order more. He then kept trying to give us the check, they weren't busy, mind you. We ordered the duck mousse which is phenomenal (order extra crackers as they don't give you nearly enough for the generous portion of mousse) and the PEI mussels (not so good. Pretty scronny and about 1/4 were empty shells. The ham and pbr broth is not very flavorful, lacking salt, and isn't hardly enough in my opinion). The frites that come along side though, with the homemade ketchup, are up to par, nice and crispy. Hopefully they are still working some things out because it would be a shame to have such a monstrosity of a business in my hood that I can't enjoy. Hands down, BEST view of the downtown skyline I've found.

28rpjQTmKU1cL-qCGAPVEw.text: Had a big group for brunch and Rachel did a great job making sure we got our food as ordered! Plus, my boyfriend spilt his mimosa and she brought him a sippy cup for his refill--very funny!

jRbNA17utb_W8f4P3XuOHQ.text: My wife and I decided on lunch at the P.R. and are very pleased we did.  From the moment we arrived, everything was done promptly and professionally.  Alexandria served us efficiently without over doing it.  Our lunches were even better than expected.  We will return and soon!

X9eQncaN-1takn-qUxYnaA.text: Great menu!  Bison Burger for lunch is fantastic!  Great atmosphere, rooftop, etc. Chelsea was our server and was exceptional!

CrXkqLNjtZbuWQdpTyiqLw.text: Hands On Charlotte held an event to view the Wells Fargo Lights.  The food was great, the atmosphere was great and Chelsea and Thomas took awesome care of us.

iPnom7hDJT5nWa7LzJo1Dw.text: Overall a good, but not a great, experience. I loved my meal, the Banh Mi pork sandwich. One of the best sandwiches I have had in years. Very flavorful with some asian inspired spiciness. Girlfriend was not as lucky.  Her braised pork was a huge piece of inedible fat. Yes, it should not be a lean cut of meat but it was like a slab of lard. Dessert was great. It's called The Elvis. The name alone gives you a hint that it's going to be big and decadent and it is.  Big enough for 3 or 4 to share. Service was good for us but we could see from the tables around us that not everyone was so lucky. But we had a very good waiter. So all in all they hit on 2 of the 3 dishes and we had good service. Not sure if we would go back though. It's not fair for people to gripe about the parking because that is a neighborhood trait and not their fault. If you don't like hunting for parking and your parallel parking skills are weak, you may want to skip plaza mid wood altogether anyway.

m9_sdB4JoSF20fkyhSQtBQ.text: If you are looking for Jackalope Jacks its time to graduate from College.  This is a sophisticsted bar menu that is executed to perfection. No wing night at this place. You feel like your in a beer commercial that's how perfect the atmosphere is. The city makes the perfect backdrop which make this a place a great first date spot or for beers with the guys. The game room fits with the bar ( which is on the second floor , the first floor is more of a restaurant and the roof is probably the best place of all.) perfectly. If I have to offer advice I would say split a bunch of bar snacks everyone I have had has been awesome. For dinner I have had the scallops and pork belly and both were great. My wife lived the Ribs and her dessert ( something chocolate) Service was awesome and the beer menu was spot on. You will not be disappointed I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

60XoUZyh9o1yuqY3xgjBFQ.text: The view of the city is nice, the atmosphere is casual and fun. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. For starters we had the sweet tea wings which were very good, and the jicama shrimp tacos which were ok at best. I had the chicken and waffles, chicken was juicy and overall the salty sweet combo was tasty. He had the short rib and felt it was lacking flavor, giving it a C. We tried the fried oreos, yum! The whoopie pie desert was enormous with tasty melted chocolate but was pretty lack-luster. I might consider going back for drinks with friends due to the atmosphere, but doubtful I'll be back for dinner.

dAaV9m2allxeApwUj5nnKg.text: This place is a cool chill spot. The view is amazing from the roof and the food is spectacular . Definitely a spot to go to if your in Charlotte. I would write more but I'm in a rush.

TxdqRNK_81FDOJ2ffDK8Sw.text: Very good bar food, great service, and one of the better skyline views in Charlotte from the rooftop.

PDX55f2JuY7qnnDb2puxuQ.text: Every time we've been here we have been fairly underwhelmed. Today was our final visit. We sat at the bar and after receiving 1 menu for both of us, we asked for another which took about a minute to get. Besides telling us the drink specials the bartender never spoke to us again. Not even to get a drink order. Not even when she brought the 2nd menu after we had been sitting for a few minutes did she ask what we wanted to drink. After sitting for over 5 minutes without even getting something to drink we decided to go somewhere else. Such a shame because it's a great location with a beautiful building and view.

nsS9LnKFAS3tguYdI7eBbg.text: Food and view, what more do you need!  I can't understand how this place has 3 stars.  We ordered several appetizers to share as well as the Duck confit sandwich.  The sandwich was the highlight of the meal!  But the devils on horseback were not far behind.... The different flavors and textures went together very well.  Great place to have drinks on the patio without compromising dinner.

HywKkRgbb1sjYcRv_2ExrQ.text: Awesome Food! Chicken And Waffles Rocked! The Lobster Mac 'N Cheese was fantastic! Started the meal off with a Mediterranean plate for an app! Very very impressed by the atmosphere and food! The only issue was parking... not easy to find parking that you won't get towed from!

xV2hvRnApQAdFR5opiDQWQ.text: Took my husband, 4 and 6 year old for dinner to use our groupon. We have been here before, and enjoyed it but tonights dinner exceeded our expectations. Wild mushroom arancini was soooo good!

qsSzXqPOj5OaScHBJtojPA.text: This review is based on a couple different visits, but I didn't want to post a review until I tried the food.   My first couple of visit's were at about 5-7 pm on Thursday and Friday nights for drinks. The tap selection is of great variety and quality, with 24 taps there is a little something for everyone, whether you want to get a bit more crafty or just have a New Castle. The service was great both times with glasses being promptly checked on.  Sunday I decided to take my wife out there for a late lunch at around 2:30 in the afternoon, and it was a great visit once again. It was her first time there so I gave her a quick tour, the patio was a bit too chilly so we grabbed a table on the second floor with great views of the skyline.   She had a Peculiar Burger ($12) and I had the OMB Baby Back Rib plate ($12)...  The burger was a good lunch portion with a side of fries, my wife usually likes her burgers fairly plain but the egg and bacon were a nice treat that she loved!  The ribs were cooked well (fell off the bone and with lots of good flavor) and a great portion, I wasn't able to eat them all and had to take some home  For dessert we had the donuts ($7) and they were awesome! They come with both a chocolate and raspberry dipping sauce, my wife and I both preferred the raspberry since we are not huge lovers of chocolate, but the chocolate was good when I tried it.  Definitely going back again, for the food, and a beer special in the $3-4 dollar range would keep me just to grab a drink more often (I didn't check last time I was there so they may already have a beer special of sorts, I will have to find out.)

1CX6-k0W5zzI_7FPRsiC4w.text: I absolutely loved to atmosphere here. Although we didn't go up to the rooftop bar which is apparently awesome. We ordered the truffle fries for an app & really enjoyed them. My sister ordered two cocktails & both tasted like cough syrup. That was the only part of the dinner that came up short. We ordered the shepherds pie & it reminded me of something my mom would make, which is def a good thing. Very comforting. Last but not least, we got the chocolate car bomb for dessert which was amazing. Overall we had a great experience & will be coming back soon to try the salmon!

WAZtrLU1RsSGpvTVdG6jfw.text: I hate to reiterate what everyone else says but really this place has gone downhill more and more every time I eat there. I used to love coming here for dinner. Now I just come when everywhere else in the neighborhood is packed. The service is ok, the food is tolerable. The rooftop does have a great view but I would suggest just enjoying it with a couple after dinner drinks and eating elsewhere.

MkLf0xyd9zW691nc4cAh9A.text: The peculiar rabbit seems to come under a lot of scrutiny due to its location and I guess some history people have with the management. Personally, I'm not too tied in with all that drama so I'll have a go at typing out my impressions.   The inside itself is pretty inviting with the wood floors and bars and moderate decorations. There wasn't any whacky stuff hanging from the walls and you definitely get the feel that they were trying for a more upscale atmosphere with this restaurant. The staff is friendly as you'd expect and I personally didn't have any trouble with the service. They do have a nice selection of beers and some stuff from local breweries which is great to see around. The food on the other hand was just kind of ok. I've tried some of the appetizers (fries, oxtail poutine) and a couple of the other menu items (Burger, Sliders) and nothing really blew me away. It was all adequate but with the menu prices where they are you'd probably expect a little more bang for your buck. If I was going to spend 40-50$ on a meal I'd probably want to just skip on over to Soul which is in the same area with better prices and much better food imo.

gmzH3PuBNYKEAwUOusruhg.text: We went to Peculiar with friends for brunch like so many of you we previewed it late last year, and it  was on our bucket list of places to check out this year. We were served on the 1st floor dining area the decor is eclectic the food was good,(especially the shrimp and grits) first time I had it. We need to check it out for dinner overall it was a pleasant experience.

XIAnuoTGwUsh-FAbb6CTlQ.text: This was our second time visiting this restaurant. we had eaten here once before and it was OK. we figured we go back and bring a friend with us last night. We all ordered the burger platters and all of us were very disappointed. in fact none of us came close to finishing what was  on the plate. the fries were old and spongy, they had been sitting in the fry for hours. All 3 hamburgers were burnt and not cooked to any of our likings. We all agreed that we would have been better off visiting a McDonald's. For $57 with included 2 drinks, it was not worth it. We left and went to Fridays and had a great meal  All in all I would go for the crowd and a drink or two, but pass on the food....go else where.

qx77_qgP3cufUeTZ036Nig.text: Nice look bathrooms where outside main doors which kind of sucked? The menu was great but small. They could use more stuff but I had an app for my main the mussels are excellent and my gf had the duck mouse  thing which was excellent. Overall very nice and if you got the bucks I would go.

Pu7zvSqE_lOqrAzJ7PkGEA.text: I tried this place out last night with a friend of mine. Great atmosphere. I didn't get to try out the rooftop seating since my friend isn't a fan of the outdoors. I have to stay I was a little unsure of what to order, but ended up choosing the Lobster Mac & Cheese. It was absolutely delicious!!! For the appetizer we tried the Sweet Tea Brined Wings. The wings were a hit but the dipping sauce not so much. It lacked flavor. I will definitely be a repeat at this place.

WMnvBBr_pNePSvSWdxOLdg.text: 2nd try...the service was much better, perhaps because it was a Sunday.

9zlQDfmvS1pgVdyAgWb_wQ.text: i wrote this post over a year ago and never posted it on accident............  $6 mussels on a Tues night got us excited but they needed seasoning & the broth was flavorless.  The bread that came with it was undercooked & turned doughy when dipped. Toasted bread would have been better. I got the pork belly & the flavor was good but it was dry & stringy. I was hoping I could cut it with my fork but I def needed my knife. The brussel sprouts were under cooked. I also had to add salt to all of it! Not a good sign. My gf played it safe & got the burger, which she's had before. I refuse to eat their burger because I want the Kobe Beef burger Jackalope Jack's used to have. Why don't they have one here? I think I'm done trying this place for a while. I had the fried chicken & waffle another time I ate here & it is just a boneless chicken breast like u would get from the store. $18 for a chicken breast??? The flavor was good but if it came with a bone-in breast & thigh it would have been amazing! Might try brunch in the future. I heard it was pretty good. The waitress was nice.

JGCBP0MSlloqpDVEZWWOHg.text: The rooftop area is neat but usually has long waits. Inside it is loud and dark. Our waitress, as many reviewers have said, was good BUT not well-served herself by the kitchen on the Sat. Night we visited around 8 PM. Appetizers came out quickly; then we waited & waited for food, finally truly pleading that they at least serve the 9-year old with us. They did that but other plates then trickled out over such an extended time that the last of our party was only served as those served earlier were finishing up. My advice: don't go with a family or people who are tired or hungry; the wait for food can just be too long.

XMrecYj9OLdZbrUpe8sp0Q.text: 03/15/15 - Went to have Lunch with friends after an early afternoon of Tennis. This place was recommended to us by a mutual friend. It was around 2pm when we arrived. We had to wait about .15 minutes for a table to be cleared. The restaurant was busy and at about 80% capacity. When we sat we noticed no Silverware or maintained table . Table was still dirty and sticky from pancake syrup. The server arrive promptly to take drink orders - ironically drinks took .15 minutes to arrive and were blamed on the Bar being slammed. The Manger came by after we complained about drinks not coming out and he said they were busy and blamed it on large parties, un-expected business and offered no additional assurance. He was very Rude and un-professional. The Food did finally arrive in pieces. some of us got our order as others had to wait. The server and everyone seemed Hungover and clueless. I asked for a shot of Fireball and they said they were out. We were also told they were out of at least 3 other advertised Draft Beers. Overall the service was a 2 out of 10 we asked for extra napkins and that took forever, we actually had to ask for silverware and that took too long. The Manager with the Black hair was never compromising nor polite - he looked like he had a rough night the day before. I can't say Ill be back. This place has potential but the Lunch menu needs to change - there are too many Breakfast items listed for a 1:00/2pm lunch crowd.

DqTMKUtVU07KdUil7j-G3A.text: For those that haven't tried this place yet, you are missing out!!!!  Phenomenal beer selection (over 40 bottles, over 25 on draft) and countless wine selection. A visit is a MUST

et5SBdtmjVZH_5SYSeQ74A.text: Perhaps my expectations were set too high, but I am just not as impressed as I had hoped.  I have been to Peculiar Rabbit twice--once for dinner and once for brunch. We decided to try it out after a co-worker recommended going for a few drinks but once I saw Chicken & Waffles and Disco Fries on the menu I decided I needed to try the food as well.  The building itself, dining areas, bars, and rooftop are splendid and I will definitely be returning solely for the sunset view of the city. Caution: Be sure to check the weather, our first visit was plagued by sporadic raindrops, which sent us running under the awning a few times.  The drinks are strong and the craft beer selection was impressive. I enjoyed my Bloody Mary, but was slightly annoyed to have to have the spice subdued. Not a big deal.  We had a very difficult time with our waiter. Bless his heart, he was extremely friendly and admitted he was new, but made many errors with our order and had to be reminded of drink orders a few times.  The disco fries were the exact over-indulging, heart attack-inducing deliciousness you'd expect. If you're looking for comfort food, these are your answer.  I ordered the chicken & waffles and was disappointed that the waffle wasn't light and fluffy but overcooked and flaky. Long story short, the flakiness of the chicken (which alone was not too bad, but again, overcooked) paired with the overcooked, flaky chicken turned my meal into underwhelming flaky, overcooked mess. Thank god for the maple glaze, which may have been the best part of the dish. In summary, I should have ordered the shrimp & grits.  I wasn't keen on returning for brunch only a week and half later but were meeting friends and didn't really have a choice. I ordered the eggs benedict, a predictable choice for me.  Hollandaise was bland, shaved ham was flavorless and the hash-browns did not taste homemade. I was not very pleased with my meal, but to be fair, I tend to be overcritical when it comes to eggs benny's and very rarely am I impressed. :)  Overall this is a fun place to grab a few drinks or watch the sunset on the rooftop but the food seems to fall a bit flat. Too bad, I really wanted to like it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the rooftop
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk brined chicken breast over a corn meal waffle served with bruleed brussel sprouts and an anise maple glaze

Exg3uC8Eo4tQ55RxJDqm2Q.text: This restaurant had such a weird mix of really good and really bad parts that it was hard to rate.   THE GOOD: Location and view are great! They have a full bar on the roof and will let you wait up there for your table. Also our appetizer, the duck quesadilla, was literally one of the best food items I've ever had. My boyfriend got the short rib grilled cheese and said it was good.  THE BAD: I ordered the salmon and it was terrible. It was overcooked and was much worse than any easy salmon you could make yourself at home. Not sure if that was just a fluke but I was really disappointed. There also were quite a few cockroaches running around on the roof. I don't really think this is their fault, it is an outdoor patio after all, but was still pretty icky to see and might deter you from going if bugs freak you out. Letting people wait on the roof for a table was great but they don't have any clear area available so it can be hard to find somewhere to stand. We ended up putting our drinks on the railing and standing between two tables of diners while we waited. This could probably be fixed with a couple small standing tables and rearranging the tables.  Overall, I might go back for a rooftop drink but would be careful about what food I order.

ufgvdzY-XjpKtjQo4Cf8Ug.text: Everything started off great and the food was good. My husband ordered his steak sandwich no cheese. It came with cheese. It happens. He sent is back, it came back with the cheese scraped off the top bun, still some cheese on the meat, cheese on the bottom bun. We know restaurants just remove the cheese but usually they will reuse the meat and give new bread. Anyway, we had to send it back again. The third time was a charm, the sandwich was delish. To our surprise they not only apologized they comped the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild Mushroom Flat Breads sans the mushrooms,  was very tasty.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch menu. Was not the lunch menu we saw on yelp but was satisfied.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front porch

w2nA7G1Fb2H180FDZZh8Yg.text: Jim Beam Honey & Ginger Ale is delicious and People's Porter for $3 was awesome.  Bacon wrapped figs- Yummy.  Shrimp & Grits and blackened grilled salmon was very good.  For a 4th of July buzz there wasn't a huge crowd at 6pm but I expected a bigger crown.   Our waiter was unique in a good way. He was very attractive and attentive. He knew the menu and offered suggestions.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fig &amp; goat cheese wrapped in bacon

1K7TIOQTut5qGAKiks7R_Q.text: Ordered togo and got a side Cesare salad for $2 along side stuffed squash and when I opened the box it was like some one threw in a few leaves of lettuce and some crouton. Very annoyed. Other than that everything was great

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. My &#34;side salad&#34;

_Q1uNcXagKR23XEZFTvC3g.text: I have been here at least six times in the past year and the service is very sketchy but the food makes up for it.  The rooftop is magnificent, possibly the best skyline of Charlotte.  One rooftop experience was well, weird. We went for a late lunch, ordered, food, it arrived then that was it!  No follow up to see if we needed anything, no check, no nothing. We ended up (because we are nice people) taking our own dishes down four flights and paying our tab at the bar.  A few weeks ago, again for lunch, the rooftop was not open (no explanation) so we sat on the ground floor patio.  We ordered avocado fries as an appetizer, which were not available. Darn.  I find the service to be somewhat slow and inconsistent every time we visit.  I think the servers need a nice pep talk because they all seem to be slightly disinterested.  Our very first visit had us on the rooftop and waiting 20 minutes for a server. When he arrived he said he had overslept and they were short staffed.  Too much information. Just apologize for our wait and take the order, life goes on.   But of course, for the food, we will be back.

kA8yR14PKvE72GQo0jKDtA.text: The salmon is bangin'.    I love the reviews that are like, "I really tried to like this place.."  Oh, did you?  Did you try?  Really hard?  lol.  If I was the owner I'd be like, "Oh, could you try and GTFO of my restaurant?"  hahaha.  Seriously though... the salmon.  It's good.

Lf3tA_Mce55py4qvh6cDgA.text: Beer cheese and pretzels.   Everybody is trying to have them few have made them great.  The PR has great pretzels.  And pretty good beer cheese.  The beet salad is eh but needs more beets IMO.  I am about to dig into the breakfast burger with bacon marmalade.  BACON MARMALADE!!!  Must I say more???  Edit.   I must say more....  Banging bitches!!  That burger was the shit.  Not as good as liberty's but damn fine.   Really damn fine.  Roasted Brussel sprouts, eh. Not as good as librettos but still good.   All in all.   A frigging great burger.

CTFlVXaOqB96gItLeM2s7w.text: My Daughter and I went there and did not have waited on. We left to go to another place to eat. Will not go back to there at all. Service sucks.

YvmDNUImoKJunO04ahq9aQ.text: Cool place, went to the roof and waited 10 minutes. Servers saw us and continued to ignore us, didn't take our orders for drinks. Went on a Sunday evening so it was kind of busy but don't know if I will go back.

tWTpgPX0kpSdcILoNsDGmw.text: This was our first time at the Peculiar Rabbit, as we are new to CLT and trying out as many places as we can to find some regular go-to spots. I was excited to try this due to reviews I read, and its proximity to Legion Brewing and Plaza Midwood.  We arrived for our reservation and were promptly seated. The server was very attentive and prompt in getting our drinks, and in checking in on us through the meal. My low rating is due to food quality and value. Our server did what she could, and management was attentive and apologetic as well.  I ordered the paella, my husband the wagyu burger, cooked medium. The food came out within 15-20 minutes, hot. The paella was about 10 parts risotto to 1 part proteins (chicken, shrimp and salmon). The dish was well seasoned and tasty, but would have been better with more veggies... or, waaaaaay less risotto.  The wagyu burger was overcooked, and dry, which was sad given the price point and type of meat. Our server promptly addressed this and offered a replacement. No harm, no foul. Unfortunately, the second burger came out just as overcooked as the first. The meat was tasty, but dry and unappealing.  Both the server and manager were more than accomodating, apologetic for the quality of food. The matter was handled appropriately, but I was disappointed at the experience. We may go back, but it will be awhile.   I have yet to find somewhere that is a go-to mid-tier priced joint to get reliably good food, have a good beer list, etc. Pro-tip: If you want a slammn' burger, head up the street to Moo and Brew.

rKGMekKolAPqPA4iE1jjHg.text: If you're headed to Peculiar Rabbit, go straight for the drinks and the rooftop seating area. Bypass eating there all together-- slow service, average meal options

SeGfe4S71_xdtLP3tLK4_A.text: My friend and I ate here tonight and it was pretty good.The restaurant offers a great selection of entrees and appetizers as well.I ordered the "Chicken Waffle Sammich" and it was good.I would have just preferred more syrup drizzled on the waffle for it to not be as dry.The chicken was seasoned well.I ordered the roasted corn as my side but it was not to my liking which I swapped for fries.My friend ordered fries with meat and a BBQ peanut butter sauce (can't recall the exact name of the meal) from the appetizer menu and she enjoyed it.She couldn't get enough!For dessert,we ordered the cookie brownie pie.To my surprise it was really good.The dessert has a light taste and it is not overwhelmingly sweet at all.I've been watching what I eat lately and I didn't feel guilty eating it at all (unaware of the calorie count).The service was "okay."Our waitor went missing a couple of times which I don't know why because it wasn't busy initially.Overall,I plan to visit The Peculiar Rabbit again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cookie Brownie Pie!

mmOTc-0BzeLeppNoW4477w.text: More pub than restaurant, which is great if you're not hungry. The menu is eclectic, but leaves the diner wishing for more. Oh, and the pool table lists to port!

DyM4qfmCimUEOfJgDsrlBw.text: Food is usually decent but nothing outstanding. It actually used to be much better, but the current chef here is not as creative as the former one.  The service is always sub par. If you decide to come here to eat, then service-wise, the bar is your best bet. The bar is usually ok service, but if you sit at a table be prepared to have a very uninterested 20-something kid take your order, mess it up, and then forget about your party (that has been more or less my experience every time).  However one thing that this place does have going for it is the killer view and rooftop bar. The roof is great to meet friends for drinks!

mz7A1kcJKvuCQBOM9Cup9Q.text: This is the second time we went back to Peculiar Rabbit, and it's still not good. The first time, the service was so bad I wish I can give the place a negative 5 stars.  However, I usually give every place a 2nd chance before I make my final judgment.  This time we have a groupon so we went during dinner peak hour on Sat night. The place seems way more crowded than last time. We got seated pretty quickly, and the server was ok. He was not that attending because he didn't check on us after he delivered our food but to give us our check. But it was much better than last time.  The food is ok, but they are way overpriced. Korean BBQ skewer consists of 2 beef skewer is $10. A bowl of fries with oxtail sauce, mushroom, and cheese is $10. This 2 I can accept, what made me crazy is the lobster mac & cheese. The plate is $22 itself without any side items, so I expect at least a handful of lobster meat. Instead we got a bowl of pasta salad looking pasta with no more than 5 piece of meat, and a tiny spoon of crab meat slaw. The entree is very disappointed, because for that price I can get unlimited crab leg somewhere else. And not to mention it did not tasted like Mac & Cheese at all!!!  So will I go back for food, definitely NOT! However, I might go back for a drink at the rooftop for the view of the city, not because the restaurant itself attracted me back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Disco fries
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean BBQ skewer
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese

81Lg_skCGFtzPAGWdztIgw.text: My last visit to this place left me disappointed. Previously, I always ordered the salmon scramble for Sunday brunch. Despite it being a popular item, this week it was taken off of the menu. The waitress said that I could order the sausage scramble and add (not substitute) salmon for a $5 upcharge. I was being a diva and left. Advice: If it's not broke, don't fix it.   On a positive note, anything with salmon is good here. They make mustard sauce in house, so sometimes it's stronger than others.

Wb2USZCoOSqUXgrCc2DbDQ.text: Plaza Midwood is full of great bars and restaurants, but The Peculiar Rabbit has always been one of my favorites for a late night drink.  When it comes to food I always get the Disco Fries when I come here.  They're hand cut and covered in gravy and cheese.  Really tasty, my friends and I almost always get them when coming here to go along with our drinks.  No problems with the staff, they've always been cordial and friendly even when coming here during late hours.  Another thing about this place is that it has 3 different levels to it.  There is a very nice view of Uptown Charlotte you can see if you sit at the top.  Good spot to check out with a lady friend.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Disco Fries

BskRKOjm05OJpNMPqPElgA.text: Party of 6 for Sunday brunch. 40 minute wait.  Ok, sure. However, the restaurant was half empty. It's tough to stand around, hungry, in the hot sun for seemingly no reason.  We thought about offering to help bus the table we knew would eventually be ours.  Once seated, it took quite a while to get drinks (my tea was mostly water) and food out.  To be fair, our waitress was excellent and the food was pretty good.  My conclusion, super sucky management.

VMuF_Y2rNVdsYwNiVP2rQg.text: Irresistibly unique menu with twists on traditional items and other more distinctive/uncommon items.  Ingredients are high quality which I always look for.  I never tire of trying something new.  Love the roof top deck which has a great view of the city's skyline.  It's been a huge hit with my out-of-town guests.  Parking can be a challenge so be prepared for a hunt but don't let it deter you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

tN4jwuYqstuwzl8WgXqZ5g.text: Very chill place to have a few drinks and some food. The roof deck is obviously their greatest asset- EXCELLENT view, especially for sunset over the city. The inside upstairs bar is also pretty cool, too. There are plenty of hightops that aren't positioned right on top of each other, so you have room to breathe,  which makes it more relaxing. I don't really care for the inside/downstairs area though. I found the tv too loud down there (has music videos cycling on it). My preference is definitely the outside seating areas and the inside upstairs bar area.

wFaPpfm2Paa6u_JntGqoMA.text: First visit came late night this past weekend and I had the chance to try the burger.  Absolutely a great burger (bar bite menu) with a fried egg on top that really made a mess unfortunately but the taste was worth the mess.  Honestly it was so packed on the first level, we had to be seated on the second level and with that being said it was hard to really get a feel for the interiors of the place so I'd like to go back when it's not so busy.  The service was perfect and quick to the table and eager to serve all of us.  The drinks we had were stout and well poured.  I didn't get a chance to catch the view from the rooftop so that too is a reason to come back out!

LnsHxmjJxPmnKuW60YAvRA.text: I LOVE this place!  Don't know why I haven't written a review until now, but I'm a huge fan.  I've been for happy hour on the rooftop with the most amazing view of Charlotte, great beer and good friends.  We were there from 6 until midnight and our server didn't seem the least bit annoyed that she didn't get to turn the table.  I also went for my work Christmas Party, we were with a group of beer drinking guys, a couple of chefs and some girly girls and everyone was happy.  The manager hooked us up with a couple of round of shots and we all got to tick around and play all the games too.  Basically- what I'm trying to say is that customer service has always been on point, drinks have always been cold and food is cooked to perfection.

lAGFz9zc9Fo_fzuQ0WR_9Q.text: I will start with the good - the view and Tiffany who is one of the hardest, funniest and greatest waitress I have come across. The bad, crass hostess staff, incredibly slow kitchen and subpar food. If you're in the area, stop in for a drink and a picture from the roof top deck and then move on.

jq_kdvkZEs77FUJWo3uo0g.text: Basically it turned out to be just like the reviews said. We waited 45 minutes to sit and we noticed open tables but didn't dare want to sit upstairs bc it was super loud and we noticed everyone waiting an obscene amount of time for their food. Everything on the menu sounded like it was going to be really good but was just "meh" not a lot of flavor. Our dessert was some banana bread thing with ice cream and banana. They forgot the banana and the banana bread was hard as a rock and burnt. I would just skip this place all together

9fYtyObqhHX4V1Qn5FWvKg.text: I love eating and hanging out here! The food is amazing and the service is great! Kate is my favorite server to ask for and the specials here are always awesome. You'll love the grilled cheese and the beer menu is always so good :)

lPB9cqn6uIz5y11I_PdrYg.text: Stopped in for a pint and a burger after a Friday Night run with the Charlotte Runner's Meet Up group.  Place is huge, with an outdoor patio and three floors of bar / restaurant space.  Lots of beers on tap - at least six local brews - as well as just about any mixed drink you could want.  I tried the Ghost Burger with the sweet potato mash.  Actually preferred the mash to the burger - the bacon slices in with the sweet potatoes were quite tasty!  The Ghost Burger itself was spicy but not outrageous.  A bit overcooked, but the grilled onions on touch were a nice touch.  Waitstaff was not great, but it was a Friday night so they probably were just prepping for a long night.  Prices were high - spent $20 for a burger and beer.  Would expect to pay about $10-15 for the quality of the food served.

jEUPhfTyK8lCxGTEJmD01Q.text: I've been here twice, wasn't too impressed either time.  The food here seems to be perpetually bland. I don't know why. Maybe I just go on " off" nights?

EaachBnjXSl9ryu_sjTc6A.text: The other night I was out with several coworkers after a long day of work and suggested we try out the Peculiar Rabbit. I had visited the restaurant almost a year ago and had a mediocre experience. However I thought I would check it out again to see if things had improved.   To my surprise we all had a great experience! We sat on the rooftop at a large table that was accommodating for our whole group. The table had an excellent view of the Charlotte skyline and there was a nice breeze. Our bartender Matt was extremely amicable and friendly. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made several great suggestions for beers and appetizers. Overall all a great time and will definitely be back again.

bXnBir_0gmk4HP79YfeaBw.text: Whats a terrible place to eat! Overpriced and terrible service,  how can a place like stay in business,  went to celebrate a birthday with a group of friends.  First the waitress was awful, since we were a group of people she didnt have to work too hard since the gratuity was already included in the bill. What a dump! Plus all the food that was ordered was salty!!! I rather starve.

Ji6bS4vsTU3upvv0G_OOLA.text: My favorite roof top spot! PC's roof top seating is incredible, great view of Uptown Charlotte and 1/2 price bottles of wine on Sundays. What could be better? Megan and Kelsey are the only servers I ask for.. they are the best!

g9np4iTvdJOlBFJWPImZIw.text: There an enough places to in Charlotte that I would pick over this place.  The night started with mussels and calamari as apps.  The calamari was all breading and didn't have much flavor.  The mussels were good sized and was probably the best part or the meal.  For the main entree I went with a turkey rueben that tasted like disgusting with a side of the Siracha Brussels sprouts which were undercooked and overloaded with the hot sauce.  I eat out a bunch and it's sad the when you want to try something new your disappointed with sub par food and service.

nsQonsuQJFf6mPaHVo9wow.text: It got the two stars because of the view- not because of the restaurant.  Awesome roof top seating- but food is lousy.  Service not good either.  Ran out of three items ordered and made no attempt to make up for it.  Noodle bowl was soggy, hummus tasteless, and they even ran out of French fries.  Who does that?

4dc6ujIwIPI6YccpepvpHQ.text: Great creative food Experience is spoiled by dreadful staff.   Hostess are disengaged ( either texting on iPhone) or otherwise ignoring customers.    Told us wrong information regarding roof top. ( said that "bar and tables" were first come first serve.  Was 5:15 on a Wednesday night.  Rooftop and restaurant was virtually empty. Companion and I sat down at a table close to bar -- few minutes later another staff person said "hate to be Debbie downer... You can't sit here.  Only "those two" tables are open seating.  Of course "those two tables" were occupied..  Indicated the two top we occupied were for folks wanting to dine... I informed we wanted supper.  She said it would be 25-30 before we could sit there "in case someone else" shows up.  Reminding her -- the restaurant was empty.  She bluntly said. "You can't sit up here.. U need to move."  That we were welcome to sit outside on the front terrace.  She led us down to front -- gave us menus-  and left.   We said there for at least 10 minutes.   I could see a bevy of staff lingering /chatting at the front hostess  podium just inside the door.  I got back up. Asked if the front area was self serve ( order from bar-- take your own food out) or if there was a server coming.  Few minutes later a server arrived.  We placed order.  As did others outside waiting.    Either the staff has no way of marking what tables are what.  Every time new food came out to terrace the runners stopped at every table ( Including folks already eating). With plates of food.  Asking "is this your order?"     The entire experience was chaotic.    Months ago I dined there and had similar experience.   For the Price point of the food.  I expect better service.

lZhsfvgIB5zcPrOlHosADQ.text: Visited the restaurant last night with a load of friends, 25ish total.  I visited the downstairs bar while waiting for the group and enjoyed the excellent selection and bar tenders' personalities.  After moving upstairs (2nd floor) with the group, we were well taken care of even with the large number of guests.  I ordered the chicken and waffles which were great, not the best I've ever had but I'll have them again.  The other food around the table looked good with most folks offering compliments.    Along with pricey food and drinks, this place has a loud, trendy, almost college vibe but I'll be back.

6Vt-pAMNLH9qx7R9UbTHnw.text: Good food, cool location and well done rooftop bar and outside area. Not 5 stars because have found some of the food dishes to be average at best. Have had others (short rib) that were very good.

Xdxl0g7OtaOh__h6wOVkMQ.text: Last night was my second time going to The Peculiar Rabbit, the first time for food. The first time I only went to the bar and it had been a very good experience. While there the last time I had stared in awe at the beauty of the chicken and waffles, so I decided I should go and try the food. The environment at Peculiar Rabbit was a typical pub like atmosphere, nothing too out of the ordinary.   After debating on the menu for quite some time I decided to try the Peculiar Burger with corn pudding, although the Krispy Kreme Sliders and Chicken and Waffles tempted me. The burger was good, but nothing too special. To me the corn pudding was kind of mushy and didn't have much flavor. My friend had the mac and cheese, which came with slightly unappetizing pork but I guess tasted good.  I think the worst part for me was the staff. At first our waiter was marginally attentive, but as the night went on she became more pushy and rude. Normally when I eat at a restaurant, waiters have the curtesy to allow you to finish at your own pace, eat, converse, and pay on your own time. Not is the case at the Peculiar Rabbit. We were given our check while we still had an entire beer left. For the first time all night our waiter was on top of her game. After that we paid and she even took our checks after we signed, while we were still there. Its a little thing I know, but it was the first in a series of uncomfortable events that told us we were no longer welcome to stay at this table.
