Then several different waiter came by, lurked, and bused one thing at a time off our table. All the while we are still drinking our beer. They basically could not show us out the door fast enough. As we walked out I heard waiters talking about us and the hostess gave us a curt goodbye. The menu is interesting, but the service really ruined the whole experience. If I try again I hope the staff learns some manners.

zS7JS6RPD0ksQITNHGRo_w.text: So, the food was good, not great, but I'd go back to try other things on the menu if the rest of the experience was great, but it wasn't.  I had the chicken and waffles upon suggestion from our server.  The chicken was a bit salty and dry, but I'd give other things on the menu a shot, it looks like there's potential.  Peculiar is the perfect word to describe our overall experience.  Our party of three arrived and was told there would be a 30-45 minutes wait (for inside or outside) and that all the bars were open if we wanted a drink.  My friends suggested we go to the rooftop where I would be able to take in the skyline (I was visiting Charlotte).  When we arrived upstairs, we noticed that nearly every table was empty.  So, we thought that maybe they weren't seating dinner on the rooftop (it was a nearly chilly March evening).  We asked if we could sit at a table while we waited for our table for dinner and were told no, that we would have to see the served to be seated.  Whaa?  So, after about 20 minutes of waiting, one from our group went back downstairs to ask about seating, since there were clearly (dozens of) empty tables and clearly people waiting.  She was told that the 'kitchen asked them to slow things down since they're fully booked.'  About four minutes later, the hostess came upstairs and invited us to sit at the vacant table we had been standing next to for 30 minutes.  We then had a hard time reading the menu and navigating our meal because there wasn't much lighting.  I mean, shame on us for sitting outside?  Peculiar, indeed.  By the time we left, the rooftop was pretty packed with people getting their weekend drink on. I mean, I get if the kitchen doesn't have the capacity (maybe), but it seems like a better approach would be to not allow dinner guests on the rooftop and offer it as a place for drinks/to wait.  The whole experience was just bizarre and left us wondering what was really going on.

_vOQQcLDICd1gipUUud8MQ.text: This restaurant is very hit and miss.  We bring our staff here (usually 9-11 people) for lunch.  Sometimes the food is good, if you get the specials.  Today, I had the club sandwich for $12.  The description sounded awesome...but the actual product was disgusting.  Dry, old bread...a little swipe of mayo on the bottom...lunch meat...1/5 a piece of old bacon...very disappointing.  The $3 diet coke really drove me over the top.  $3 for a diet coke from a fountain...really?  The waiter removed my sandwich and $3 diet coke from the bill.  But if I had not spoken up, I would have been overcharged.  We are not going back to the Rabbit this year.  Too many other places to eat lunch.  Sad because they use to be good...but the past 6 months has gone down hill.  I'm sure it is hard to keep people working in a restaurant, but good food is your product.

ok1-LnOYqvMdd9D0P9xgDQ.text: I love brunch, and have been to it seems like a trillion brunch places in Charlotte and the Peculiar Rabbit is a top contender! Their cheese grits, cheese eggs, hash browns and French toast were incredible. I went with a party of about 15 women and we all kept ordering food! It's definitely on my list of favorites !!

VAGszvQswcj6d_o5Yec_FQ.text: I had the beet salad with salmon. Absolutely delicious! Rooftop view of the city is great!

8lCYUB0ihfKyaOsn6K4t-g.text: We tried Peculiar Rabbit last night with another couple. The restaurant is loud so don't expect a quiet evening even in the upstairs lounge. The service was absolutely horrible...and I'm someone who can tolerate bad service. We were told once our appetizers came out that the kitchen was behind on orders and it would take about 30 minutes for entrees. We had the poutinne fries and the wings for appetizers both of which were just okay. We had the chicken waffles which was very salty and not a crowd pleaser in the group. Someone else ordered the short rib grilled cheese which consisted of a lot of different cheeses and not that much short rib. We weren't offered a dessert menu and we had to ask three times for water for the table. We were looking forward to trying this restaurant but left disappointed.

y90XEFJIK26JpBOCITUJmg.text: Six of us went to The Peculiar Rabbit tonight for dinner.  We started out by sharing Disco Fries and the pretzels.  The fries were delicious.  Four of the party got one of the burger selections.  They all seemed to enjoy their entrees.  I had the baby back ribs with corn pudding and collared greens.  The ribs and the corn pudding were very good.  The collards were OK, but they are not my favorite to begin with.  The service of food delivery to our table was good, refills of water and tea was a little slow.

dP061YtB3IbWrRS840_X1g.text: Had a great time here! There are 3 levels to this restaurant, and (you guessed it), 3 bars! The roof has a party all of it's own, with their own bar and a beautiful view of the city. I went with a group and all of us tried something different. LOVED the Devils on Horseback (it's a must try-and you will do a happy dance when you eat them!), Mussells, and the Korean Skewer! Didn't much care for the Lamb Lollipop, which had ground lamb.  I ordered the Rabbit for dinner-something I had never had before. Not my favorite, but it was good. The best meal of the night was the Pork Belly (it was on special and is currently NOT listed on their menu; it was not served with noodles). The ribs were also fantastic!  We had drinks all night from the bar-great beers, and fantastic hand crafted drinks as well.  Great atmosphere, so eclectic and really fun to people watch there. Delicious food, looking forward to going back!

hoUF5KhNBHUdT8vzWMHnQg.text: Whatever you guys are doing with the pretzel buns keep it up they are amazing---would've had a better picture but I are them all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious pretzel bun. Comes with 6 but I ate them all.

tnuqaukWF1aBhJj2vqfNuA.text: This was a neat little restaurant. Nestled in the heart of Plaza Midwood it boast an incredibly urbanite vibe. From what I understand it is a renovated church, but you'd never guess so from the exterior and interior decor.   I dined with a dear friend for lunch today, it had been awhile since we'd seen each other, so needless to say the menu what not high on the priority list. Our waitress was very kind and checked back with us several times to see if we were ready to order. After awhile she came back cordially as ever and we placed our orders. I ordered the bahn mi and asked her opinion on it. Surprisingly she gave me a very honest answer, "I don't particularly like it, but some of the staff claim it to be their favorite.", I risked it and I'm glad I did. It's not traditional in any sense of the word but it was delicious nonetheless.   I recommend giving this place a shot. Do be aware though that parking is a little questionable. They don't actually have their own lot but I parked across the street with no issue.

Rt_PKapofC4RC3p6VheFXw.text: I've been here twice so far. The first experience was a bit underwhelming, but having heard good things, I decided to try again. Our visit today began with a rocky start. My friend and I both ordered coffee. The coffee arrived with a bowl full of crinkled up brown equal and Splenda packets and the tiniest little pot of cream I've ever seen. The server was nice enough to run to the kitchen to bring us some real sugar. Alas, once it arrived, there weren't any spoons to stir the sweet goodness into our cups.   Fast forward to the food. The grits tasted like a strange sweet creamed corn and the chorizo omelet was just okay. My friend ordered scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast, and bacon. Let me just say, hashbrowns do not mean cubed fried potatoes. I mean really, they're like mini-fries. What is the fun in that? And the scrambled eggs? Well, they were a bit creamy. I think they were underdone.   Their menu has a lot of variety and I give them kudos for that. However, I can't say that they do any of it well. The view is nice and the vibe is chill. Other than that, I don't think I want to eat here again. Perhaps just drink?

aQ-cmQp1lKg91nYd13SdoA.text: We had a work event here.  I was delighted that this restaurant was chosen, as I was able to walk there from my home.  We were seated on the second floor, and it felt hot initially, but that was most likely due to my walk. Drink orders were quickly taken, and bread with butter was served.  The area was brightly lit, and loud, commercial pop music played.  Would have preferred dim lighting and background jazz, but I am sure they are going after the young demographic . I ordered the Mediterranean plate, which featured pickled vegetables, hummus, pita bread and falafel.  Delicious, and a nice portion for a light meal.  Service was on point, even when it came to bringing the checks. There are a couple of things that I found unappealing.  I excused myself to go to the ladies's room, which is downstairs.  A server who was ascending cut me off, causing me to wait.  You can "ma'am" me all night long, which they did to my annoyance, but actions speak louder than words.  Show your manners. Furthermore, this building used to be a beautiful, old church and now it resembles a big box, cookie cutter chain restaurant.  Sure, they can cram them in and give them a view, but there is absolutely no charm in this place. Still, the restaurant is in my neighborhood, plus food and service was decent.  I will support it.

lVHF4ITbtf5LvtsCZyENOQ.text: I really want to like this place because I really love the food. Its an interesting menu and obviously a great space and location. However the service and management of this place is going down hill quickly. Service is mediocre with waiters who obviously act like they would rather be anywhere else. The managers seem to think it is appropriate to work in an establishment in yoga pants and workout clothes (did you just come from the gym, if you did, ew). General manager thinks its ok to sit at the bar on duty and drink, nor take my polite complaints seriously. Please let me know when you have new hostesses, managers and gm's. I will return then.

UqCT1fbj7TSSMYAX6y2R6A.text: I bought a Living Social Deal for TPR because it included alcohol, something I'm always excited about because deals normally do not.   We went here with a couple of our friends and between the table ordered muscles and fries, and disco fries for appetizers, and then we got the BBQ sliders, fish and chips, ribs with corn pudding, and burger with butternut squash bisque.   I thought the disco fries were very good. They included meat, which the one other time I've had them they only cheese and gravy, but I liked it a lot! If you haven't had disco fries you should definitely give them a try. I had the burger with butternut bisque. I got the bisque as my side (which they do not charge extra for), because we got the fries earlier and it had creme fraiche (South Park nerd). The burger was pretty good, fairly standard. I thought the soup was the star of my meal.   Everyone also got a 20oz beer (they have 10oz and 20oz), which was around $5.50. They do not have cider :(. The bartender was also nice enough to give us an "extra" beer that they had for Free. Love Free.   Our waitress was Megan, who I thought was good. It did take a while to get going, but you have to remember this place is fairly large with 3 floors. We made a reservation for 6:30 on Open Table because they did not have any 7 available, although they had plenty of tables still available at 7.   To address the parking situation, we were able to find it pretty easily, and we did NOT have to pay any money, which is something I know a lot of other people posted about.   After the Living Social deal we were only left with a tab of a little over $3. (The deal was for $40, and we got the disco fries ($10), a burger with soup ($9), ribs with corn pudding ($16), and a 20oz beer ($5.50).)    So if you find yourself wanting to try something new I suggest The Peculiar Rabbit, good ambiance, lots of TVs, and good food!

Pplt5Jir3pWCySac-Rc_tw.text: My friend n I have been wanting to come here for a very long time but sadly we were extremely disappointed.   Decor: Tables are ugly. Decor on general isn't cohesive. Drinks: Worst bloody mary I've ever had. Brunch: Split the eggs Oscar. Asparagus was cold and the hollandaise was a little on the thick side. Service: Our server Kristopher was not in a good mood and frankly turned us off from the very beginning. He might want to try smiling... Just saying   Sadly not impressed, maybe we'll just come back for beers.

T-2aEpPfGMBgAzVd1HqBug.text: The disco fries tasted good, but I was a little disappointed in the amount of cheese on them (and not in curd form either). It's very American of me to want more cheese on everything though, especially when the cuts of oxtail were surprisingly large and juicy. If I could change them, I would put curds of cheese, more like the amount found in poutine and shred the oxtail pieces into the gravy to make them easier to eat and share.   My dining companion had the burger with an egg, bacon, and pimiento cheese on it. It was giant and difficult to hold and eat - I would suggest offering to cut it in two or sending a knife that's up to the challenge out with the burger. I tried a bite -- it was delicious, but very messy due to its size and construction.   I had the chicken and waffles and while I was initially concerned about anise being added to the syrup (I don't like licorice flavors), I tried it and it added a depth of flavor to counteract the sweetness of the syrup while being otherwise unoffensive. The chicken was perfectly cooked and juicy inside a crispy crust of breading. The waffle was made with cornmeal, which helped make it less like a typical breakfast waffle. The Brussels sprouts were caramelized with bacon. All the flavor profiles on the plate meshed very well.

LEYn4Y6nJPNWBMxyVKHI5A.text: Great food. Cool atmosphere. It's been on our list of "go to" restaurants in the area for a bit. We finally went for a date night and I'm glad. We will definitely be going back. The staff is knowledgable and the menu is very interesting. I love a good farm to table restaurant. We had devils on horseback as an appetizer. I ordered the pork belly and my boyfriend ordered the rabbit (which was one of the specials.) his was way better!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly with brussel sprouts
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped figs aka devils on horseback. Amazing!!

_OxR6i2dckEpHE0DvhinTw.text: I must admit I had some reservations about this place based on other Yelper's reviews which seemed to vary quite a bit.   I was part of a large group celebrating a birthday and I enjoy hitting the Plaza Midwood neighborhood now that I live in the 'burbs.  Found the interior inviting and loved the track doors and woodwork.  I am not a fan of sitting on barstools so I chose the booth side of our platform raised table near the bar.  Our server was excellent, and realized we had some old menus.  I have to admit the overhauled new menu was much more to my liking.    We shared pimento cheese, pretzels, and deep fried veggies for our apps. I found the pimento cheese a bit dry, but well seasoned. I skipped the other apps, but the rest of the group enjoyed them. The large bite size pretzels and beer cheese were the crowd favorite.  For my entree, I chose the chili. I would call it greek style, sweet and slightly spicy. I really appreciated the portion size too.  This place is huge with three floors, VIP room and a roof top bar that has excellent skylne views. The main floor bar had a nice buisness for a Monday night and should be drawing a neighborhood crowd.  Our server was excellent and had no qualms about seperate checks and splitting the birthday girl's tab among all of us.      I cannot complain about parking since it was a weeknight, but I know that I sympathize with other Yelper's complaints about the $5.00 charge.  We actually parked across the street.

2CntVTmoSbYHSEZiEte-IA.text: I don't have much to say about this place. it was alright. small menu, but beer selection was A-OK!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The regular burger
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The peculiar burger

yuzP1BcIGip5HrKktLKnCg.text: Pretty spiffy spot.  Saw a neat building on New Years Eve, and my group and I decided we should pop in and check out the venue.  It was a nice find with 2 levels, and the 3rd, being on the rooftop.  The people who worked here were kind enough to provide the event with New Years gear, champagne, and fun sparklers!   Overall, the setup for Peculiar Rabbit is great because I tend to get bored being in one area, and I am able to move around on different levels, or play pool in another room, or just grab some fresh air on the rooftop.  The place is also new looking, and is not shabby at all!

G9UfuRiAs-hfVcM0tS01YA.text: I'm a fan of the Peculiar Rabbit.  Yes, I get they roped off some parking, but it's not hard to find a free spot (especially after all the additions on Commonwealth).  It's just ridiculous to rate this place 1 star because of that.  Broke ass hipsters need something to complain about.  Weird thing is, most of them don't even drive. Ironic, huh?  They always have drink specials, even on weekends.  I hate when I go somewhere on the weekend and they don't have ONE special.  You'll always find one here.  Last time I was there was the epic 'ice storm' of 2013 (lol).  They had $3 imperial winter draft pints.  That's a 20 oz beer by the way.  The food has always been consistently good.  They source local ingredients, which is the norm now if you want to be a hip place.  My favorite dish from what I've had was the fish n' chips.  Waitress persuaded me to get it because the Triggerfish was fresh off the boat that day.  Needless to say it didn't disappoint.

WUe6yp1RsMhfzKPm2Rj0sw.text: Do you like paying exuberant amounts of money for mediocre bar food and domestic drafts? Then this is the place for you!  When I first walked into The Peculiar Rabbit I noticed the lack of, well, everything. The bland decor, the lack of customers, and a complete disregard for the plaza-midwood neighborhood mentality, made me feel a bit peculiar. See what I did there!?  It is very apparent that this restaurant is trying to play off the success of more "upscale" businesses in the area. With a restaurant like Soul around the corner who offers a much better atmosphere, food, and price point, it is hard for me to understand why anyone would waste their time and money on this establishment. It is amazing how uninspired this business is and how their idea of making a restaurant a success is to alienate the community and throw money around. Just because you built a giant crap hole with a nice roof deck, doesn't mean you can ask people to pay ungodly amounts of cash for a bud light and a burger.  Their real mistake is when they started to infringe on the accessibility of local businesses by leasing a vast majority of the parking spots in a lot that serves many establishments. Which is kind of a peculiar (LOLZ GET IT) site because there are a total of maybe 5 cars at any given time using the $5 to park makeshift lot. Good thing you guys paid all that money to rope of the parking lot because it is really being utilized.  The only redeeming factor of this place is the staff. Which were friendly and helpful.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this worthless business.

cuDPxF7PUZqFbUbBnMiUMw.text: Despite the uproar that this place has caused, leading many Plaza Midwoodites to call it the Puke-ular Rabbit, I enjoyed my dinner here.  The interior is strange but as Ron Burrrrr-gundy would say "that's a given" since the shape of the building is right out of an Escher creation.    Service was all over the place.  We had a lot of different people come by our table and some of them were attentive and others seemed to be checked out.  But the mussels and the large pours of Belgian beer were very tasty.  My wife got some sort of seafood conglomeration and enjoyed it.  By the way, IN RE the parking situation, I live just down the street and y'all can come park in my driveway for free if you do something nice or funny for me.  Y'know, leave a little package of Swedish Fish in my mailbox.  Or maybe you can dress up like Dick Van Dyke in Mary Poppins and sweep my sidewalk and sing Chim Chimaree.   Anyway, if you can figure out the parking thingamajig, I think it's worth a visit to Peculiar Rabbit to give it a shot.  And stop by all the other cool places nearby afterwards - Snug Harbor, 22 Gallery, Petra's.

ENJtBz6AZSmhlmi8iz78oQ.text: My wife and I and another couple visited this restaurant on a Friday night.  Luckily my wife had made reservations several days ahead of time, because when we arrived at 7:00, the wait was 1.5 hours.  We were seated promptly at a nice four top table next to a window on the first level.  Unfortunately, things went down hill from there very quickly.  Our waiter came over for our drink orders and we had to tell him multiple times which wines we wanted and finally had to point to them in the menu so he could write them down.    Drinks came and then we ordered appetizers. After 30 minutes, I had asked the waiter to check on the order.  The appetizers were delivered a short time later.  We then put in our dinner orders, and after about an hour, I finally asked another waiter working in our section if the kitchen was having problems because the delay in getting our food was ridiculous.  BTW, we are not high maintenance people so it is very unusual for us to ever complain.  Jason, the manager, came over to our table and apologized for the delay and said it was our waiter's first night and they had to pull him off the floor because he had gotten overwhelmed.  Jason said our food would be on them for our trouble.  Fair enough.  Class move by him to admit the problem and make it right.  That's when things got really strange.  15 minutes later, Jason came back to the table and said the food was being plated.  Then, a short time later, our original waiter (the one who had been "pulled off the floor") came back to the table as if nothing had happened and asked if we wanted dessert!  We had to tell him we still hadn't gotten our food and he promised to check on it.  Finally, about 30 minutes after we were told the food was being plated, it arrived piping hot.  Jason came back to the table and admitted that there had been issues in the kitchen as well and comped our entire meal drinks and all.  The food itself was great once it arrived and Jason did what a good manager does when there is a problem which is why I gave it two stars instead of one star, but it is hard to overcome the bad impression the service made.  Maybe the restaurant needs to limit the number of seatings per night until the kitchen and wait staff rise to the level of their food.

9-Gv0fLpDW23mVjerlX2TA.text: Option of sitting inside or 45 minute wait for outside and this was with a reservation, I get it it's a Friday night but the only reason to come here is to sit outside... the server came by said that someone else was our server then came back 10 minutes later once they realized/were told they were our server. Then we ordered drinks and tried to order food, they were out of what I had chosen, of course that happens, but added to the bad experience, server was trying their best at this point. Then the wait for our food started for 35 minutes, a salad and grilled cheese, why did it take so long???!! Disappointed 2nd time here may be the last, food is not worth the wait.  Wouldn't recommend it.

3es-aCpkViKbC4Qk3YdmrA.text: I've been here a few times because I work within walking distance. The food is ok, but takes awhile to come out. It's good -- I was just not completely impressed. The drinks are good but not that consistent between visits.   I will definitely be visiting again, and the rooftop had a great view of Uptown, but this wouldn't be my first choice for dinner or drinks in the Plaza area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffle sandwich

MHSXc8kVY4eyvQCySPHSTg.text: Enjoyed my lunch today! The food was good and the service amazing! I had the steak tacos and they hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

pR6UGd57e3ReXcTKsrBzdg.text: The location is actually really nice, it has a nice patio and a roof top. I wish the food was a little bit better. It is decent but for the price I would expect a little bit more.

vxOLb-H4otzjQRiYYL0wmw.text: Going to have to come by Peculiar Rabbit some time and actually have a meal. Last couple of visits have been 1 - a work happy hour and 2 - just to grab a beverage and enjoy the rooftop patio. Awesome place, three levels, pool table, ground floor patio/biergarten, and rooftop patio with a bar as well. Offers an unbeatable view of the skyline. Very good when the sun is going down. Service has never been an issue and always a great beer selection.

R8twnaRKM93wfNnJM8TtDA.text: 3 star rating says it all. Tried to enjoy a drink here ended up with the most scattered, bizarre experience and went elsewhere.

LpNYir1cf0Ur4NKZ7pJoAQ.text: The food has always been good when I go; however, the views from the rooftop are what keep me coming back.  I'm usually not one that likes to sit outside with the sun beating down on me while I eat but I'll make an exception for this place.  If you're able to time it for when the sun sets behind the skyline it makes for an even better experience.    The last time I went to the Peculiar Rabbit I had their meatloaf which was really good.  They pan fry it before plating it which adds a nice crisp texture to the meatloaf.  We had tried the artisanal cheese plate as an appetizer and it was also really good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunset behind the Charlotte skyline sitting on the rooftop of the peculiar rabbit.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rooftop at peculiar rabbit

fvEcrHhoD1jHtNwfnq58tQ.text: I knew I was going to like this place just because of the name! This restaurant/bar is 3 stories and the top level is a rooftop bar, it's probably really nice during warmer weather (also has a good view of the city)! We set on the first floor to eat. I had the chicken biscuit and ask for gravy instead of hot sauce and mayo, I was a little disappointed because the gravy came on the side in a very very small bowl. I was hoping that they'd just smother it in gravy. Oh well. My husband got a burger and fries and said it was pretty good. We got there around "Brunch" time, the menu didn't have a huge selection and I did think it was a little pricey. After eating, I had to adventure to the second floor. Off to the side where the bathrooms are was another sitting area where they had these awesome paintings of Alice in Wonderland scenes. I love restaurants that have funky art work on the walls. Overall it was an okay place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chicken biscuit with the very very small bowl of gravy.
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The view from the rooftop!

1gVMWBSS-folmDLv885N_w.text: This is about Jackelope Jacks, their sister restaurant. We walked in early (7ish)to shoot a game of pool and have a drink. I guess the bartender (Emilia?) wasn't pleased to see we had a child with us, so she immediately said she would need to "check with her manager if we could be there."  Yes, check with her Manager to see if we could be there. Again, there was no one inside and we were looking to shoot a game of pool and have a drink. Guess we know why no one was there to see their kind bartender..

FT-MFUzC25m9V_p1f5Hndg.text: I came here for dinner and chose a Caesar salad. My waiter asked if I wanted salmon, shrimp, or chicken. I chose the shrimp. This was the best decision of my life lol. The shrimp were grilled to perfection and seasoned just right. Clearly, this salad was good because I'm writing a review on lettuce lol. Overall, the atmosphere is great. The view is amazing (of the Charlotte skyline) and they have drink specials.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roof top seating is the way to go here!
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mimosa with grenadine and the homemade pop tart

jrC0ZgPg3j7r0emVAhjjFg.text: Great experience! Came for a friends 21st birthday and she was treated like a QUEEN. Service and food was impeccable 11/10! Also great great views of the Charlotte skyline! Will definitely be back(:

MZ8PuyMIGlKEpuHWzplBug.text: I have very much wanted to like this place, but sadly I haven't had either good service or good food when I have been here. I would have given two stars but since this is a fun bar location I bumped the overall rating up to three.  The first time I went I had eggs Benedict which were entirely lacking - mostly cold and the hollandaise sauce was clumpy. Another time I went a friend ordered a side of toast that was not brought until almost 15 minutes into our meal. The last time I went I had coupons and asked the hostess if I could use multiple since there was no mention of combining coupons. She said they now had that stipulation in writing on the new coupons, and since mine was before that I should be able to combine. Of course when we got the check the waitress refused to apply more than one coupon.   All that said I have never tried (nor am I tempted to) this place for any meal other than brunch.  As a bar this place is fantastic - large beer selection, knowledgeable bartenders and solid views of the city.

25Y-bv3JPPfgiFv0KnMMhA.text: Not very impressed. We waited almost 1 hour 20 minutes to be seated. It was odd due to the number of open seats and no one else waiting. One member of the wait staff wasn't very friendly at all.  We were brought food with no silverware and requested some. After about 5 minutes, we went and found our own silverware. Also, one persons dish was brought with a spoon and wasn't provided with a napkin. It seemed very unorganized. The food was descent but not great enough to make me want to come back.

FFV3VPfTztvoondnP32p7w.text: I just want to thank the staff at PR and the event coordinator Nicole. She was great in setting up my surprise proposal on the rooftop of the restaurant to my girlfriend. The night was perfect and they even added a live singer to make it truly a memorable experience. They did an awesome job of accommodating me and everyone I invited to share this special moment with me.  Thank you PR, you made this a night my fiance and I will never forget.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nothing better then a rooftop surprise proposal. Thx PR!

vNrohAAiA59mNJzORyj0tQ.text: I would say this would be a 3-1/2, but maybe not 4 star. We came here with a group for a birthday. The waitstaff was very polite, separated our checks easily, and was helpful. I got the mushroom flatbread and it was really quite good. Our drinks however, were incredibly watered down. I'm a lightweight and if I really had 5 drinks I would have woken up in a dumpster somewhere, but I was quite sober. I really like the place, when it's warm they have great rooftop and outside seating which is great. I'd go again, it's in great position for bar hopping in.plaza midwood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. The mushroom flatbread, was great drinking food.

z8MYk3S_qn_i8s_KUkqBVA.text: Favorite place to eat when visiting Charlotte. The staff are always friendly, food is great, and the rooftop patio offers a great place to hangout and enjoy the Charlotte skyline! Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

gLpK9hJ3NpvqKhG0GAnthA.text: I ate here for brunch for the first time. Overall, the food was decent and the prices are good. I felt like they should've had more brunch options, though.

xSFsKIWVYhYib0arePneZg.text: Came on Wednesday around 7. Asked for rooftop seating to view CLT skyline. $4 Draft got Son of peach. Had Sweet Tea Brined Wings and Short Rib grill cheese. Everything was delicious. Service was fantastic and very friendly.

3cgxWSDNkpAP-6RD2GhvkA.text: What a great new menu! The "rabbit" was the best grilled cheese I ever had!!! My son had the Kale and Cauliflower Enchilada and my husband and daughter had the Gypsy Schnitzel. They loved it! We also had the avocado bites and mini beef wellingtons. Lip smacking. Great views from the rooftop as well. Definitely coming back when we come through town again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

iMz4LxdNva3I4dJ3iXhKqA.text: Amazing city skyline view from their rooftop section, their best feature, especially at dusk/night! Most of my visits here have been only for drinks, as it's a good place to mingle and have convos. The space is separated into three floors, with the middle floor typically the most lively, because that's where most of the alcohol is. Lots of beer on tap and craft cocktails to choose from.   This restaurant deserves more credit for their creative menu. I appreciate the trendy menu featuring unique combos that the chef envisions but unfortunately, the food doesn't seem to leave a lasting impression. Not bad by any means but doesn't stand out enough to warrant the slight price premium of their menu.   Overall, The Peculiar Rabbit is a solid spot to for a casual date or a drinking stop with some friends. It's a bit more low key than I'd personally prefer, lacking much buzz but it has its moments. This place is still good and I'll be back again, but my other neighborhood favorites will more often than not take higher precedence.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb burger with side Caesar salad

pgAPFNieBKLyipRwlFKbtw.text: Had a nice lunch few weeks ago on the outside patio upstairs. Great views of the City. Daniel the manager was very fast with our order and brought our young kids stuff to do. We will definitely be back for brunch again! Thanks Daniel C!!

w_Jo4yj71smq45Wt_pzMKw.text: Check Your Receipt!!!!!!!!  My friend decided to stop here for her birthday. We thought hey let's get away from uptown for tonight! Our server was great very personable. Food was good. When it was time for the tabs we noticed that we each had a 18% gratuity included. I asked the waiter why we had the gratuity with a party of four. He bluntly said I added it because the person that left did not tip. I said OK that was a 12 y/o child that paid for her own tab and had to leave to get ready for school. As if that had anything to do with the company policy! I asked for the manager he laughed OK sure. The manager came was very respectful apologized and explained that the gratuity should not be included. He offered a gift card I declined but my friend accepted it. I will never go there again. I cannot think of any reason other than bad ones that he would think to automatically add gratuity to our $20 tabs. Sigh

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

ghvP0EPk7eDDE547O9I6Hw.text: Recently changed management and they are trying to turn things around since my previous review. Lots of updates to the menu - creative and original dishes, large portions, and service was a lot better!  Will be back.

y4d9ElG43mVXMKdE641gbQ.text: Food was delicious and service was good. I like their beer selection, but I was a little confused by the beer menu. It said that they offer 12 or 24 ounce draft beer, but the server brought me out a 16 ounce and said they didn't offer 12 or 24. $4.50 for a Miller light draft was a little steep, But I didn't complain because the server was so nice. I was a little disappointed that they did not offer a dessert menu, Not that I was hungry, because the servings were quite plentiful, I just wanted a little snack to take home with me to eat later with my leftovers. But all said and done, I had a great experience and enjoyed my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

cPXtbKN-hjAculBtLwn4wg.text: Beer selection was good but only some local craft.  Food was OK but service was horrible.  We sat for 20 minutes before he took our drink order.  They weren't even busy.  Yes we had a few stragglers but they should have at least brought drinks while we waited.  Then the food took awhile and our checks as well.  I didn't bother ordering a 2nd beer...

BWz_f4PzTX5JHCcviyq7_A.text: The chipotle chicken tacos are to die for. Fries are fried to perfection too ..I forgot to finish this a few weeks ago. I see now that they don't have this in the menu? Idk but I am moving to Charlotte in the next few days and I can't wait to spend some time here ... wonderful place

t9kE6AEejRXiCHbukC2XOg.text: Peculiar Rabbit offers something for everyone.  Let's start with the building itself.  Located in a former church and former nightclub, there are 3 floors with distinct feels.  The front patio is covered - and, weather permitting, usually has a fire pit or two going.  It's a cool vibe, but admittedly can be hard to take advantage of in the brutal summer heat.  The bottom floor has a mix of high tables, booths, regular tables and a bar.  The dark wood makes it's feel very cozy and romantic.  The second floor also has a bar and lots of tables with a great view of the city skyline from the 2nd floor windows.  In the backroom on the 2nd floor, you can play skeeball, air hockey and bumper pool.  This area can be reserved for private parties/celebrations.  The 3rd floor is a rooftop bar with one of the best views you can find of the Charlotte skyline - come prepared for the weather, as there are no heaters or fans.  The menu as Peculiar Rabbit seems to change with fair frequency.  The food is consistently good.  There's a mix of burgers, salads and heavier entrees.  While nothing stands out as a must-have for me, I always enjoy whatever I eat.  A lot of people rave over the fried chicken and waffles - I must say, it always looks amazing.    For beverages - there are about 15 beers on tap and a great selection of cocktails, including 8 or so different mules.  The Plaza Seventy Thyme is one of my favorite cocktails here - it has gin, thyme and st. germain YUM!  I think I come here more for the atmosphere than what's on the menu - but, fortunately, I really do enjoy most everything on the menu.

5SFJwA5phmf6dGKsXc6qgw.text: My wife and I ate in the Biergarten with our son. Their menu is very creative. I had the deconstructed chicken and dumplings. The skin on the chicken was amazing. It had roasted veggies and blackberry dumplings to go along with it. All of which was smothered in a really great gravy.  We were all pleased with our meal.

NyUl6004zoeGHxG80vizBQ.text: Went right before sunset on a Saturday night. Was told it would be a 30 min wait for the rooftop, but ended up waiting 1.5 hrs! If we knew, we would've just sat inside!! But pretty good food and a nice view of downtown Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

eOyPL8fVnCIUxbZPNcNHGA.text: Not only is this place TERRIBLE, the staff is horrid.   Although the food prices are reasonable and the fish and chips (being the only item worth waltzing in for) are decent, I have always had terrible experiences.   The bartender Alex is the reason I will not be back. She is short, rude, and oddly preoccupied by a restaurant completely vacant. My poor server, obviously within his first week, asks her questions and specials of the day. Not only does she not even bother to look up to help him and US, his customers, she stated there are no specials (as I stare at a sign stating the Red Bull&Vodka are $8 every day).   It's very sad to see such business with so much potential dwindle in service. I will not be looking back twice at this place.

U6rH2_N_KWx5v675a9saLA.text: Super cute! Laid back atmosphere. I went with a group of friends just for shots so we didn't really stay long or eat anything. I'll come back though for sure.

u2bqF_zA36uuCx2PjQRN4g.text: I came here last night for my birthday with a reservation made three days in advance for preferable rooftop seating, 8-10 people. We were told the rooftop was full, yet when we went to take pictures of the view there was a COUPLE taking up a long table alone up there. We were seated outside on the patio on the bottom floor. We waited 1.5 hours for our food, after having to specifically request to order appetizers and food. After finally receiving the food (most everyone got burgers), we concluded that it was not worth the wait and was sub-par in taste.   Pros:  The view on the rooftop is beautiful, especially during sunset. Drink service was mostly quick (in the beginning). Pretzels with beer cheese were amazing. Cons: Slowest service I've ever received. It was a Tuesday so I'd hate to think this is how service is during busier times on weekend or at brunch. Burgers had no sauce or cheese. Salad was whole romaine pieces which needed slicing; lettuce was grilled/charred which made the taste kind of odd. Not accommodating at all for a large group or apologetic about the bad service until the very end of the meal when it was time to pay/tip.   The only thing that made this meal bearable was that I was with a large group of people so we could entertain ourselves by talking. After two hours, we were starving and all talked out. We contemplated leaving multiple times but decided to stick it out and give this place the benefit of the doubt - don't. Overall, it didn't make for a good birthday meal and I was disappointed.

-idoPGDFczrRB2yfRmYrcg.text: I've tried to give the Peculiar Rabbit a chance. I really have... but the food is always so-so and the service just plain stinks. There are just better places to waste my money on beer and eclectic pub fare.

KJzR7LAZHmLs99n5Tb_d4g.text: The Peculiar Rabbit, or I as I call it... the funny bunny.   No matter what you call this place we can all agree on one thing: the real reason to come here is the rooftop patio. #AmIRight?! Tremendous view of our gorgeous uptown skyline. I think it beats Whisky Warehouse based just on layout and setup.  Foodwise, the menu can vary because of PR's farm to table concept. I really like that. Our latest visit here we ordered calamari. I wasn't a huge fan of the breading. A squeeze of lime drastically made this better. I ordered the watermelon feta salad. Simple, clean, fresh flavors. My friend got the chicken and waffles. Holy, it looked like an entire chicken was on the plate. A-OK is a good description for the food here. I've never had anything bad... it's just there is nothing that has been overwhelmingly impressive.  I've only been here during evening hours, so I usually park across the street at the JLC Wearhouse. (Only when it's closed of course) I don't understand the whole reverse parking thing in Plaza Midwood. You can translate as, "I'm not very good at parking."   I think The Peculiar Rabbit rooftop is a great place to grab drinks and apps for a date, a night out with friends or to kick off an evening. Because of the size and all the levels, it would also work well for a group dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Watermelon and feta salad
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffle. Holy massive chicken

b26f3KyKGTsP_dZP9n0GTw.text: VIEWSSSSS ON POINT. The menu has some very interesting options, it was hard to decide! I know many come here to drink, but UNFORTUNATELY ya girl is underage SO I cannot speak for that side. I got the Braised Rib Grilled Cheese (if I remember correctly) and I don't know, it was just OK. There really wasn't much flavor and it was kind of dry. The fries that my brother ordered as a side were AMAZING!!! Perfectly seasoned and super crispy and hot. I do want to come back and try their brunch, I hear it's good.

ha8HeLAVAaX4bimBWf0kXw.text: The Peculiar Rabbit is a great find and such a cool spot off of Central Ave! Hubby and I took his parents there when they were visiting and we were all super happy with our meals! Great staff, awesome atmosphere and not a long wait for food! Totally going back!

JsMebmEbRTs_ubM3gBdNEA.text: Food is decent- Pecan brussel sprouts were really good. Portabello mushroom, avocado, cheese melt was really spicy.. I think it was the ghost pepper cheese, which I took off midway through. .. I just couldn't handle it any longer. The sauteed onions were really good.   Ambience is nice, each of the three levels are all a different experience. The rooftop deck is neat with the view, but too hot in this heat without fans.. the shade helps with suncover, but not with air circulation. . It's just a vent. First floor has a big room for events, paint nite, plant nite, etc. Main bar seating and tall booths. Second floor is more regular tables.  Parking- street parking is few and far between, but there's a huge shopping plaza across the street. Just park and walk over.   Random- The neighborhood is walkable and friendly to all types of people. The outdoor first floor patio is also dog friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States

a0DforkLzo5LzpdLiT7Fhw.text: A solid three stars. If you know you're a popular place, you may want to have more servers on hand. We arrived and waited 10 minutes at our table with no waiter coming over. After 10 minutes, we were told we could sit outside. After about 10 more minutes, we got to get our drink orders in. We didn't complain but we just wanted to order.  After a little more waiting, who I'm assuming is the manager came over and apologized to us that the wait was so long! We said its no problem and thanks for coming over to us. He told us to order a round of drinks of him, wow - that's great service! Well, it would have been, if someone ever came back to the table for us to order said drinks.  Okay, on to the food! We only ordered a couple apps, which were fantastic! We got the beet salad (Yes!) and the Carolina Poutine (HECK YEA). Both tasted amazing, and I'd go back for the food!  Overall, Food: 4.5. Service: 2-ish.

24jj_MtKJ5c2y8Y7F9GNFg.text: Flat Warm Beer. How does draft beer not have zero bubbles?   Over Cooked Food- You can't even cut it with a knife-much less eat it?  Ambiance of Constant Loud Dishwasher Cycle and ESPN Commercials? Lost the Remote?  Unless Management Fires Ponytail Hipster DoucheBag Bartender and Cook- Expect "Attitude of its your fault- here is your $30 bill."

62idbxKY6bozUttSEsJvpA.text: I'll have to give this place two stars and I doubt that I'll go back anytime soon. I must say this wasn't our first choice for the evening. But due to Souls two hour wait, we came here.   We started off with drinks I kept it safe with a beer but my girlfriends had cocktails that were watered down. We also ordered an appetizer "Sweet Tea Chicken Wings" wee great the have us only one ranch when we asked of three. The girls changed their drinks and then dinner came out. I ordered what I thought was a gluten free lamb burger but it was shredded lamb, one of my friends ordered the same. The lamb was so dry I barely would swallow it, I had to chance it with water. On top of that it really wasn't that hot.  After reordering something different the manager came out and I spoke with him. Explaining that my mind was set on their Lamb burger as the menu states it's Burger but items shredded meat. Instead of saying "oh I apologize that's an old menu, or we haven't updated our menu". Instead he said " we no longer the burgers." So my question is how long are you going to have False advertisement. But you menu clearly said Lamb Burger.  I've been here three times one in which was a birthday dinner and this by far was the worst

TTSpg1ezg0fKcgqw9KS5AA.text: Had Sunday brunch order chicken biscuit, grits and gravy biscuit.  The chicken has a nice crush and is a thick meaty breast. The grits are creamy and even better with cheese, they don't require butter. Finally, the biscuits are un-describably good; they seem to contain some herds. Great place to eat.

qBz6hzxZ-7RFKabka2vtEw.text: OK, I'm just going to put it out there.  There is no rabbit anywhere on the menu.  Thank goodness though that there is lots of other great food.    I had driven by this place several times recently and wondered how it was being received by the Plaza Midwood area.  When my daughter and her husband offered to take me there for my birthday lunch, I jumped at the chance to check it out.  You can't review The Peculiar Rabbit without talking about the parking situation, or more precisely, the lack of parking situation.  There is literally no place to park legally.  End of story.  If parking in a business lot and sneaking across the street creeps you out then eat somewhere else.  The venue is pretty cool, 3 levels and the layout is nice and cozy.  We opted to sit on the roof.  It was a nice day with a great view of uptown and the service was prompt.  For a starter we went with the mousse and pickles, which is duck liver mouse and house made pickles.  I love duck liver mousse so I was looking forward to this.  It was good but not great, nice and smooth and flavorful, very classic.  The pickles were ...ahem...."different".  Okra, radish, mango, jalapeno, and cauliflower, in a sweet, spicy, vinegary brine.    Between us we had 3 different entrees.  I had the braised brisket sandwich.  This was a solid hit.  A nice mound of tender flavorful, juicy brisket that paired beautifully with the caramelized onions and blue cheese, all sitting proudly on a soft but crispy hoagie roll.  French fries are hand cut and fried pretty well with tons of flavor.  My daughter, Melissa had the Banh Mi, a first for her and she is definitely a fan.  She said her life is now divided into two periods, before Banh Mi and after.  The Rabbit's version is pretty traditional with a very flavorful pork patty that Melissa said tasted like the inside of the best egg roll you have ever had.  I tasted it and have to agree.  With the pickled daikon, cilantro aioli, and jalapeno peppers it has that traditional bite of spiciness.  Chris had the lamb burger, big, fat, meaty and so juicy that the juice dripped onto the plate with each bite.  He said it was really good.  He ate it so fast I never got a chance to poach a bite.    If you're in the Plaza-Midwood area for lunch or dinner and don't mind circling the block a couple of times for a parking place, hop into the Peculiar Rabbit and give them a try.

AcT7fD8xvws2cChIVn6zAg.text: What?? 3 stars??? This is my first time here and I can't believe how amazing the food is!!     I had the peppercorn bistro steak and it was cooked and seasoned so perfectly that I would say it rivaled 5 star restaurants. Drunken mussels for an appetizer which were also "off the chain".  This place is not McDonalds cheap, but remember, the food is so perfectly prepared that it is worth far more than the menu price.   Don't forget what many other reviewers said... One of the best views of the city hands down, especially if you sit upstairs.   If you live in Charlotte or are visiting Charlotte, this place is worth a visit! YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of The Peculiar Rabbit - Charlotte, NC, United States. Photo of the bar area. Picture window behind bar overlooks the city of Charlotte skyline.

B0_rzhnw_IQh5gMdtZYrHA.text: P Rabs has really good drunk specials, most of the time.   The food is a bit overpriced for what you get there, but it was good. I'm personally was not a fan of the big gazebo top they added to the patio with the blue lighting. Yes I understand it's good for when it rains you can sit out there, but the lighting could be better in my opinion.  The one thing I hate is parking, you can't really park at Elizabeth Billards without the owner yelling at you when you don't go in or see a guy asking for money or you'll get towed.

NiSave_MXi5lYHmSvVKkTg.text: Somewhat surprised that this place doesn't have a higher rating. I've been here 3 or 4 times now, and each time I've had something different to eat and was equally blown away each time.  This is more of a restaurant than a bar, so I recommend you try their food out. Brunch items are great, as are their burgers, sandwiches, and traditional irish pub food. Do yourself a favor, get a side of the corn pudding. It's the only time I've ever gone to a restuarant and re-ordered something when I ran out.   Give it a shot, sit on the rooftop patio (it's covered so no need to fret over the weather), and enjoy yourself. Great food, plenty of local beers on tap, and typically good rotating drink specials. One day during the week I know they have a $10 burger and beer special...why wouldn't you try it out.  Happy to have this place in my backyard.

lygt0UqCjEJXpQzMmRRj5g.text: Great late brunch experience today! Ever meet a waiter that just rocks at their job? "Franch" went above and beyond for us today! Every order that came out was spot on, and he was great with summer drink recommendations. Been to peculiar plenty of times for the city view & good food, but this is the first time I've been impressed with the service! The Nola Benedict is my personal favorite brunch option.

w5_dG8H902L92S3Y79FBxA.text: Those wings...  Did not expect that from such a classy restaurant :)  They take pride in their fries, too!

gWVovtlePfe18tVjTSNtxw.text: Visit occurred in June of 2013, review is admittedly late.  Made reservations for this new (at the time) place in Charlotte. It was a really nice building, elegant decor. We were excited to try the Poutine, I thought it was good, but I have nothing to compare it to! I was not overly excited by the food, but we had a nice meal and left full. Pros- Wonderful ambiance Perfect for a date Unique menu options  Cons- Pricey considering the "normal" food quality No memory of the service quality, so they didn't do anything good or bad to catch my attention

TVYiJjbQDvvs63VMRh2OvQ.text: I heard mixed things about this restaurant so when a groupon came up for it I figured what a great way to try it.  I was VERY impressed!  I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner from start to finish.  As far as the service went, our waitress Elizabeth was excellent.  I am one to ask 20 questions about the food and she was patient and provided great explanations and recommendations on everything.  The service could not have been better.  As far what we tried, it was all great.  The beer selection was outstanding, I got to try the Stella Cidre which was really good.  We started with the bacon wrapped date appetizer.  Very flavorful.  My boyfriend had the fish & chips plate which was a HUGE amount of food for $13.  I had the mushroom risotto dish and it was amazing.  He kept eating my food.  It was risotto balls that are excellent with several different types of mushrooms.  The flavor was great.  It wasn't a healthy vegetarian dish but it was outstanding.  I think I will be craving this dish on occasion.  I don't know how we managed to eat dessert too, but the pumpkin cranberry bread pudding was really tasty.  I was pleasantly surprised after reading the mixed reviews.  I am so glad I gave this place a chance.  I will definitely be back!!!  OH yeah, I read a review about cheesy pop music playing and we did not experience that.  When we were there it was good music in the background with matching videos on some TVs and football on others.  There was some fun 80s music with some radiohead, modest mouse and music like that thrown in.

2NAHwvZppb_LizaXQUx71g.text: The food was great, but the service was below par.  Me and two other friends showed up to the Sunday brunch at like 12:30. We were expecting a wait, but the inside was completely empty on the first floor. The hostesses said that they were reserved for reservations. It made sense and the hostess said it would be a 25 min wait. We decided to wait.   Almost 1.5 hours past and our buzzer still hadn't gone off. People coming in after us were getting sat before us. It was becoming very frustrating. We finally complained to the hostesses and they said they forgot about us. It is very unlikely because we were standing in front of the hostess stand the whole time.   The server was lovely. She did a great job. The chef's can cook there. It is just sad that an experience that could have been very positive was very negative and it is all blamed on the hostesses (one of them being a manager in a purple dress).

lV1dzvlnoLOzQqKu9l9PSA.text: I've dined in an enjoyed the food/experience several times since moving to Charlotte, but was especially impressed by their excellent catering services. We had a volunteer event for my workplace in S. Charlotte a few weekends ago, and were impressed by the variety and value of PC's catering menu.  Booking with them was effortless on our end - they handled everything and provided a delicious dinner in a timely, professional manner. The food was DELICIOUS - our entire group was raving about the food for the rest of the weekend. We had chicken, meatballs, salad, rolls, green beans, the BEST mashed potatoes I've ever eaten, and cheesecake and fruit for dessert.   I would highly recommend their catering services to anyone and we'll certainly use them again.

lyGHFdnmrYDAIOzw4GsvJQ.text: This is such a cute little place but the food is HORRIBLE and the service is even worse. We went for brunch and had to wait an hour for a table that was open the whole time. My omelette was greasy,y friends salad had wilted brown leaves and the vehicles was cold- they the salad and it was still bad.. They told us they took it off the bill but they still charged for the added chicken.   Service was horrible. The tables around us We're left messy too while the hostess just looked at them.  I have asked many people and they have all said how bad this place is but the location and facility is nice.

jwOIB-7OPQTrOT_X0Sm-Kw.text: The Good: The FRIES...of course most people are going to be like really of all the food you could talk about you talk about the fries! YES! They are PHENOMENAL, I could honestly just go there and eat fries. I also had the tea brined wings...twice. The first time I went they were excellent, the second time I went, they were WAY too salty. :-(  The decor is pretty nice, and the waitstaff is friendly. Our service was fast and both times I've went was during lunch hours.  The Bad: Parking kind of sucks. I mean, if you aren't familiar with the area, you will be driving around looking for a spot. It could be worse but it definitely could be better. The good thing is you can park near CVS or the Junior League but sometime parking is packed there too. I also had the deviled eggs...meh, you can pass on those, I though they had a bad aftertaste.

Tli4RHDZlowxTdKX5zZPKg.text: First-time here for brunch with a large party. Prices and portions were good. Food was either lukewarm or cold for a few. They had to send back. Could work on spacing and service was decent for server who had no help except food runners. At least ours was seasoned well. We longed for refills, but didn't get too impatient.  Several of us enjoyed the mimosa and Bloody Mary specials. We were not offered scones. Maybe they didn't have enough?  May try again with a smaller party.

qgvKRvuCi3Oci2pntpjRPg.text: I want to give this a 3, I really, really do. After the Competition Dining experience a few months ago, my husband and I were wowed by the food from Brent Martin and vowed to check out Peculiar Rabbit. But, clearly, we weren't fast enough as Brent has moved on.   We ate here the other night. The food was ok. Really just plain ok. We went for dinner and were craving real "dinner" food, not pub fare so I guess we need to check it out when we are craving a burger and fries. Both of us had amazing salads but so-so entrees. Drinks were fine, nothing memorable.   The service was attentive but maybe a little over eager. I asked to have the salmon entree modified to be served gluten-free and, after a quick trip to the kitchen, I was told that wouldn't be a problem at all. However ... when I ordered dessert - a pudding, or so I thought, it might have been nice to have been given a heads up that what I ordered was totally not gluten-free. Most people are gluten-free for the entire meal, not just the main course. My mistake but still ... silly.

wb4w-FWfuSRcn3oAlN3p5w.text: The menu here is creative and VERY tasty!  For the level of gastronomic intelligence displayed in the dishes, the prices are downright bargain.  Service is okay...but not quite on a par with the food and ambience.  Overall, a wonderful place that I will definitely come back to when I'm in Charlotte.

uSJ1JK3hqeIcqCk6AE59_Q.text: Amazing Space...The building is amazing in location and layout.  Sadly a waste. Been here twice...everything I've had was either "meh" or just not good.  I've had Disco Fries, Lobster Mac and Cheese, Peculiar Rabbit Burger, Their deviled eggs, and their version of lamb shwarma.  Food is eh, Service is mediocre, Venue is great....but what are you to do.

Cr5d75mmB_uVe-iGOhHglA.text: Fun place to hangout. The open terrace is the best part. Drinks are good. However, their choice of starters is pretty limited. If you are looking for a place to just drink and have some fun , this is a good place to hangout. Not much of a place for foodies

KW1z1_5sDfy8PSrCYdJQ8w.text: Yikes! My beau and I came here today for an early brew and bite before a checkers game and we're more than disappointed. To start, I ordered an app with our meals and it wasn't served before our main dish. It was also cold. I got a salad and the arugula was warm and barely had any dressing :/. Our waitress did not check on us throughout the meal and then asked us if we could close our tab early because she was leaving her afternoon shift-- we had planned on more drinks after dinner. I watched as another couple had to flag someone down to get their check and then later watched a couple one sit down at a dirty table. This place has a great outdoor patio and view of the city. Perhaps they are understaffed, but I certainly hope management will step in soon. Overall not worth what we spent for such a poor experience.

zLZc8nv7ZP1VpSJc0tkZ_Q.text: After driving around for 20min trying to find a place without a line to have brunch, we decided to try the Peculiar Rabbit.  I have to say that the only thing that impressed me were the personalities of the servers, very out going and personable.  The food however, was nothing special and I'd opt to wait in a line at a different place before I came back.  The strawberry banana bread they brought for the table was a bit dry and def didnt taste like strawberries.  My buddy had about two bites of his runny grits and barely finished half of his pancakes while I attempted to eat a very underwhelming bahn mi sandwich (the bread swallowed the rest of the sandwich).  My beer was actually really good, but my friend's bloody was sub par and pretty weak.  Oh, and they have a ton of cameras throughout the restaurant and had all their feeds displayed on a TV above the hostess stand, almost like a weird reminder you are being watched.  Find another place to eat if you can.

ckwF6Hr_uYDAHKVi-3XTPA.text: Went for Saturday brunch on the rooftop. Great views of the city and our server Taylor was very nice and helpful. I had the chicken & waffles and friends had huevas rotos, all tasted delicious. Couple mix ups with the order but Taylor was quick to fix them, would definitely come back

qLvqyxgGzqTJcDY711LLUg.text: So we came here on Sunday morning and service has been great but we decided to come on Thursday for lunch and it was soo fun!!!! Taylor basically gave us our own Charlotte brewery tour at are table !!! I recommend coming here even when it's slow cause u will still have fun .

At8B7CsYCi_BjS0nJxMrHQ.text: We took our friends and my son for their birthday celebration. Taylor was our waiter. The food was incredible and the service was right at that same point. The pricd point was excellent. Definitely a place with no compromise on the quality of service. Highly Recommended. PS, don't forget the short rib grilled cheese sandwiches and the excellent habanero stout beer they have

ITUV-PHC9Za2_A9TjhlGpA.text: Came at 12:30 with my wife and walked up to the rooftop for a drink and asked the bartender if they were closing and we couldn't get a drink and he said no And then another employee came out and said "NO WE ARE CLOSED BYE" we felt very offended and never plan on coming back or referring anyone here

pp-lDRMEG6yJH4t3Z0Wd_A.text: I went for lunch the other day and had the reuben sandwich. It was awful. The bread was so soggy that when I picked up the sandwich it literally fell apart in my hands. I have been a couple of other times and the food has been bad every time. I want to like this place- the atmosphere is good, the waitress was nice (although she didn't seem to care about the disaster of a sandwich when I mentioned it), the fries were good, and they have a good beer selection, but the food has been consistently bad from my experience. It is kind of pricey for the food to be that bad. Peculiar Rabbit PLEASE fix your food- you can do better!

RJ8J_2MSLxh9-fzWfckDCA.text: I was amazed when we showed up on a Sunday and basically told by the woman up front who wasnt the host by the way that we should probably try another restaurant. I brought friends from out of town specifically to eat there and enjoy the view. With an empty restaurant we were told 35-40 min wait. When we asked why she explained that 3 very large parties had just been seated at the same time so we would have to wait. She then said the kitchen couldnt handle what they had. We offered to just sit and wait at a table and have some brunch cocktails but we were not allowed. She actually gave us the name of a restaurant we could walk to because "she just didnt know if the restaurant could handle any more people today". WTH. Who does that. We left. Our brunch at zada janes was amazing and the people were much nicer.

tYuS3nFy5zckkKm1NUw6IA.text: We came to The Peculiar Rabbit to celebrate a friend's birthday. The service was great. The staff was very attentive. I had the Kale Salad with Salmon and it was very good! I love goat cheese and there was plenty in the salad.  The view from the rooftop is great!

chvabYNrgsxt5CyHoFBRkQ.text: Had a 7:45 reservation. Got there and they said if we wanted the rooftop it would be about 30 minutes. No problem, we'll go have a drink and wait.  Almost an hour later when we inquired about our table they said the table was ready but the kitchen was running 20 min behind. Finally got seated. The waiter then also expressed that the kitchen was behind. Ordered 2 starters immediately since we were starving. It's was now after 9:00! Finally got our staters at around 9:35. Then proceeded with our meals. Mediocre at best. Definitely not worth the wait. I suggest stopping for a drink on the rooftop on your way to dinner somewhere else.

o1Rfef_86GnB6QkAzN9CVg.text: We've eaten here twice in the last 3 months. First time for lunch was great!  My husband had their version of Shepherds pie and he gave it great reviews! It wasn't the traditional pie he grew up eating in the UK.   Our second visit we ate around 10pm at night, I had the chicken and waffles and my husband a burger.  Chicken was over cooked/dry with a really dark almost burnt skin, and the waffle cold.  Our waiter was indifferent to our complaint about the food. The food is inconsistent,better places in the neighborhood to try.

Dda28gkvzhm5oBixS5X_SA.text: We were so excited to try this place out for our anniversary,  only to be disappointed and ready to go after 20 minutes!  Service was okay, Food was okay,  kind of bland and the music was too loud to hear ourselves talk. Probably a first and last for us!

jLcziuHE3ZNzl2kz7z0zdw.text: Very nicely renovated building and all of the staff were very friendly and attentive.   The food, while okay, is vastly overpriced for what it is.   Had the chicken and waffles, and the fish and chips. Both were just okay.   The deviled eggs appetizer was very good.

x-ZC8YvXc16mWueW0-8f7w.text: Worst service in Midwood!!  It was like pulling teeth to get anything from the staff.  No silverware, no plates, and waiting 20 minutes for a drink refill.  Sad because the location is great and food was good.  They somehow forgot they work in the service industry!!!

JZzcWwnhltaApzGzLwGsOA.text: Ate here on a Sunday night and it must not have been a great night in the kitchen. I ordered the chicken and waffles which turned out to be completely unseasoned and bland. Out of a party of 6, a few were satisfied with their meals, the rest were disappointed. It food's not bad, but it's not great either. Our waitress was great, as was the place's music video channel.

SmO3YCJcTMVS_Q34ujQIoQ.text: Overpriced, complicated, hipster food. They try to take standard american bar food, fancy it up a bit, then slap a $$ price tag on it. Yes, the view is amazing; and yes, they've got a solid beer selection, but that's it as far as I'm concerned. After giving the place several tries, I would say from now on I'd stop by for drinks only.

sWCmsArWyj6kFKjtG6D77g.text: Just had a great meal tonight!!! Fri night special was creole rubbed salmon with purple potatoes   Full of flavor!!! Best salmon I have had!!!

jX3mQ67R3Z3lPa97E56uEQ.text: Tried it out 4 times...0 for 4.Bad food, bad service, bad drinks. Except for the view, this place is awful.

rqyMC722kTLE1Q-l5WzqwA.text: Great atmosphere and fast service! Just wish they would serve had a better late night menu!

SVjjHJP7_4N2m2vYCBUDSw.text: Atmosphere is excellent.  Location is great.  Rooftop patio is amazing.  Food is mediocre at best.

bYR-TnQlv24_V8iHDEbNNQ.text: Came here awhile back for a friends birthday and our whole experience was horrible. Staff made us feel uncomfortable and the food wasn't very good. Won't be coming back here.

ziZKbvrflPb8DBUoHz_SwA.text: I enjoyed our Sunday brunch at the Peculiar Rabbit! My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles which was so yummy I stole most it! I had the hash which was delicious but a little spicy to eat that early. We will definitely be returning to dine on their amazing rooftop. The views of the skyline inside were amazing, so I can only imagine how awesome they are from their rooftop!
